title: Columbia Women's Benton Springs Full Zip
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit, warm but not bulky', 'author': 'R A A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice jacket , perfect for running errands in winter or chilly nights', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars this brand seems to be quite good', 'author': 'Gail Burgio', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'very comfortable & fits well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thick, Comfortable, and Warm', 'author': 'Shauna Davis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The product was very high quality. It has kept me warm in 30-40 degree weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice and comfortable but cheap zipper', 'author': 'dusty0778', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I received this jacket today. I ordered a 2X and it fits as I hoped it would. Just roomy enough. I\'m usually a 1X so I would say to order up one size. The sleeves are a little long but that\'s better than too short. This jacket was not too short in the body length as some people stated. I\'m only 5\' 4" and it\'s a perfect length on me. My only two complaints are the color. I ordered black. It looks very black in the photo but it\'s not a true black. It\'s more of a charcoal gray/slight navy. It doesn\'t bother me but if you are hoping for black, this is not. And the zipper. It\'s very cheap. I could not get it zipped up. I was afraid the little bottom piece would pull away from the fabric. I was very gentle with it but could not get it zipped up while I was wearing it. I had to take it off and lay it face up on my bed and work with it. I finally got it to zip and then zipped it up and down a million times to "break it in" but still could not get it re-zipped once I unzipped it again. Bad quality zipper which surprises me coming from a Columbia jacket. Other than these 3 things, it\'s a nice jacket. The main problem I see is the zipper.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jacket', 'author': 'Leanne B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great jacket. It keeps me so warm! Too warm at times! It‚Äôs a bit loose around my chest and hips which is what I like the sleeve length is perfect and the jacket length is perfect too!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The sweater runs small', 'author': 'Roney', 'rating': 3, 'content': "If you're a bigger gal or person get the 2x, the large fits like a small", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Thinner than expected!!!', 'author': 'Juanita Davis', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The jacket was much thinner than I expected and other jackets of the same brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Ripped arm seam', 'author': 'Lace S', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love my new Jacket. title: Columbia Men's Ascender Softshell Front-zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Giftable', 'author': 'Valitia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift. It fit perfectly, hangs nicely, plenty of pockets, comfortable and looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice for a variety of conditions', 'author': 'Railgee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ended up purchasing two of these jackets in black. One for working in the yard and out in the public, and second I have set aside for more dressy occasions. I was impressed with the fit, the overall quality of the jacket for the price, its lightness and thinness, and its use in a range of temperatures and conditions. I have used it for light winds and 60 degrees, and heavy winds in the high 20s. I have worn it both for shoveling snow and for attending a play. In all extremes, it performed perfectly. Both the outside of the jacket and inside liner dries quickly. In my opinion, this jacket is an exceptional value for the price. I have much more expensive jackets with big outdoor names, but this one has become my go to choice for all but the most extreme conditions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice jacket, has become my favorite', 'author': 'GVLabs49', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a really nice light to mid-weight jacket and the bonus is, it looks really good. I haven't played golf in it yet, or worn it in the rain, but I will update when I do. Nice material is comfortable and feels very well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket with a few minor issues', 'author': 'B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really like this jacket. The weight is great for anything from cool spring/fall days all the way down to freezing temps. It blocks wind well and does an admirable of keeping me dry while I walk across a rainy parking lot. The classic simple style makes it easy to wear with just about anything.There are a couple of minor things that would make it even better. The sleeves are fleece-lined, which makes for a warm feel but makes it a bit more difficult to pull it off if I'm wearing long sleeves, especially if I'm wearing a sweater. The other thing I'm not crazy about is that the collar will NEVER lie flat. One side always always always sticks up. It's not unique to this jacket, nearly every soft shell I've ever owned has had this problem. I suppose it's handy if you actually zip it up all the way, but who does that?I still wear it a lot. It's my go-to jacket if it's above 25F outside.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, runs a bit larger than expected but that's okay", 'author': 'Robert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great quality you would expect from the Columbia brand. Ran a tiny bit longer in the arms that I expected, but that's good for keeping my hands warm. Proper color quality, Nice and thick, but still lightweight. Not not wrinkly. Good size pockets. Very durable, would definitely last multiple years, maybe even decades.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket, and it came with a surprise!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Arrived on-time, is well-made, and fits just right. BUT...when i was trying it on and checking the pockets I found a wadded up face mask and a crumpled post-it note. Gross. Into the washer it goes.That aside, it's a nice jacket and worth the money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Colombia Jacket', 'author': 'T L Dyer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this jacket for my husband to take on a cruise. It was lightweight and easy to pack. My husband loved it. He is looking to purchase an extra one. Would highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive Comfort', 'author': 'Billy A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It surprised me how well it repelled water and blocked wind. I also bought it for a few other family members for gifts. They all rave about it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars the coverage', 'author': 'linda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Jacket fits very well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket bad zipper', 'author': 'John Davis', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love the jacket,but the zipper keeps coming loose at the bottom,and is very hard to unzip and redo the zipper', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. This shoe was thoughtfully designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!', 'author': 'monica cerda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wear heeled leather boots as my day to day fashion, I‚Äôve never been a sneaker person and so after complaining to a friend about hiking sneakers I purchased hurting the top of my foot after an hour of wear, they suggested I try hiking boots instead. I felt like a fool for never connecting the dots. Lol.Well‚Ä¶I found these, loved the color options and the reviews seemed pretty legit! I‚Äôve worn them twice so far while running errands to see how they feel and I have to say, no discomfort and so lightweight!!Now down to sizing: With stylish boots, I‚Äôm typically a size 8, and I did order an 8 initially, however with a thin sock, they felt pretty snug and I thought maybe they might start to bother my toes since there‚Äôs more cushion that what I‚Äôm used to and what if I want to wear thick socks?For me that was enough to go up to an 8.5 juuuust to be on the safe side and because‚Ä¶why not find out? $75 is still $75.So glad I did! They feel roomier yet still a great fit, so if you‚Äôre in limbo, I‚Äôd say size up .5 if you want to be able to throw these on without switching your socks. üòâHappy I got these and I‚Äôm looking forward being more active!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Time WAS a Charm! Only took 5 tries to find Prince Charming's Boot!", 'author': 'FLGulfGrnEz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read the reviews wherever I could find them. I had become very confused over the sizing. I have a hard enough time getting the right size without this much of a difference thrown at me too!I was in love @first glance, beautiful dark gray with aqua strings. Ordered size 7 as suggested though I wear a size 6.5 or 6. Feet measures a size 5-5.5, L=8.5" R=8.7". There lies the rub, right foot doesn\'t fit sizes same as left one by a fraction so hit or miss. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Zippers are the bomb for higher topped boots/shoes especially with fat feet, high instep, opens the slimmer top for feet to get to sole.Back to the size sessions; First was great price on 7\'s, looked order back up and saw where I had ordered from the warehouse! Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. Still have plenty of room through toe bed area but TOO PRETTY, COMFY & TIRED to second guess anymore, size 6 it is!Merry Christmas Folks! Good Luck with your sizing, hope this finally solves some problems??? It was the socks that made all the difference which I kept hearing in almost every review but didn\'t hear the bell in head go off... All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! Uh Oh, gotta get lined pants, knit cap, goggles, warmer gloves, down filled vest... Merry Christmas to me.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality but rubbed on my ankle', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The shoe was nicely made and looked to be good quality. When I first tried them on , they were comfortable and looked cute. I walked around in them for about an hour when I started to feel rubbing on my right ankle in the back. I needed these for a long hike and knew they were not going to work for me. I think these would be a great shoe for shorter walks or to wear around the yard. I did size up half a size because I would be wearing heavier socks and they fit great. Just not for a long hike that I was planning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Hiking Shoes', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These shoes rock!! I wore these on a trip to Iceland and they kept my feet warm and dry. We made several long hikes through various terrains (mountain, river, gravel, mud) and they didn‚Äôt hurt my feet or feel too heavy. They are perfectly light weight and sturdy, provide ankle support and traction. These are my go to shoes for hikes now and they have held up well for at least the last year. Definitely worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Right Out of the Box', 'author': 'Michele Kohan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with these boots. They were super comfortable right out of the box and I wore them for three straight hours immediately upon putting them on. I love the classic look of these boots and can't wait to hike in them! I looked at a few different colors that were available in my size (11 women), and initially chose the classic tan and red because of the lower price; but I found I really love the color and am glad I chose thetah. They remind me of hiking boots I used to have when I lived back in Pennsylvania growing up.This new pair of Columbia boots are true hiking boots, with cushion all around the ankle and tongue, a flexible thick sole and also appear to be waterproof by design, although haven't tested that yet.The down side is the boots will be too hot to wear in the summer here in Florida, but are working great for the unexpected cold snap right now. They will come in handy for trips out of state in my camper. A+ boots!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and Cute', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I picked these based on great reviews and was not disappointed. I wear a women‚Äôs 10 in non-athletic shoes and a 10.5 wide in athletic shoes. Amazon recommended a 10, and I‚Äôm glad I got the 10.5 wide. I can lace them tight for a nice fit, and they don‚Äôt press on my bunion.Pros- Not heavy, but feel sturdy enough for rough terrain, snow and ice- Beautiful color and red accents- Don‚Äôt make my big ole feet look too big- Comfortable from the minute I put them onCon- Insole is glued down tightly and not removable. All shoe manufacturers should make their insoles removable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Columbia hiking boots', 'author': 'Deborah Kretsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with my purchases. I ordered a brand new pair and also went and bought the warehouse inspected used one on additional discount. The used pair is in perfect condition, not a mark or sign of wear anywhere on them. They‚Äôre just like the brand new pair. Perfect!I wear orthotics in my shoes, I tried them both with and without them to see how they feel. I will of course wear them with the orthotics otherwise my plantar fasciitis will get inflamed. I want to wear one pair at work which is standing on my feet my entire shift on cement floors and the other for daily use or camping etc. I will also be spraying a treatment on them for additional protection against the elements.I do have wide feet. One being bigger and slightly wider than the other as well. I always wore a 6.5 shoe, but I guess my feet spread out over time so now I wear 7.5-8 shoes/boots. I went with the 7.5 wide on these and they feel just fine. If I got 8s I think they‚Äôd have been too long and I‚Äôd be tripping on my own feet. Definitely glad I got the wides they would have been too narrow if I got the regular ones. The orthotics raise my foot in the shoe so I have to loosen the laces a lot to accommodate and this is the first time I‚Äôve had extra length on the laces to tie rather than a teeny amount to tie my shoes!For today I am wearing these around the house to break them in. They feel fine out of the box but I tend to get foot fatigue easily due to my foot condition so I need to break them in. My baby toes always get the brunt of the pain when wearing shoes and especially new shoes. I haven‚Äôt felt that pain right away like I normally would. So that‚Äôs a plus for comfort!!So far I love these and so glad I bought both pairs! I love the color and the red laces. They remind me of the old hiking boots I used to see growing up, only a more comfortable updated version! The other colors look cute in the pics but I feel limited to what I can wear them with so I feel these are more neutral to the colors I tend to wear. Hopefully these last a long time. I do own other Columbia products and am usually pleased with their products, this is the first time purchasing footwear.Thank you!Edit I‚Äôve been wearing these to work using my orthotics, standing on my feet on cement floor. No discomfort at all, they have been very comfortable! So happy with these boots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In love!', 'author': 'Desiree Mangan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I asked for these as a Christmas present and boy I am so happy I did! I usually wear an 8 however I do have wider feet and knew I was planning on wearing thicker socks so I asked for an 8 wide. I unfortunately have not had the chance to wear these while actually hiking, however I did get to wear them during the recent snow storm. I was waiting for a pair of snow boots that I ordered to come in which they didn‚Äôt but I knew that these were thick and waterproof so I figured why not wear them while shoveling. Clearly they would be much better at keeping my feet warm and dry compared to my Ugg boots. Which it is no surprise that they actually did! My feet were BONE DRY. I was out there for over an hour walking through nearly knee high snow, both shoveling/clearing off cars in my drive way. I love these shoes. Not only this but I had to go to work and play outside in the snow with my preschool kids and same thing, nice and dry. I also wore them all day, 8-5, and my feet feel great! Though I haven‚Äôt used them for what I actually asked for them for, I can tell they will perform just as well as they have already! So buy them you won‚Äôt regret it:)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Glennaker Rain Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable Protection and Style', 'author': 'Secret Angel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently gifted my dad the Columbia Men's Glennaker Rain Jacket, and I am thrilled to give it a well-deserved 5-star rating. This rain jacket combines reliable protection, stylish design, and exceptional quality, making it the perfect choice for outdoor enthusiasts and everyday wear.One of the standout features of the Columbia Men's Glennaker Rain Jacket is its reliable waterproof and wind-resistant capabilities. The jacket's advanced Omni-Tech technology ensures that my dad stays dry and comfortable, even during heavy rain showers. The fully seam-sealed construction and water-repellent fabric provide excellent protection against the elements, allowing him to enjoy outdoor activities without worry.The versatility of this rain jacket is impressive. It is lightweight and packable, making it easy to carry and convenient for travel. title: Men's Full-Zip Fleece Jacket (Available in Big & Tall)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality, look for it on sale', 'author': 'John', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Fit: I am 6ft,165lb with broad shoulders, long arms and no gut. I wear a size MEDIUM like a sweater with only a Tshirt underneath. In MEDIUM it fits me with a trim fit and the sleeves are the right length for me. It fits me perfectly. To wear this as a jacket over thicker base layers I might need a size larger. The sleeves are attached at a sensible angle so it is possible to raise the arms freely and move freely, which is a very welcome feature, thank you Amazon!The Material / Stretch: I have three colors: the red buffalo plaid, charcoal heather and navy blue. The charcoal heather and navy blue are a traditional fleece that has some normal stretch to it but is not a "stretch" fabric. The red plaid feels more like a felt that doesn\'t stretch very much. I like them all but the red plaid is a bit tight in the elbows at first but does eventually stretch to fit.Warmth: It is a mid-weight fleece like advertised. I wear it indoors like a sweater.Pockets: The inner wall of the pockets are constructed of the same fleece as the jacket, so that creates two layers of fleece in those areas, making the jacket feel thicker in that area but not bulky. I would prefer pockets made of a thinner mesh or fabric but that isn\'t a big issue. The extra fabric adds some warmth that some people will prefer. Pockets are deep and have zippers so are both warm and secure.I\'ve had these jackets for about 6 weeks and wear them frequently, sometimes with a vest over the top for additional warmth when needed. This is a nice item, no complaints so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, Thick Fleece', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband loves this jacket! He tried it on when it arrived, and kept it on the rest of the day. I think this jacket runs slightly big -- my husband is 6 ft 2 inches, around 255 lbs, and the XL fits well. We also ordered the 2XL, but the arms were really baggy, and it was somewhat big overall. The weight is a heavier fleece, which for the price is great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfort is King', 'author': 'Wags', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have had an older C9 (Champion) fleece for years and wear it whilst doing chores-construction-insulation-painting-caulking...etc. That now is falling apart and looks like an artist's studio floor.Time for a new fleece of some sort. So, with the awesome price, I tried the Amazon fleece. My old one was 1/4 zip and that was fine. Full zip? Good for us older people who don't want to mess up our hair. Just easier to manage. Star #1.It is a pleasant color and very nice fleece fabric. Star #2It has 2 side pockets that zip. Star #3The zipper is flawless and the comfort, fit and stretchiness makes it like a second skin. Star #4There are compartments inside where the pockets attach to the side seam. If this was sewn all the way down to the waist, it would be an inside pocket and a place to stash my cell phone. It is left open and I may just sew it closed myself but this is the minus 1 Star for this garment. It should have a cell phone pocket somewhere.I guess if it was designed that way, it would cost 2-3 times more.Size wise- I am wearing medium and I like it. A little snug but this is my preference. Not binding.I am 5ft 9in and weigh 170lbs. It fits as expected.Good quality. Good Value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great General Light Fleece', 'author': 'J A', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's a great basic fleece for a great price. I always prefer super reasonable priced clothing because I'm very hard on my clothes, especially my light jackets which I historically am a professional at getting caught on things causing tears or punctures. While I haven't had that issue yet, I won't cry when it does happen because the cost is super reasonable. It is soft, comfy and warm without being too hot and works as a good under layer if it is very, very cold. When that happens, it's collar lip is super handy at providing protection for the neck. All in all, great fleece.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A great basic', 'author': 'Earthling', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The proportions fit well and it has nice pockets. The fleece is medium weight. It's not the very beefy top quality fleece of name brands, but very serviceable and warm enough. Very low price and a great buy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased with this warm and soft shirt-like fleece', 'author': 'LL in AK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this today and it is so soft and warm. It is very cold here in Alaska right now so I put it on immediately and have been wearing it around as an over-shirt, like a coat. It keeps me quite warm and toasty when I go out to run errands at 5 below zero. and yet I am still comfortable snuggled up on my bed. I love it so far. It seems very well made. Not at all an inferior brand to the more expensive brands like Columbia. It is well-made and thick. I am very pleased and will be ordering more of these fleeces in the future.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice', 'author': 'G.C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Everyone is different.I just happened to love it. Not! So much because it was on sale,but rather because it fits like a glove.It really does. And if by chance, it may shrink due to the dryer etc., not to worry because you could always bring it back to its original size. I was taught many years ago, that if, and when, any of your garments shrink due to the dryer, hot water üí¶ etc., you can always bring it back to its normal size by rewashing it in cold water üí¶ üåä using Downey fabric softener. Do not use a generic brand. What this does is, it relaxes and extends the fibers allowing it to return back to its normal size. Nor do you want to put it back in the dryer (you must air dry it) or else you'll be back to square one. Don't tell anyone; let it be your little secret.besides,the color is nice and bold. One thing that I like is, that it's a very lightweight. I chose a lightweight because I have others that are medium weight, and another that is a heavyweight.But what I like the most is, that it also has zipperd pockets that zip up, rather than zip down. And the reason why I like zipper pockets is, because you can rest assured that you won't lose your keys or other belongings if you zip it up versus zipping it down. Unlike other brands with no zippers where the pockets are very shallow and not that deep and you may lose whatever by accident. I give it five stars. I'm sure you'll like it too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Men‚Äôs full zip-up', 'author': 'Lynnie Jean', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this item for myself and the fit is perfect! Wanted a couple other colors, but they sold out, so thought I would try one in the men‚Äôs in a size smaller. Purchased only one because I wanted to see the difference in the fit. title: Men's Packable Lightweight Water-Resistant Puffer Jacket (Available in Big & Tall)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Light and warm', 'author': 'Angela A. Sanyal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great coat. Seems light. The fit was perfect. Can easily be packed for a trip. Great value for a good jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good jacket !', 'author': 'Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The jacket is very nice and it fits perfectly and is very comfortable and warm.very light weight you don‚Äôt know that you have it on but it keeps you warm just like a heavy jacket. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good lightweight jacket and that will help you warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good cheaper alternative but not for heavy use', 'author': 'Avant', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought for the purpose of travel and outdoor use in those times where temps can change drastically from 70F in the morning down to 40F at night.I got this on sale for $20 which was a far cry from $60-120 asking price of other packable down jackets. For the price, it's much warmer than I thought and has well thought out features. So far I've worn this in 42F weather, coldest and just going on a walk I was breaking a bit of a sweat with it half zipped. It has 2 exterior pockets and 2 internal pockets. Personally I wouldn't put too much in these, as I can really feel the thing stretch and drag down. Just gloves, hat, phone etc. should be fine, nothing like a can of soda or something. Water resistance is what you expect for thin nylon stuff, a few drops is fine, actual rain, get an umbrella or an actual waterproof layer. It's also pretty windproof, took it out in the aftermath of a pseudo hurricane and didn't feel the wind.It packs down pretty well into a 6 inch long 3 inch or so bundle but nothing like the high tech hiking stuff, I just wish there was a shorter loop so I can carabiner it to my pack easier but seems like it was intended to be carried like an umbrella. Also wish it packed into itself rather than have a bag which may get lost one day. The material imo isn't very durable, I have no rips yet, but I'm not confident and think if I rub on something the wrong way it's going to tear. The stitching seems fine so far, and doesn't seem to be leaking filler yet.Sizing wise, I have a 45 chest and usually wear XL, but this is kinda big even for an XL, maybe because they were antiicpating you layer something like a thick sweater underneath. It is also a bit long for my torso, about 2-3 inches more than I need to sit at my waist. I have 23 sleeves and that fits perfect.I don't expect this to last a long time, but it's useful for the time I'll have it.12/28 edit:So I just used this exactly for what I bought it for because of the huge winter storm that swept across the north and east coast US. Temps went from nearly 60 degrees in daytime all the way down to 23 by late afternooon with extremely high winds that were throwing doors around and knocked some street signs off their mounts, and it was perfect. I just had a t-shirt underneath and on top of this was a gymax waterproof windproof jacket. Again my only complain might be if the material doesn't last and it's a bit long.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Survived European Backpack Trip', 'author': 'Jakob Banks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this to take on a trip through the UK, France, and Italy. The jacket I purchased is yellow. I wanted something that would be adequately warm on a cool spring day so I wouldn‚Äôt have to bring another sweatshirt or have to pack long sleeve shirts. I also wanted something that folded up very small as I was only taking a backpack for 10 days. This jacket fit the bill perfectly. It comes with a bag which will compress the jacket down to about the size of a smaller shoe, but the way I found best to pack it was to fold it into quarters, flat, and put it on top of my clothes in my backpack. The jacket would compress almost completely flat, adding almost no bulk to my bag. It was like a magic trick how small it became. When I wanted to have it handy, but did not want to carry it, I would stick it through the handle of my backpack, pulling it halfway through, and it would stay there securely when I put my bag into overhead luggage storage on the Italo and Eurostar, making to easy to grab if I became cold. There were some cold and very windy evenings and nights when we were in London and Paris (50 degrees F, with a strong breeze coming off the Thames and Seine) and this jacket kept me warm with just a t-shirt on underneath. I encountered a brief rain shower on the Path of the Gods and stayed dry and the jacket dried pretty quickly. I can‚Äôt speak to how well it would perform in a heavy downpour as that was the only rain I experienced during my trip. Overall, this jacket was perfect for me and at the price point, I was not going to be upset if it got lost, stolen, or ruined. After being stuffed in my bag over and over and shoved into overhead storage, the jacket still looks brand new. Not to mention it looked stylish in all of the photos my wife and I took! I am 6‚Äô6‚Äù and weigh about 190lbs and I bought a large. It fit well without a lot of extra bulk and the sleeves were long enough for my wingspan. 10/10, would recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Philmont Approved!!!!', 'author': 'Shawshank', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased two of these jackets as a lightweight backpackable jacket for our 12-day Philmon trek in the Sangre Cristo mountains of Northern New Mexico. During our trek, we had 2.5 days of rain in altitudes over 9,000 feet. The lowest temps were mid to high 40\'s, windy and wet! These jackets did an outstanding job of keeping us both dry and warm. In fact, during one particularly heavy rain, I discovered my old Army ACU wet weather top was in fact no longer waterproof. I pulled off the top and this jacket which I had underneath my wet weather top was soaked in the front, back, and arms. However that moisture/wetness never touched my skin. This jacket also served as part of my pillow setup and in spite of the exterior being wet, and in the absence of NNM\'s low humidity, the jacket dried quickly, and I was able to use it as my pillow. I would without hesitation recommend, and purchase these jackets again. When I say "Philmont Approved", just know that means more than someone\'s opinion after taking it out of the package and posing in front of a mirror. To recap the benefits:1) Lightweight: The jacket packs easily into the included bag and was attached to a carabiner on the outside of my backpack. It stayed secure through bushwhacking trails, hiking through trees that tried to grab everything, and scaling up and down some steep mountainsides. My son kept his bag attached to the loop in the jacket and that worked very well for him.2) Water resistant: We both wore these during a few days of sprinkling rain and 2.5 days of legit rain- rain. Water never breached the inside of the jacket and made contact with our skin. That is a win!3) Warm: This jacket kept us warm in the very cool mountain air of Northern New Mexico, both dry and wet weather. I\'m not going to tell you that this jacket will keep you warm in freezing temps because we did not encounter that kind of weather. But I will tell you that when it was in the mid 40\'s and my sleeping bag zipper was broken, and I was quite cold, I put this jacket on (and lost part of my pillow) but was warm and toasty!4) Quality: The zippers work great. Zippered external pockets were a huge plus to reduce the chance of important things (like snacks or other small doodads that I used) from falling out and being lost. The deep interior pockets were great for holding my phone (for pictures). The only issue I had was that I tore the loop out. It was dark and I was having a hard time getting the bag unknotted and broke the loop by force. It wasn\'t a failure on the jacket - it was a failure on my patience!5) Dries quickly: After it got wet underneath my "notta wet weather top" it dried quickly and was able to fulfill it\'s purpose as part of my pillow setup.Summary: This is a solid choice for a lightweight outer shell for cooler weather, and will work even if there is some rain in the forecast. It is lightweight and breathable enough to work as a sub-layer if you have a lightweight rain jacket to help break the wind. I did not notice the wind getting through this jacket, so I believe it serves well in that regard. Also, if it survived my teenage Scout and all his rambunctious rock climbing and goofing around, then it should serve you well. I purchased the Dark Olive Green because it\'s similar to the Ranger Green clothes I wear for Boy Scouts, and my son purchased the Light Brown because he likes that color. Both colors look good. The Light Brown is similar to Coyote Brown, but a little darker. The OG version was also cheaper at the time of purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Rugged, Comfortable, and Warm.', 'author': 'Russell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Works very well for the price and thickness, it's quite roomy. I'm regularly outside for short times in 0 to -20 and it holds heat in well by itself. A shell style jacket would be a nice compliment for prolonged exposure to colder temperatures and wind.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality and Price!', 'author': 'M G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a warm lightweight pack able jacket suitable for travel and outdoor activities. Exceptional value for a great fitting jacket. Medium fit trim 5‚Äô8‚Äù .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Fair deal', 'author': 'tigerace', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Weight and Comfort (5/5): As advertised, this puffer jacket is incredibly lightweight, making it perfect for transitional weather. It's comfortable to wear, and the lack of bulkiness allows for easy layering, which is a big plus.Warmth (4/5): Given its featherweight construction, I was pleasantly surprised by its ability to provide adequate warmth. It's great for chilly mornings and cool evenings, but I wouldn't rely on it for extreme cold conditions.Packability 4/5): This jacket's packability is a standout feature. It folds into a compact size, making it ideal for travel or as a backup jacket that you can easily stow away when not needed.Versatile Design (2/5): The jacket's simple, minimalist design makes it versatile. It pairs well with various outfits, from casual to semi-formal, adding a touch of style to any ensemble.Cons:Durability (4/5): While the lightweight design is advantageous for comfort, it does seem to compromise the jacket's durability. The fabric feels somewhat delicate, and I've noticed a few loose threads after only a short period of use.Limited Cold Protection (4/5): Despite its decent warmth, this puffer is not suitable for harsh winter conditions. It's best suited for milder weather or as a mid-layer during colder months.Price (3/5): The price is moderate, but considering the concerns about durability, some might find it a bit steep for what it offers. There are more robust options available at a similar price point.Conclusion:In conclusion, the lightweight puffer jacket I purchased offers a mix of positives and negatives. Its featherweight design, comfort, warmth for moderate weather, and packability are definite highlights. However, concerns about durability and limited suitability for extremely cold weather may be drawbacks for some users. If you're looking for a versatile, lightweight jacket primarily for transitional seasons and are willing to handle it with care, this option might suit your needs. Nonetheless, if durability and cold-weather protection are top priorities, you may want to explore other options at a similar price range.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My homeless shelter asked for help - this is what I sent!', 'author': 'Review', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Montana has been so frigid this year, it was -40 around Christmas. title: Men's Relaxed Fit Washed Duck Sherpa-Lined Utility Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort, reliability, and sizing.', 'author': 'Diego Schelling', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 5‚Äô9 (175cm) and weigh around 175 - 180 lbs (79 - 81 kilos) and purchased the Large. Fits me like a charm, no regrets. Great quality. Very comfortable. Looks great. But most importantly it kept me warm and cozy under super cold weather. The coldest it got while I wore it was around 10 - 20 degrees F* (-12c to -6c) and it did its job perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A nearly perfect work jacket.', 'author': 'Bill L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been a Carhartt fan for years, and I purchased the Utility Jacket to replace my 26 year old Carhartt chore coat.What do I like about this jacket: Everything.The Fit: I am 5ft 11in tall, 185lbs, Medium build, so I ordered a Large, and the fit is perfect from the sleeve length to the shoulders. Because the jacket is gusseted, it allows for full range of motion even with the jacket fully zipped and buttoned. The jacket has an adjustable waste cord, which I have not had to touch. Another nice feature is the jacket length, which falls at pocket level on a pair of jeans. The jacket is slightly longer in the back than in the front, which keeps it from riding up.Storage: The jacket has six pockets. Two front "hand" pockets, two buttoned breast pockets, an additional front left breast pocket with a center Velcro closure, which makes for a handy place to hold pencils, and an interior zip pocket on the left, which I use to keep my wallet secure. Pocket depth has not been an issue, and I keep an IPhone 13 in the front hand pocket with no issues.Warmth: The jacket is Sherpa lined. I\'ve worn it hours in 25-32 degree temps and was comfortable with just a T-shirt under a Henley shirt. I would say that it would be comfortable to work in from 20-50 degrees. The zipper (right zipper) also has a button cover, making it that much more air tight. The sleeves are cuffed, though they don\'t appear to be at a glance. These cuffs really help with keeping cold air from seeping into the arms, especially if you\'re like me and you like to wear a thinner undershirt while working. There is a Sherpa-lined attached hood as well.Construction: This jacket feels heavy duty. The zipper is beefy, the buttons solid, and the overall construction is solid. I feel like I can use and abuse this jacket without destroying it. The duck outer lining is not soft cotton, but it moves, and feels strong without being stiff.Appearance: This is not a bad looking jacket and I might even call it stylish. I would feel fine wearing this while out and about.Demerits. I give this jacket one demerit, and it is a very minor demerit, and that is the attached hood. I like the hood, I like how it lays on the back when not in use without feeling bulky, I just wish that it could be removed. This is a very minor quibble, however.Overall I highly recommend this jacket if you are in the market for warm, heavy duty, and practical work wear. It is not inexpensive, but I feel it is worth every penny. In fact, I would go as far to say that even if you aren\'t in the market for a work jacket, but only warm jacket that can take a beating, then this jacket is worth considering. It is warm, comfortable, practical, and not bad looking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and warm', 'author': 'rhonda morin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband loves his new jacket! It fits perfectly and is super comfortable. The quality is excellent and exactly what one expects from Carhartt. It's stylish enough to wear out n about too. He thinks I paid way more than I did for it. Del Vecchio', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This jacket is absolutely perfect for FALL WEATHER!!! It‚Äôs not too heavy, not too long the color is great‚Ä¶it doesn‚Äôt look like a work coat. It IS a good sturdy jacket, but if it is cold out, and the wind kicks up...you WILL feel that cold, but you'll also warm back up again immediately. A MUCH BETTER VALUE would be the ROTHCO FIELD JACKET...WITH THE LINER...TALK ABOUT A WARM JACKET...AND IT DOES PROTECT YOU FROM THE RAIN, BUT IT DOESN'T HAVE A HOOD...BUT...YOU CAN PROBABLY BUY ONE.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'Rick Sanchez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Badass Carhartt jacket - warm and fits well, plenty of pockets, looks great, and is durable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket, true to size', 'author': 'S-Marie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is exactly as described, true to size and very warm. Amazing quality and looks very nice', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value and takes wax well', 'author': 'Missy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this to make my own waxed jacket for colder weather that will repel water well. The commercial ones range from $150 for very light weight ones to $400+ for heavier duty ones. I like the Levi brand and have had good luck with their construction quality in pants before, and their design looks great to me with the Sherpa lining and detachable hood.I‚Äôm 6‚Äô1‚Äù 275 lbs with longer arms & torso that usual for my height. Fit is an issue for me with sleeves coming up short unless I oversized and drown in coats or jackets. The xxl tall option online fits perfectly for an overcoat in high 20‚Äôs to low 40‚Äôs weather with normal layers underneath. It is too warm for me in the high 40‚Äôs or above.The zipper quality feels good for the jacket and the removeable hood inserts. The hood insert is the same gauge zipper as the jacket, but the attachment zipper side is different. You won‚Äôt be able to zip on some other shell lining or fleece into that as I thought I could from stock photos.I applied wax and melted it in with a heat gun. Anything but pure cotton canvas could melt or burn from that, so I was worried about the polyester lining. It all came out very well in my opinion, and the canvas held up to the rough and strenuous waxing process on all the seams. None of the liner got stuck to the shell, and nothing melted.The buttons on the wrist adjustment and pockets don‚Äôt have much holding power, so it‚Äôs easy to unbutton your wrist cuff against things. That‚Äôs better than it getting hung up on things and ripping though I guess.The had warmer pockets so have a good lining, but I‚Äôm indifferent to the pho button pocket detailing. It doesn‚Äôt hurt anything, but I could do without it. The hand pockets are pretty deep for gloves, keys, or a phone. Be careful with phones in those pockets while sitting especially like in a car slightly tilted backwards. My phone falls out there easily but never while I‚Äôm walking around. The breast pockets are good for that with a reasonable sized phone & case though.I really like the brown color both when new and after taking some darker colors from the wax. I‚Äôve already bought another Levi model trucker style jacket in the black color too.I would recommend and have already bought a few of these to wax as Christmas presents for my dad and older brother.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I'm Digging It", 'author': 'tj serritella', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a real nice jacket...the looks are sharp...I look sexy as hell in it! The functionality is sweet. It's nice and toasty with the sherpa lining. The detachable hoodie is a nice convenience for me living here in the midwest when it gets warmer without warning.The zipper on the hoodie is a nice quality zipper but the zipper on the actual jacket is a little on the small side and doesn't seem too sturdy. I'm hopeful it will hold up to a few years of wearing. There is nothing worse than having a nice jacket and have the zipper fail. A bad zipper turns the entire jacket into garbage.Overall, I'm very pleased with my initial usage and this purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Lightweight Bomber Jacket Causal Fashion Flight Windbreaker Light Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wash it first! (it softens)', 'author': 'Jesse McClure', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Last night I was planning on giving this jacket a 1-star review based primarily on the material which seemed horrible and unwearable. It\'s polyester, but seemed not like polyester cloth for clothes but rather the polyester that\'d be in plastic bottles. I was tempted to say that this could either be thrown in the garbage, or have garbage thrown into it (e.g., it\'s a plastic garbage bag). But I tried putting it through a laundry cycle (normal wash, cool tumble dry) and I\'m glad I did. It came out *soo* much softer.It\'s still not particularly "soft" when compared to other materials, but it now feels on par with normal clothing-grade polyester and is certainly wearable (it really wasn\'t before being washed). It still doesn\'t scream quality - but it\'s a functional cheap jacket for spring. Given the low price, this adds up to a pretty good value.EDIT: 1 Year Update:I\'ve upgraded my review from 4 to 5 stars. The original review is above and still holds true. But I\'ve come to really love this jacket and it\'s proven to be incredibly durable after a year of fairly regular use and a whole lot of abuse.I do have one gripe: the zipper on the inside pocket tends to get stuck a lot on the thin flaps of material meant to cover the zipper. This is not a great design. However, given just how many times this zipper has gotten stuck, and the fact that I have no patience to deal with such an issue delicately and instead I just pull on it as hard as I can to break it free ... given this abuse, it\'s amazing that the zipper is still just fine. I\'ve had much more expensive coats where if material gets stuck in a zipper it\'s game over for that zipper.This jacket\'s durability overall matches this zipper too: this is the cheapest (price) jacket I\'ve ever owned, and I\'ve treated it as such. It\'s seen a lot of carelessness and abuse. It\'s been left on the filthy seat in my truck reserved just for my dog ... and it\'s been stepped / sat on by that dog. The jacket\'s been shoved into various spots, twisted, tugged, and abused in every way imaginable. Yet after a year of this there are no rips, no tears, no snags, no broken zippers, no fraying seems. The jacket still looks like it did on day 2 (after the first wash - as noted in the original review, it looked like crap on day 1).Despite being the most affordable jacket I\'ve ever owned this definitely my favorite light weight jacket. So much so that I\'ll likely get another in a different color. It\'s not flashy, but it does look nice for very casual environments: basically when I\'d otherwise wear jeans and a t-shirt, this goes over that well and looks great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very stylish', 'author': 'Brian Catania', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a nice light jacket, very stylish, material is waterproof so can double as a rain coat. Material is not super soft, but I like the fit and style alot and the price is very good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, odd sizing', 'author': 'Aaron Morse', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Product itself is better than expected. Quality is wonderful. Nice and lightweight but durable. Good flex. Color is spot on. The problem i have is the sizing is all wrong. Order a size up is my recommendation. I ordered 3xl which should have been big on me, however it fit more like a 2xl. In fact, it's hard to tell if I got the correct one. The packaging says 3xl, but the item tag says every other size internationally", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Best lightweight jacket I've owned", 'author': 'Chuck F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As one reviewer noted, wash this jacket when you first get it. Makes it softer and more comfortable, IMHO. Time will tell, but the material seems very durable, and the zippers are sturdy. Recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits Great and looks great!', 'author': 'Florida Man', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'well constructed and comfortable jacket', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking jacket!', 'author': 'D. Andersen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought to replace a similar jacket that had just worn out. This jacket looks nice and fits well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Noisy raincoat - not for casualwear', 'author': 'Ashley N', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This black bomber jacket fits true to size and has a nice look to it, however, the material was not as expected. It's more of a raincoat material on the outside as well as the inside, making it very noisy whenever you walk or move around. If you're looking for a nice looking jacket that is truly weatherproof, consider getting an actual raincoat instead. This bomber jacket wouldn't be the best to wear to parties or for casualwear because of the raincoat-like material. On top of that, it's not very well insulated. Overall, was not super satisfied with my purchase, but I know now what kind of material I want to look for while searching for a good black bomber jacket in the future. For the price, it would seem to be worth it, if you're just going for the style. But the material makes the jacket overall not comfortable to wear for long periods of time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very well made', 'author': 'Linda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered for my dad, very well made, looks like the photo. Plenty of pockets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Satisfied', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As long as you're not planning on braving a winter storm, this jacket is well worth the purchase.If purchasing mainly for the fashionability of it and bracing against wind on cooler evenings, I have little to no complaints/regrets with my purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing service', 'author': 'Juan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I struggle with clothes that fit. I ordered from this seller and the clothes fit perfect. Price was great, delivery time was good and the jacket fit perfect. Thank you. I will be buying more from you. I will also recommend this jacket to my co-workers', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super Value!', 'author': 'JR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'London Fog has always made high quality, stylish coats & jackets and this is no exception!Just the right weight. I also like the mesh lining which allows the garment to breathe.It is a classic style. It has a lay flat fairly WIDE collar which I prefer over the standup collars you now see all around. Zip pockets and also comes in tall sizes which works well for me. I am 6‚Äô0‚Äù 230lbs and the XLT fits great.If you grew up in the 50‚Äôs and 60‚Äôs this jacket is a no brainer.PS: yes, it is packaged in a small bag and being made of synthetic fibers, it will be wrinkled. If you order clothes online, you should be used to it. Order a small portable steamer, there are several choices on Amazon. It will easily relax the wrinkles. title: Men's Hoodie, Ecosmart Fleece Full-zip Hoodie, Zip-up Hooded Sweatshirt for Men
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft...', 'author': 'KLT', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are so nice. They're soft, plenty of colors, sturdy zipper, warm yet lightweight and comfortable fit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm and Comfortable; Sizing a Bit Difficult', 'author': 'Hannah G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this sweatshirt for my husband in Spanish Moss in Size Medium which he usually wears in other brands of sweatshirts. It was too big, especially in the shoulders with extra material in back of the shoulders. We ordered a Size Small, and it fit very well...maybe a teeny bit tight but fine. He really likes the color, warmth, cozy feeling. and we do recommend. Great price! He is about 5\'9", slim but not skinny, and 155 lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A good basic for the price‚Äîeven for women!', 'author': 'O.L.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It is surprisingly difficult to find reasonably priced women‚Äôs zip-up hoodies in basic colors without logos, trendy cuts, or other bells and whistles. I am 5‚Äô6‚Äù, 150 lbs, and a medium fits comfortably. It is not a high-end piece‚Äîthe strings are somewhat flimsy and finished with cheap plastic tips; the zipper works but does not move super-smoothly and is shiny metal rather than matching the color of the sweatshirt. I was not impressed when I first got it, but it actually improved after washing: it‚Äôs now softer and fits better, with no pilling. It‚Äôs light to medium weight, so not a good outer layer in the winter. I needed it for around the house and for very casual weekend outings (I wear suits to work), so for $19 and given the super-quick delivery, I‚Äôm very satisfied. Great color selection‚ÄîI got black and red, and will probably buy more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice: Comfortable, Warm, Good Looking', 'author': 'ArtArt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far they seem quite durable. I bought a total of three. I bought red, black, and maroon. All three colors look very good with my brown, khaki, or black cargo pants.Until the weather gets warmer I wear one of them under a leather jacket whenever I leave the house. All three look good with either one of my black or brown jackets. The hood is roomy enough to wear on top of a watch cap, ear muffs and or various other versions of very warm hats. If the weather is too warm for both hoodie and jacket, I take the jacket off and just wear the hoodie.Finally, I want to stress the advantage of having a zipper instead of a pullover. With a zipper I can control my body temperature better. When I get too hot I can simply unzip the hoodie. Wearing a long sleeve t-shirt and or sweatshirt of a matching color undernearh the hoodie creates a good look, and rovides warmth and comfort while experincing some very low temperatures.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Still holding up!', 'author': 'cort : )', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this for my fianc√©e to wear around the house on mornings/evenings when it's cold. This is light enough to wear around indoors, but warm enough to wear outside if you're going to the store or walking the dog. The fit is true too size, but if you like alot of room in your sleeve cuffs at the wrist, then I would suggest one size up. The cuff was a little tight when he first got this and he has been stretching the fabric to loosen up the wrist area, and it has just a bit, but this is how I know that this jacket is well made because it won't stretch out and look overworn. There has been no problems with the zipper, it always zips up and down flawlessly and never gets caught on the teeth, and hasn't messed up even though it's been through the washing machine and dryer countless times. We got this jacket in the color black and its ready to go right out of the box (I like to wash my clothing first before wearing it but my fianc√©e is impatient and wanted to wear it right then and now when trying it on to see if the size fit well) and it doesn't leave any dye marks on sheets, furniture, or fabric that I have seen before happen with other brands. This also has not bled onto other colors in the wash, and hasn't shrunk up from being in the dryer instead of air drying. Also, even though it has the thin fleece like material on the inside, it doesn't need to be lint rolled, and doesn't leave a bunch of little black lint on the shirt your wearing under it. I purchased this in February 2023 and at the time of this review it is February 2024 :)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable', 'author': 'WBB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Well made and a good price. Nice vivid color.', 'author': 'G.C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s a lightweighted hoodie with pockets and a zipperd front. Everyone is different. You may have a preference of having a medium weight, or a heavyweight or even a (lightweighted one like this one); I\'ve would have preferred a medium weight. "Only" because that\'s what I\'m used to. Other than that,it doesn\'t bother me. It\'ll also be good for wearing on warmer days. As far as the color, it\'s exactly what I was looking for. A nice bold vivid "Red" color that doesn\'t look faded. Anyway, it really fits perfect. I have a size 50 chest. 6\' tall, 210 lbs. And if it shrinks, because of the dryer, it\'s no big deal, it\'ll still still fit beautifully. A little trick that I\'ll share with you that was taught to me many years ago, is: if for whatever reason any of your garments shrink due to the dryer or whatever?, you can still bring it back to its original size by you rewashing it in cold water üí¶ üí¶ üåä and useing Downy fabric softener. Do Not! use a generic brand. What this does is that it softens and relaxes, and extends the fibers allowing it to return to its original size. But the trick is to air dry it. Because if you put it back in the dryer, you\'ll be back to square one. Don\'t tell anyone. Let it be your little secret. title: Mens Casual Lightweight Jacket Softshell Flight Bomber Jacket Varsity Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Don't be fooled by the low price and that it's a China product. Jacket is Amazing!", 'author': 'Maria G Barraza', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I will just say that I like many hesitate to buy a clothing product when it's not made by an American or European popular quality brand. This jacket, although perhaps not from a world renowned brand, for it's budget price, will astonish you like it did to me. The jacket is just a well rounded, well made and great looking inexpensive bomber style jacket. I bought the dark forest green which btw looks like a nice military or police green. The cashier at the gas station a go to every couple days saw me with this jacket on a few days ago and i was also wearing some pilot style sunglasses and he thought I worked for the local sheriffs office, lol. That's how good the jacket looks. I have gotten compliments from coworkers also asking me where i bought it. Its perfect for our cold but not freezing temperatures here in the lower great central valley of California but perhaps not for higher elevations of California and other parts of the country that get super cold. Trust me when i say this jacket is worth every penny you are gonna pay. I am a 5'8 male and weigh 170 and the Large fit me just as it should. No too tight and not too loose, just perfect for me. I recently ordered the black one also, this is how much i ended up liking the jacket. Try it, you have nothing to lose with Amazons great return policy. I guarantee most of you won't return this jacket. That's all I have to say.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice quality and very well made', 'author': 'Sarah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Pleasantly surprise with how well this jacket is made - makes me want to order more in more colors. It is lightweight which is good as I don't every need heavy jackets in Florida, and I brought this to the Blue Ridge mountains and it held it's own with just a long sleeve underneath. On top of that, I love the look of the zipppers and color (I got the green one). My only complaint is the size. I'm on the heavy side, so Amazon recommended getting a 2XL, I usually wear XL. Plus side is, it fits even with a sweater underneath. Downside is, it looks oversized on me. Sleeves are too long and the length goes well past my waist. None, the less still happy with my purchase, but would recommend try before you buy if you're unsure about the size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars First impression.. its impressive for the price.', 'author': 'T WH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got the thicker jacket in a size large, I'm about 200 lbs and 5'6 and it fits like a extra large which is nice!
