title: Eversoft Fleece Hoodies, Pullover & Full Zip, Moisture Wicking & Breathable, Sizes S-4X
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cool', 'author': 'Juan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A sweater is the ultimate clothing item for staying warm and cozy. Whether it's a chilly winter day or a cool summer evening, a sweater is there to provide comfort and protection. Its soft and knitted fabric feels gentle against the skin, making it a pleasure to wear.One of the greatest advantages of a sweater is its versatility. It can be dressed up or down, depending on the occasion. Pair it with jeans for a casual look, or wear it over a dress for a more elegant ensemble. With so many colors, patterns, and styles to choose from, there's a sweater for every taste and preference.Not only does a sweater keep you warm, but it also adds a touch of style to your outfit. From chunky cable-knit sweaters to sleek and form-fitting designs, there's a wide range of options to suit any fashion sense. Sweaters can be accessorized with scarves, hats, and jewelry to create a unique and personalized look.Another benefit of a sweater is its durability. Well-made sweaters are built to last, making them a wise investment in your wardrobe. With proper care, a sweater can withstand years of wear and still maintain its shape and quality.In addition to its practicality and style, a sweater also holds sentimental value. It can remind us of cherished memories, like cozy evenings by the fireplace or family gatherings during the holidays. Wearing a favorite sweater can evoke feelings of comfort, nostalgia, and a sense of belonging.In conclusion, a sweater is the optimal choice for both fashion and function. It keeps us warm, adds a stylish touch to our outfits, and holds sentimental value. So, next time you're getting dressed, don't forget to reach for that trusty sweater! Stay cozy, my friend! üòäüß•", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Available in very large sizes, still cheap, and comfortable', 'author': 'Dave Hogan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very large, and have difficulty finding stuff to fit me. These came in 4XL and fit me comfortably. I found them warm as well so I can throw them on to go outside to the car when it's cold. They have built in front pockets so you can keep your hands warm too. They are well made and were very inexpensive (not common for big and tall items).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite hoodie in our house', 'author': 'Sarah Burgess', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Multiple family members have this type of hoodie and my kid asked for this brand exactly because it's so soft against the skin & very comfortable. They're also pretty durable as far as wear and tear we haven't had to throw one out or had one get really tattered looking despite daily use and regular washes. It's warm on it's own but not super thick so great for layering too which we do in NY when it's freezing. You can easily get thermals & a sweatshirt under it then your big coat over it. True to size and roomy", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very soft!', 'author': 'Christopher E.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love the hoodie! I ordered a men's version because I liked the fit of the men's best, even though I am a woman. It's true to size, very comfortable and most of all VERY SOFT. It's cozy and warm despite the fact that it isn't heavy at all. It's just thick, soft and cozy. The zipper is very smooth and good quality as well. Honestly for the price it's such a comfy sweatshirt that I can practically live in it!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet, warm hoodie at a fair price!', 'author': 'CaseMan260', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comfortable, soft and warm, this quality hoodie is well made and ready for cold winter days!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy', 'author': 'Theresa abbazia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very light weight sweatshirt, extremely soft for those that have sensory issues, I am a 5 foot four woman 140 pounds I got an extra large men‚Äôs it fits nice and loose and just goes below your rear, perfect for around the house', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great cheap black sweatshirt', 'author': 'Olivia', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My job only lets us wear black basic outerlayers so I bought this and only wear it for work - its great, its soft, and it was cheap. It's pretty thin so I wouldn't buy if you plan to wear without a jacket on top but for wearing as an extra layer its great", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and lightweight', 'author': 'Genevieve Eisan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is such a comfortable sweatshirt. It is not very thick which makes it perfect for Spring/ "Winter" in Texas. When it is in the 40s when I go to work but 70s when I leave I needed a sweatshirt that was comfortable enough to wear during that range of temperatures and this fits the bill perfectly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Passes the teen test', 'author': 'Mighty Critical', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My daughter sneered at the smaller box-store hoodies I bought her in desperation, to entice her to stop wearing her father\'s old one (not because it is ugly but because he is a deadbeat). This one passed the test (she even gave me an "Oh. Cool. Thanks."). She wears it until it can walk on its own and then she washes it, rinse and repeat. It has held up beautifully and hasn\'t yet made it into the "that is so last month" pile. Well done, Fruit of the Loom.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality for the price', 'author': 'Tom Wolff', 'rating': 5, 'content': "First off, for under $20 you shouldn't expect top notch quality, but this hoodie is superior to one you'd buy from Wally World at that price. I think it's just as good as the ones at any average outdoors store that cost twice as much. So unless you need pro gear, go for one of these. Nice thing is that if you catch this hoodie on a barbed wire fence and tear it up, you won't cry at the thought of replacing it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Lightweight Softshell Jacket Fleece Lined Hooded Water Resistant Winter Hiking Windbreaker Jackets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, quality jacket perfect for daily wear or travel and great value for the money.', 'author': 'Texan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this jacket for my hubby after letting him choose it from several others and picking out the color. He is barely 5\'8" & 185 lbs with broad shoulders so i ordered the XL. It fit him to a tee. He mentioned it\'s quite roomy - there\'s plenty of room in the sleeves to layer if needed for colder days and the armpits are not snug or tight. The sleeves are a tad long as expected but the velcro tightening solves that problem.We live in north TX where weather fluctuates between the high 30s & 70s from day to day during the fall and winter. His other coats and jackets were either too large or thick, or did not serve as windbreakers or easy to lug about so he needed something light and comfortble, yet lined and warm enough for all weather wear. This jacket checks all the boxes, and we plan to take it with us for our Europe trip in May-June when weather over there can be rainy and chilly. He loves it and we couldn\'t be happier with the purchase. It\'s attractive and alot better than the expensive brand name ones i\'ve seen at the mall.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very warm and lightweight', 'author': 'Al23', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Jacket is great! My teenage son hates heavy jackets and prefers zip up sweaters. This has been his go to ever since I purchased. It's warm, water proof, and lightweight. I also bought one for my husband and he also raves about this jacket. Definitely recommend buying.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warmer than shell, long narrow sleeves', 'author': 'A. Oltsch', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I wanted a lightweight, windproof jacket but this is of thicker, warmer construction. Whatever the older reviews, the hood is definitely removeable via zipper, and the ends can tuck into little velcro pockets too. Hood is quite oversized, sleeves are overlong (as others note - and I have long arms) and both the body and sleeves are slender. If those suit you (and such slender sleeves seem to be a European/UK design) it looks a good, trim jacket for cool weather. Zips well up neck very comfortably! Body not roomy enough for any heavy sweater beneath. I immediately donated it to Goodwill because I have other midweight jackets that fit my needs better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits great, looks good, functions well. Good value.', 'author': 'Gregory Gibbs', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed a cold weather jacket that wasn\'t too bulky for days where the temperature ranged from 25 to 50 degrees Fahrenheit and this was a great choice. I am 5\'8" and weigh 177 pounds. I ordered XL so I could wear a sweater or hoody with it and it works fine. Sleeves are a tad long but it has a Velcro strap that will keep them from falling over your hands. Plenty of pockets for phones, keys etc. Good value. Arrived the day after I ordered it. I am satisfied with my purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect fit and very comfortable, serves the purpose of keeping warm and dry on days when the temps dip into the 40/50 degree range.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jacket', 'author': 'Frank M DeBella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like the jacket , fits nicely good quality . The blue jacket is nice and warm .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm.', 'author': 'GELO', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Very nice winter jacket. Really warm it holds body heat well. I like that it has lots of pockets that I probably won't use and the wrist straps are a plus for windy and cold days. The grey color is Suttle and goes with any attire. When receiving the package it is air tight so just guide an iron or steamer over it to remove the wrinkles.Worth the money!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The sleeves are the drawback', 'author': 'GEB', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Nice weight. Lots of pockets. Good fit in shoulder and chest. BUT the diameter of the sleeves is too tight. Imagine wearing a sweater and needing a wind/water layer jacket. The jacket would accommodate the sweater everywhere but you could not get your arms through. Also, for some with longer arms the additional length might be appreciated. For me, with short arms, the sleeves extend 2+ inches.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket, size matters.', 'author': 'William', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice quality jacket. I purchased it as a lighter weight ski shell that I could wear on its own on warmer days, or with layers if colder. It fits that purpose nicely. It is a good weight on its own for spring skiing at above freezing temperatures. Below freezing, you‚Äôll want to layer up. Before buying, I read many reviews and was unsure about whether to get a large or XL size. I am 5‚Äô11‚Äù, 205 lb and usually buy size L jackets. In the end, I decided to get the XL, which turned out to be the right decision for my intended use. With no layers underneath, it is a little big on me, but with the wrist and waist cinches, it fits reasonably well. On colder days it is roomy enough to wear a fleece layer underneath, while allowing freedom of movement with no tight spots or binding. I think a size L would have fit better without layers, but would have been too snug with a fleece underneath.L', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and Functional', 'author': 'C M Nemeth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just bought this coat as a replacement for a water "resistant" coat I use around the house when I need to be outside in the rain or snow blowing the driveway, and for an upcoming trip. I literally bought it at 9-ish Pm ET and it was at my door the following morning before 830am ET. Thanks Amazon!The coat itself is very comfy (2XL) and there is room under it for a hoodie or sweatshirt. Its a little less roomy than some other 2XL outerwear I have but there is enough room for bulkier clothing under it (layering). The main reason I got it was for an upcoming trip to Alaska we have planned for later this year and wanted something that was fleece lined for a bit more warmth in 40-60 degree weather w/wind/rain. My existing waterproof-ish coat has no lining and would not be very warm in those temps w/wind/rain. Can\'t include how it did for that yet but will update the review when I get back, later this year.So far so good. Provides the additional protective layer I was looking for and is water-"repellent", not just resistant. Allows for winter work outside the house (shoveling/snow blowing, etc) without getting cold or sweaty under it like a warmer coat would. Plenty of pockets, zippers appear to be good quality, removable hood is nice too as that may allow for more casual wear in the colder months and during that trip coming up. For the price compared to Duluth Trading Co or The North Face for similar coats, you can\'t beat it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Wool Blend Pea Coat With Detachable Soft Touch Wool Scarf Warm Winter Trench Coats
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Coat. Great Price.', 'author': 'REH', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Extremely happy with my purchase. The coat looks great and looks of decent quality for the price. It\'s nice to be able to stay outside the $200-$400 higher side coat price range and get something that looks good and fashionable. I rotate clothes a lot, so having several winter coat options at more reasonable prices fits the bill perfectly, just as this coat does. And, at the price, if can get 1 or 1.5 seasons wear, I\'m happy.As for coat fit, I\'m 6\'3", 34x34 pant, 15 1/2" neck, 36" sleeve, 40" chest, 175 lbs, more triangular build. The large fits a bit loose at top, but that\'s my issue as I prefer a bit tighter fitting clothing. So, not a manufacturer problem in my opinion as some online clothes can be. More so, I wouldn\'t downsize due to the sleeve length which was absolutely perfect. And, above all, the extra size accommodation at top, of course, is likely given to accommodate a suit/sport coat underneath. And, while peoples suit/sport coats length can vary, if my suit/sport coat is buttoned, this coat covers such an undercoat just fine. If the suit/sport coat is unbuttoned, that coat hangs a bit out from underneath from this coat. Not an issue. Just FYI. And, with my preference for likely wearing with just a sweater, this size will be great and as tailored to one as one can expect from ordering online.I ordered the coffee 01 color, and no disappointment there. What I saw in the pictures, is what I got. I was worried the blend might look a bit cheesy. But, no. Very refined looking and just the color I wanted.Some people said they didn\'t like the buttons, that they are maybe a bit flashy, i.e., not just solid color or standard brown/black. If you are way conservative in dressing, or need that, perhaps so. I get it. But, I think they are a nice accent. I worried a bit about that too. But, when I got the coat. Not a problem at all. Looks great and if a real concern I think the coat is worth it to have a tailor put on the buttons you want.Last, there seems to be a bit of confusion on the reviews as to whether its too short or that its more of a waist coat. Yes, this version is. For me, it fits more to my upper thigh, or right at mid-point on pants pockets. HOWEVER!!!, within the color options, different lengths are presented, so beware! And that is perhaps what people are noting. One color you like, might be a different coat style/length than another color you like. So, carefully read the description and look at the sleeve bottom to coat bottom ratio in the pictures for length approximation or read the size charts, which I think pretty accurately depict the difference.I picked up on this difference and decided to also order a longer length coat in another color by this manufacturer, in case the first didn\'t seem to fit as I wanted. I am keeping both! as these are really decent wardrobe additions and each of the lengths I thought I was picking is exactly what I got. One other point on some of the comments, this coat did come with a scarf. The other coat under this manufacturer that I got with the listing shown to come with a scarf, did not. So people have noted this. Perhaps true. But, in seeing that possibility ahead of time before ordering, I knew scarf or no scarf was not going to be a deal breaker at this price. Also, I believe some folk contacted the manufacturer and got the scarf separately. Again, not a deal breaker for my purpose.Anyhow, long review....but I was really impressed with the coat(s) from this brand/manufacturer. In buying 2 at still a fraction of a $400 single coat price, I can rotate and likely get better dress options and similar wear, and I will look for this seller\'s clothing in the future.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent look for the price', 'author': 'Chris Carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Overall, this jacket looks much more expensive than it is. I wanted a nice "dress" jacket for the winter months, and liked the look. For the cost, it was worth a try. The jacket looks well sewn, and the liner is comfortable. It\'s warm enough for casual winter wear, probably into the 20\'s, but it\'\'s not a parka or ski jacket.I\'m 6\' tall, ~215 lbs, and went with the X-Large. It fit extremely well, although I would have preferred an extra inch in the sleeves (which is the case with almost everything I buy that isn\'t a "tall" version). The jacket isn\'t too bulky, it fits well enough when sitting in a vehicle for a commute.Overall, this is now my daily "office wear" jacket during the winter months.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket !! Fits slim.', 'author': 'Steve', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Jacket looks great !!Sizing is a slightly small. I have a 48‚Äù chest but ordered the XL for a 52 as I have wide shoulders and wanted to wear this over a smelter or similar garmentFirmest was as expected, just a little on the e snug side even with a T-shirt. Amazon was great and helped me returnit for the 2xl.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So much better in person', 'author': 'wanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The material is super soft. It‚Äôs a good winter jacket. I got a large for my fianc√© who‚Äôs 5‚Äô11‚Äù and 180lbs. It fit perfectly, with a little room to spare. Looks dapper. So happy with the purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Misleading description & waste of money', 'author': 'Jay M.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I\'d give this a -1 star if I could.Firstly - this is not a pea coat AT ALL. Also not a winter coat, and has barely any insulation. At best this could pass for a cheap fall jacket... At BEST. It may as well be a blazer/sport coat, but def not heavy enough to take you through even a moderate winter.Also, the fabric is SO cheap!! Honestly it\'d almost be funny if this were at 1/2 the price. And that "detachable scarf" is also really cheap and didn\'t have any attachment system as claimed.Thank goodness for Amazon Prime returns.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Looks great, medium quality', 'author': 'Bryan N. Kilmer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'First and foremost, the jacket looks great. I\'ve been wearing it for a few weeks now and have received multiple compliments (mostly from random guys) on how it looks. The built in inner scarf (which is annoying to actually connect to your jacket with the super tiny stretchy loops) gives a great boost of color. It\'s also more than warm enough for winter, especially if you layer it with a long sleeve shirt or sweater.Onto the less than great parts. While the length is perfect, the chest region is a bit tight. I\'m about 5\'9" and 160-165lbs and the medium is restrictive in my shoulders and arms, so much so that I usually prefer to take my jacket off when driving as you need unrestricted full use of your limbs to drive. The other down side is that the right pocket had a giant hole in the bottom that fed into the insulation portion of the bottom of the jacket. The actual insulation is light and feels like pulled apart cotton balls (not a bad thing, just weird). I had to sew it up and now it feels weird because I\'m horrible at sewing. I probably could have exchanged it...but I ordered it late into winter here and needed a new coat so I dealt with it.Otherwise, for this price this jacket was well worth it. I\'m not sure I\'d buy it again because the fit is a bit off. The arms are perfect length, it\'s just the chest that sits a bit tight. If you are more on the narrow side of chest size though, this could be perfect for you. If not for the massive hole in the pocket, I would have given this 4 stars because it really is a great value at this price point.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this coat!', 'author': 'Mike S', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the fit and look of this coat! Got compliments on it as well! Very good price and quality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this coat', 'author': 'Gregory Coleman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this in an XL.. Overall I would definitely buy it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars a definitely warm coat !', 'author': 'Private entity', 'rating': 4, 'content': "k is more expensive than cost. it's definitely warm. one review said the pockets aren't deep. I beg to differ. it has 4 pockets in front lower section. the upper ones are plenty deep for both a scarf and knit cap in one pocket. the side pockets aren't as deep but typically deep likim a Chicago guy so I know what cold is ! my recent jackets haven't been the best for midwest brrrrrr. after checking out local stores I decided to check online .this one caught my eye and the reviews were good. as I got it, it has a nice fit. I bought it in tan and the looe other coats. problem is things may fall out side pockets on any coat. it also has 2 inside pockets for phone or glasses. it comes with a quality long scarf too. my only issue is the button holes are tight but may get easier with time. other than that, a great value for the cost and id buy again. recommended !", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product, order the correct size', 'author': 'Next Up!', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Liked the quality of the product, but the 2xl "recommended" size was too small for me. title: Men's Jackets-Bomber Jacket Fall Winter Warm Windbreaker Full Zip Casual Padded Coats
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Christmas gift', 'author': 'Bryan M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this for my husband for Christmas. He was wanting a heavy winter jacket. He likes that it is fashionable and versatile. It has plenty of pockets he says so that‚Äôs a plus I think it looks good on him and it fits really well. It looks pretty durable, he likes it so I‚Äôm happy, and I think he‚Äôs happy too about this purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressive for $50', 'author': 'Ace Traveller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me start by saying that I have not had this jacket long enough to know how it will hold up over time but so far this jacket is amazing.FitAt 6\'2" / 200 (long legs) I was tempted to get the XL but got the Large as I wanted something really light as I have a full winter coat but could not be happier with sizing of the Large.MaterialsThis jacket has a really soft and water resistant outer skin. I placed my arm under my water spigot and the water just bounced off and two quick shakes of my arm and it was dry. The inner liner is very good at storing body heat so you could probably get away with this being a three season jacket if you live in an area with relatively mild winters.FeaturesThere are four pockets on the jacket I have, two traditional waist-level jacket pockets on the left and right with an inner pocket and an outer left arm pocket. The two hand pockets are decent but a little shallower than I expected. The inner pocket is nicely sized and readily falls to hand. I will likely never use left arm pocket as it feels odd to access and awkward to zip back up. Speaking of zippers, all of them appear to be of at least decent quality as the zippers feel decently robust and the tracks are metal. It is a bit annoying that the main zipper on this jacket is on the left which is different than any other jacket I have owned and takes a little brain retraining to get use to.OverallI have spent a lot of money on jackets in the past but also got my money\'s worth. I went a bit cheaper this time but I am pretty impressed even in the short time I\'ve worn this one. I will add an edit if this impression changes due to unexpected quirks or wear.December 2023 Update: 2nd JacketThis jacket has been great and despite rolling around on concrete more often than I cared to as well as doing a lot of other more tasks that would cause wear, I bought a new one to wear when going out. I am happy to report that the new one has the zipper on the traditional western right side of the jacket and there appears to be more insulation in it as well (still not bulky though). I am still using the previous one for working on cars and such.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'Bob H.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The jacket appears to be well-made, the fit is right, and it seems to be pretty warm. However, I am just wondering, it says men‚Äôs jacket fits like a men‚Äôs jacket but the zipper is on the opposite side you would find woman‚Äôs jacket or coat! I guess I‚Äôll get used to it because I intend on keeping it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'Bobby R.', 'rating': 5, 'content': '5\'10", 175. Med fit perfectly. Well made and warm. Only issue is Chinese made zippers are on the opposite for men. Not a biggie. Looks great!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good ‚Äúmid weight‚Äù jacket', 'author': 'Marc', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Jacket is a very good fit with ultra waterproof outer material and deep zippered pockets. Only criticism is a stubborn somewhat sticky zipper but a little lubricant does the trick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing quality', 'author': 'Tanya', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My brothers argued over this jacket even though the tag clearly was addressed to one of them üòÖ Almist looks interchangeable because of the inside. Good fit and beautiful colors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A Little Odd', 'author': 'Vic Faraci', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This is a nice jacket. It's comfortable, good-looking and warm. It's a men's jacket but the zipper is sewn in opposite of what we consider normal. You pull up the zipper with your left hand because that's where the zipper tab is. No other zippered garment I've ever had is made this way. I don't know if this is a manufacturing mistake or if this is the way it's done in whatever foreign country the jacket was made. As I said, it's odd", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lite weight', 'author': 'Myo T. Lin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Went to Italy backpacking (Venice, Florence, Rome, etc‚Ä¶) in December. 50degree F and I have no problem. I like arm pocket also. Price is perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Material is not the Nylon as usded in the Real Flight jacket. Fit is a bit off size.', 'author': 'Paul Warren', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the Price, its ok. But the real real Flight jacket is Nylon. The product is NOT a Bomber jacket, it tries to emulates a Flight Jacket. It should be made of Nylon but seems to be like cotton. The size fit is a bit weird .. length and sleeves are a bit long but it works ok. Priced under $50.00 , I'll keep it.The vendor should state what the material( s) are and tighten up and get and use the US size patterns that are in keeping with US jacket dimensions, particularly for the Large and Extra Large. This is not rocket science, easy to do ------ and it would be a much better product ! It would be nice to see a true US Air force Flight Jacket in US Air Force dark Blue also. Several Blues but in my opinion no Air Force dark Blue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Cute!', 'author': 'Candy Osias', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This jacket fits nicely, the lining adds a hint of fun, and has a inside pocket. The jacket is holds up well in a light sprinkle, not not in the snow. It's a great jacket overall, warm and comfortable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Insulated Eisenhower Front-Zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable jacket, correct proportions, Size as expected.', 'author': 'James Jameson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So this is my 3rd Dickies jacket in this style. I am used to the fit, and knew what to expect when ordering, so there were no surprises here. This is the insulated version, so it is a little warmer than the cheaper non insulated version. Do yourself a favor and choose this one over the non insulated version. The non insulated jacket is no warmer than a thin flannel shirt. This one actually holds in some heat. This is by no means a heavy jacket, however. Im a skinny guy, so I get cold in the 60s and 70s. This jacket provides enough warmth for me down to the 40s. But in the 60s, if I\'m working/moving around, it actually gets a bit hot.So, yes it is a "light" jacket, but not so light that it wont do any good in the 40s and 50s. Also it\'s not too heavy (in my opinion) for temperatures in the 60s.The lining is like a polyester type, very smooth and feels good on the arms. I prefer this to cotton or wool type linings. This is only preference, but just thought you should know, in case you prefer the more cotton type lining.So the fitment is probably what you are most curious about. This style of jacket is short and meant to be more fitted than other jackets. The sleeves come to your wrist (with average arm length). The bottom of the jacket stops at the waist, maybe slightly above depending on your torso length. If you\'re wearing the correct size jacket, when you move, this jacket may feel "too small" for you. Meaning the sleeves will come above your wrists when stretching your arms, or the bottom will rise above your waist line. You will feel it slightly constricting shoulder movement. If this is what you want, then order the correct size. If you prefer a little more breathing/movement room, then order the next size UP.Just for reference, I\'m 5\'11" 145 pounds, fairly skinny. I wear a small in most jackets, small-medium t-shirts, small work shirts/uniform shirts. But I don\'t like baggy shirts and jackets. So a small in this Dickies jacket is perfect for me. If you are about the size of me, and prefer more fitted shirts and jackets, then the small should be good for you. If you like them more baggy, then go with the medium.This theory should work across the spectrum in all the sizes. If you like fitted coats, then get the size you would normally get. If you like them more loose and baggy, then get the next size up.All in all this is a great buy on a very durable jacket. I work on cars for a living so this jacket gets daily use and abuse throughout the fall and winter. Even with all the abuse, I still get a few years out of these jackets. That\'s not to say they are worn out after a few years, they just get so stained and faded, it\'s time to get a new one. But at this price point, you could get a couple at a time, and wear them forever.Oh an one more thing. If you\'re looking at other work jackets on Amazon, you may notice many of them say the proportions are all screwed up...Like oversized arms or torso areas. Weird proportions that make you like Popeye or something. The Dickies jacket IS NOT like that. If you get the correct size, you will not look weird like you may with other brand jackets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not that warm - Zipper broke after 3 or months of use.', 'author': 'Bob', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Fits tight, not as warm as you would think as they describe. Downgraded from 3 stars to 1 star. Nine months later the zipper is broke rendering the jacket useless. Didn't wear it during summer so actually only got about 3 or 4 months out of it and of course didn't wear it every day.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Too large I didn't wear it Not good material and ugly", 'author': 'sam', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Too largeI didn't wear itNot good material and ugly shape", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Fit', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Classic design and built to last. The fit is on point. Amazon recommended a small, but I went with a medium. I think a small one would have been too snug. I was initially worried that the sleeves would be too long/big, but the length and size are just right. The sleeves rest slightly below my wrist but do not cover my whole hand. For reference, I am about 6'0 and weigh about 160-165, average build.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars One Star', 'author': 'Jose Mendoza', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I didn't liked, arm is too long", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size', 'author': 'alex c', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Note that im a female- 5‚Äô4 about 130 lbs. I ordered a small and it fits really big. probably closer to a medium/large. Which is expected as it‚Äôs in men‚Äôs sizes, but just a heads up. Other than that the jacket is great. warm, sturdy, thick.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars jacket has certainly changed since my last one in 2004', 'author': 'E. Susie Christie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "this jacket runs a bit large. i have a small in the non-lined as well as lined from 15 years ago and the new jacket is a bout half size larger. could be the other two shrank with time as they are of a very different material. the new material is very 'rubbery' and more rigid even after a wash and dry. will see how long the quilting inside retains its integrity.addition of interior pocket a nice touch. interesting in that dickies now has slightly contrasting stitching around the collar. runs a bit large. typical jackets i would be between a small and a medium. this jacket fits like a medium so has room to add an additional hoodie or other thick jacket underneath to fill the gap inside.again, the materil feels strange but also more rugged, synthetic feel than the earlier generations.the smell of chemicals is strong when opened. seems to the the smell of the poly filling on the interior.have 'airing out' for a coupld days in the other room.fit is good and im sure it will last another 10 years.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars No insulation as described', 'author': 'Julia', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Jacket has NO quilted lining as it says in the description. When I took the jacket out of the bag it came in I lifted it and could see the light of my lamp right through it! Very dissaponted!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Mechanic boyfriend loved his Xmas present', 'author': 'Nat Rynn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits great for average xl man, proportions are what are expected for this style of jacket - shorter/waist length, slightly boxy/in shoulders upper arms - preferred by the recipient- my boyfriend and mechanic - who likes his clothes to be fitted BUT comfortable first and most importantly - he layers underneath (long sleeve shirt/potential flannel/& finally a hoodie sweatshirt underneath on those really cold days - and he stays warm in NJ winter weather working in a garage. It was intended for work so I‚Äôm not sure if the fit would be as ideal if you didn‚Äôt intend to layer as extensively as he does daily‚Ä¶ but works for him and what we bought it for. It‚Äôs polished/professional looking without being *too* explicitly uniform esque.. actually finishes his top layer with a bit more style that he was lacking with his old coat or any of the other aforementioned layers he wears underneath.. he asked for this specifically and after researching/considering Carhartt options that were more than 2x the price, I‚Äôm happy I listened & went with this lol. Would buy again! DEF get the lined version, I can‚Äôt imagine the unlined being any more than a denim jacket, possibly even offering less in the warmth dept on that topic. Esthetically it probably is nice for warm climates but it‚Äôs totally worth the price to get the lined version of this jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Zipper failed after 3 months and not worn everyday.', 'author': 'Richard', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Will not be picking up a another one update March 14th zipper will not zip up this jacket looks brand new', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2018', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Cotton Lightweight Multi Pockets Zip Front Stand Collar Military Jackets Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars EXTREMELY WELL MADE JACKET, KUDOS!!', 'author': 'K. J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I HAVE TO SAY, THIS IS ONE REALLY NICE LOOKING JACKET! I\'M EXTREMELY SURPRISED JUST HOW WELL MADE AND COMFORTABLE IT IS. FOR THE PRICE I EXPECTED FAR LESS. I LOOKED IT OVER AND THE SEWING IS VERY GOOD, SEAMS ARE STRAIGHT, THE CUFFS AND WAIST BAND ARE ALL TOP NOTCH. THE FIT IS SPOT ON. A LOT OF TIMES THE ACTUAL SIZE OF JACKETS SOLD (HERE), RUN POSSIBLY 2 / 21/2 INCHES SMALLER. BUT I WEAR A SIZE XXL AMERICAN MADE JACKET AND THIS SIZE XXL FITS ME JUST FINE!! THE ARM LENGTH OF THE SLEEVES ARE QUITE LONG. AND, THE OVERALL LENGTH OF THE JACKET HANGS RIGHT AT MY WAIST. THE ZIPPERED POCKETS ACTUALLY ARE WORKING POCKETS! THE AREN\'T DEEP, BUT COULD HOLD A KEY FOB OR SOME SCREWS OR NAILS IF YOU\'RE PIDDLING WITH A WEEKEND PROJECT OUTSIDE. BACK TO THE ZIPPER UPPER ISSUE YOU MIGHT\'VE READ ABOUT IN OTHER REVIEWS. THE LEFT SIDE ZIPPER IS NOT A MALE / FEMALE THING OR A LEFT-HANDED/ RIGHT HANDED THING EITHER. IT\'S A EUROPEAN / ASIAN VERSUS NORTH AMERICAN THING!!! ON OUR SIDE OF THE BIG PONDS THE SLIDER ( OR PIN ) PRETTY MUCH HAS BEEN UNIVERSALLY PUT ON THE RIGHT SIDE ( THESE DAYS, BOTH MEN AND WOMEN ). BUT, OVERSEAS, IT\'S THE OPPOSITE, THE SLIDER GOES ON THE LEFT SIDE. THE THING WITH THESE JACKETS IS THAT THE MANUFACTURER HAD DESIGNED AND BUILT THESE JACKETS FOR AN OVERSEAS SALES DESTINATION. HOWEVER, THEY PROBABLY SAW AN OPPORTUNITY TO SELL TO THE AMERICAN MARKET AND HAVE SINCE STARTED TO SELL HERE. ALSO, THEY PROBABLY SAW NO ADDED VALUE TO MAKE BOTH LH AND RH ZIPPERS. SO, IF YOU WANT ONE OF THESE JACKETS, YOU DEAL WITH THE ZIPPER. I TELL YOU, ONCE YOU ZIP IT UP, NO ONE ELSE WILL KNOW BUT YOU .???? THE COLOR OF THIS GREY JACKET IS PERFECT THE MAIN POCKETS ARE PLENTY DEEP ENOUGH AND THERE\'S AN INSIDE POCKET ON THE WEARERS LEFT SIDE. OVERALL, I\'M A BIG GUY, GRAVITY HAS DROPPED MY BIG CHEST STRAIGHT DOWN TO MY WAIST! NOW, IT\'S A 54 INCH CHEST AND (GULP) GUT!! THIS JACKET ZIPS RIGHT UP, NO WORRIES! JUST DON\'T KNOW WHAT ELSE ANYONE COULD ASK FOR CONSIDERING THE PRICE. I LIKE IT SO MUCH, I THINK I\'M GOING TO ASK FOR THE DARK KHAKI JACKET FOR CHRISTMAS üéÑ! ( I\'LL ACT SURPRISED ) !! BUY ONE, THEY\'RE WORTH YOUR HARD EARNED CASHOLA!!LASTLY, THE ANSWER IS " NO " I WAS NOT COMPENSATED BY ANYBODY FOR THIS REVIEW!!!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket', 'author': 'Regeneration', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was surprised to see how good this jacket is. Quality fabric! thick and warm. Runs a bit big so you should size down (if you're Medium in regular shirts, take the Small size for a slim fit). The sleeves aren't insanely long, which is a relief. Looks good, feels like, and well-priced. Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish Jacket with Fit and Zipper Quirks', 'author': 'George', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I fell for this jacket\'s military style ‚Äì the sharp collar and structured shoulders are totally my vibe. But being a tall, lean guy with a bit of muscle, getting the right size turned into quite the saga. At 6\'4" and a lean/athletic 245 lb build, nailing the right size meant playing Goldilocks with not one, not two, but three different jacket purchases. The large was laughably small, the XL nailed the sleeve length but was tight across the shoulders and baggy around the waist, and the XXL settled the shoulder issue but left me swimming in sleeve and torso fabric. If only more manufacturers offered tall sizes. You‚Äôd be surprised how many of us there are out there that would buy more online if those existed.Tailoring was the secret sauce to making the XXL work, a necessity for the style-conscious athletic build.Now, let\'s talk about the zipper ‚Äì it\'s the bane of this otherwise great jacket. I want to say it\'s a 50-50 shot whether I\'ll be zipping smoothly or stuck in place. In reality, it happens about 9/10 times. Despite foreseeing this from reviews, the annoyance was real. It\'s likely getting swapped out soon. After some adjustments, the jacket\'s look is a win, making the extra effort worthwhile.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The thickness and size', 'author': 'Sti', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The jacket is very nice. It's worked very well with light and medium-thickness sweaters and I've been able to walk my dog and spend 30+ minutes out in the cold without feeling too cold.My only nit-picks with this coat are the pockets can get cold quickly when your hands aren't in them, but they do a good job of staying warm when your hands are in them.And when wearing thicker sweaters underneath, the buttons come undone when I lean over or get in my car.Durability is decent but there is already a tear in the left armpit and I've been very careful to hang up the coat when I'm not using it and I can't think of any times I stretched it too much, so I don't know where the tear came from.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my winter needs in New Mexico', 'author': 'Leonardo M. title: Men's Water-Resistant Softshell Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent jacket... at a fraction of the cost of "name brands"', 'author': 'Hunter H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Amazon Basics yellow jacket and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The jacket is made with high-quality materials that are both durable and lightweight. The bright yellow color is not only stylish, but also makes me highly visible when I'm out on my morning runs or bike rides.One of the things I love about this jacket is how comfortable it is. The fabric is soft and breathable, which makes it easy to wear for long periods of time without feeling weighed down or uncomfortable. I also appreciate the zippered pockets, which are perfect for holding my phone, keys, and other small essentials.In terms of functionality, this jacket truly delivers. It's water-resistant, so I never have to worry about getting caught in a sudden rainstorm, and the reflective strips on the front and back provide an extra layer of safety when I'm out in low light conditions. The adjustable cuffs and hem also ensure a snug fit that keeps out the wind and cold.Overall, I highly recommend the Amazon Basics yellow jacket to anyone looking for a high-quality, affordable outerwear option. It's stylish, comfortable, and functional, and has quickly become one of my go-to pieces for all my outdoor activities.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality, comfortable, and warm enough', 'author': 'VADadx4', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'In Virginia it gets pretty cold, not like northeast, mid west or west cold but when I walk the kids to school it can be 30-35 degrees. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice sturdy jacket', 'author': 'D. Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've started to wear this new jacket and I'm very happy so far. It's warm and seems to be of high quality. It has nice zippered pockets and fits great. Thank you", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable, well made, and water resistant - yes, please', 'author': 'Steven M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely love this all-weather jacket from Amazon Essentials! The fit, comfort, and style all speak to a quality made product without all the extra fuss of a designer name, nor the extra price either. The breast zippered pocket is perfect for a normal sized cellphone (sorry, haven't tried to uber large phablets yet) and allows easy access while out and about. The two side pockets are the perfect depth and positioning for your hands or a set of keys without worry that they may fall out. They are also zippered, in case you want to ensure what's in your pockets, stays in your pockets.The fabric is similar to, but much lighter than, the neoprene like material that is used in wet suits. It is very comfortable, does not get stuffy, and appears to keep a light rain off just fine. Zipped up it also keeps the cold away enough in a light breeze, but probably isn't ideal for winter wear.Overall, for a product made for Amazon directly, I am very impressed with the quality and design of this lightweight, water-resistant jacket. title: Men's Rugged Full Zip Dakota Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars WARM', 'author': 'Kenneth Bondurant', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The jacket looks simple. Doesn't look overly stylish. But, OMG, it's warm. Deceptively warm. When I first got it I didn't think it was going to keep me as warm as all those puffy jackets I've been wearing over the years nor was it going to be as warm as those scratchy wool jackets. It's super comfortable on the first day. Granted it is no longer as cold as it used to be in the 80s and 90s but still there are a few cold days over the winter and this jacket handled it perfectly. I was surprised and impressed. And it doesn't look half bad as far as style goes. I prefer stylish jackets but for practicality purposes, this jacket is perfect.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just the perfect jacket for the Alaskan Spring and Fall!', 'author': 'D. Ash', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Legendary Whitetails Men's Rugged Full Zip Dakota Jacket and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed! This jacket deserves a 5-star review for its exceptional quality, durability, and style.The first thing that caught my attention was the material. The jacket is made with a high-quality, heavyweight cotton canvas that feels incredibly sturdy and well-made. I have no doubt that this jacket will last me for years to come, even with regular wear and tear.The fit of the jacket is also perfect. It's not too loose or too tight, and the sleeves are just the right length. The full zip design makes it easy to put on and take off, and the collar is the perfect height to keep my neck warm on chilly days.Another feature I love about this jacket is the number of pockets. There are plenty of pockets to store my phone, wallet, keys, and other essentials. The pockets are also deep enough to keep my belongings secure and prevent them from falling out.Lastly, the style of this jacket is impeccable. The rustic, rugged look is perfect for outdoor activities like hiking or camping, but it's also stylish enough to wear casually with jeans or khakis. The attention to detail on this jacket is impressive, from the stitching to the zipper pulls.Overall, I highly recommend the Legendary Whitetails Men's Rugged Full Zip Dakota Jacket to anyone looking for a high-quality, durable, and stylish jacket. The material is top-notch, and the attention to detail is second to none. I'm already planning on purchasing another one in a different color!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect layered Jacket', 'author': 'Alexia B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is better quality than anticipated and is functional. You can wear it layered as pictured or you can separate the layers. Fit is right on and should order for the size that you are. This jacket goes with anything from a pair of jeans and a t shirt to a button down with khakis. There are a couple different color options / variations however they are all very practical. For a little over $100 ($108 I believe) my husband has a jacket he can wear anywhere we go and actually like the jacket he is wearing and it is comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sharp looking fall jacket', 'author': 'Dom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This jacket looks a lot nicer in person than it does online. It has a great rustic look and is lightweight.It's definitely not a winter jacket however, I find myself cold even with a thick sweatshirt underneath it in 30 degree weather, it just doesn't have much insulation in the liner, but would be a great spring and fall jacket.The stitching is a bit lacking and in the two weeks I've worn it the liner has started to come apart,I think it will likely only last this one season, Wich is a bummer because I really like it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars heavy and perfect', 'author': 'DSH-A08', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Not a jacket to baby. It's tough, and it's heavy. Very good in the cold!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Jacket!', 'author': 'Cooler74', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great looking jacket that fits true to size. Very warm, but not bulky. Definitely recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I absolutely love this jacket', 'author': 'Pat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My jacket is XL and it\'s Tobacco Brown. I\'m 6\'1" tall and weigh 195 pounds and I live in South Florida. I wrote that so it may help someone with deciding what size to choose when buying this jacket. It fits A1 perfectly in every way except the sleeves are a bit long. But 12 dollars at my tailor shop fixed that. Ok, now the jacket itself. I love everything about it. The material looks and feels like a jacket that sells for 3 or 4 times the amount I paid. The hoodie insert will work perfectly for the few chilly days we have here. The insert removes very easily and voila: It becomes my very favorite casual jacket hanging in my closet. i don\'t understand the complaints about pockets because on my jacket the outer hand warmer pockets are deep and substantial. The upper zipper pocket perfectly holds my Hide & Drink card holder wallet and it\'s far more secure there than in my jeans pocket. Summed up I just love this jacket. I have no affiliation with the company that makes this jacket or the seller of it so I can affirm this is the best jacket deal I have ever seen on Amazon. If you were undecided please trust this review because it\'s in no way skewed. You just can\'t go wrong with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It actually fits!', 'author': 'Jason T. Knowles', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm 6‚Äô8‚Äù tall and I have long arms even for my height and this jacket fits! Usually for me to have a chance of a jacket fitting I have to get it in ‚Äútall‚Äù and two sizes too big so the shoulders are to wide and hang down onto my arms some to help make the sleeves long enough. But with this jacket the shoulders are where they belong and the sleeves are still plenty long enough. It is also well fitting everywhere else, comfortable and well make. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who asked.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfort & VERY Warm until stitches came apart 3 months worn.', 'author': 'J. T. McMenamin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love this jacket. I'll get another one. I'll learn to keep certain heavy items out of the inside pockets because they will start to unravel the stitching. Also little holes kept popping up through the inner lining causing tufts of the insulation to pop throug them causing little white whisps which catch on whatever shirt I am wearing and pulling out ever so slightly over time.There hasn't been a more comfortable and WARM jacket I've ever owned. The removable hoodie really kept my shaved head warm when it's wet or simply cold outside. The soft feel of the outer shell is pleasant to the touch. The zippers work absolutely flawlessly.After using needle and thread to repair 2-3 locations where the stitching has come apart I've noticed 2 more places after washing / drying this jacket in cold water / low heat.I'll keep it for my 'dont care if it gets dirty' jacket and purchase another one to look snappy.This purchase made me happy and even happier since I know how to sew. Your mileage may vary.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Going strong after a full winter', 'author': 'Jim Sullivan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "While this winter was mild by Cleveland standards, this jacket still got plenty of use and seems to be holding up well. It's comfortable and plenty warm. It's a casual jacket that looks nice enough in almost any situation too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Rain Defender Relaxed Fit Lightweight Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket!', 'author': 'TrueBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this for husband who had a 20+yr old lined windbreaker that was at the end. I don't have anything negative to say about it at all, highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars His New Closet Staple', 'author': 'Gabby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I gave this jacket to my boyfriend for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. Its a thick, heavy duty jacket that's soft on the inside and durable on the outside and it keeps him really warm which he loves. Its his new go-to jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, thick, well made, great looking jackets..... but arms are way too narrow', 'author': 'Jason Richardson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Here is the real deal with these jackets... From the good, the bad, to the unfortunate.The Good:The prices on Amazon for these jackets are amazing! The jackets are beautiful, well made, thick with sherpa insulation in the torso and plenty of thick insulation in the arms. The denim washes are consistent throughout the garment and look just like the pictures you see pictured online. In my opinion they are simply strong, well made, beautiful jackets. I love them.but....The Bad:The arms in these jackets run narrow, so if you have any sort of upper arm musculature they will be tight, too tight. This will force you into buying the next larger size jacket in order to increase the arm width (which is still snug but doable). The problem now is the jacket will be longer and wider in the torso... That's an issue because the jacket simply looks too big, wide, and long!The Solutions:1) Some folks have tried getting around this by buying the larger size, washing and drying in order to shrink the garment (because shrinkage mostly occurs in the length of the arms and torso and a little bit in width), then wear the garment to try and stretch out the denim. Remember it is denim so it will stretch quite a bit just like your jeans do... BUT there is no guarantee it will shrink enough in all the areas you want for a perfect fit..2) You pay a tailor to increase the upper arm width by sewing in extra denim fabric or stretch fabric...3) You go to Sears or a local Levis location and try on a dozen jackets to find one that fits you just right...4) You buy a vintage 70's, 80's, 90's pre-owned jacket which were cut larger in the arms back then...Point is this: If you are tall and slender with slender arms the jacket will fit. If you are overweight with thin arms the jacket will fit. If you are built with a keg like torso and stick like arms the jacket will fit.The Unfortunate:However... If you are athletic in any way and have average muscle size, medium muscles, larger muscles, or huge muscles the jacket will not fit your arms... period. The jacket will fit in the shoulders and the torso but not the arms. Can you see the recurring theme here?My solution:I tried both the large and the XL and neither fit my arms properly and were way too wide and long in the body. (Therefore I had to return them to Amazon.) Unfortunately I ended up going to a local retailer (paid way more than if purchased through amazon) tried on 20+ jackets, got lucky, and found something I could break in. I also bought another one (by going the vintage route via ebay) which worked out even better because they were made bigger and different back then.Great jackets but terrible fit. All Levis needs to do is increase the upper arm width by 1.5 inches in order to compensate for the extra insulation put there. This is why the Sherpa jackets have this sizing problem because the manufacturers are using the pre-existing un-insulated denim jackets as the base model, filling it up with sherpa and arm insulation and....boom....poor fitting jackets.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great with your hands in the pockets.', 'author': '66Mustang', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Good fit, looks good. Who says a 63 year old can't enjoy this quality trucker jacket. The subdued looks good with the Black Stonewash jacket. Color is solid and not patchy. I normally wear XL, but had to exchange for a Large sized jacket with Amazon's exchange program. The four inch difference across the chest is huge. The properly sized jacket definitely looks better with the more snug fit. Looks great with your hands in the pockets. A great Xmas gift at under $60.I could see an improvement of the jacket with a more-whiter colored Sherpa material. Maybe fluffier like some of the impersonator brands out there.... The arm sleeves could benefit with Sherpa or fleece material as well. The body of the jacket is warm.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice lined Levi jacket', 'author': 'Stephanie Harris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a very soft, pliable jacket, not stiff at all. It fits well, and is warm. Has a retro 80s look to it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great! Makes me feel tough wearing it.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This Levi Sherpa Trucker Jacket in Olive Green was bought for this winter. Unfortunately we had a very mild and short winter this year. On a 10 degree Fahrenheit day, with a stiff wind, I did try this jacket out and found it to be plenty warm and somewhat wind resistant. I am 5\'8", 155 pounds, 39.5 chest with a sweatshirt, and found the Medium size jacket fit my width perfectly. The cutout for the arms could be bigger in my opinion though. I could walk, shop and drive a car just fine but if I was swinging a hammer wearing this I would go for the next size up. Also the exterior material seems like cotton canvas (?), maybe it will hold up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best gifts i've gotten for my dad.", 'author': 'makeupgirl', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased tis for my dad for Christmas. This is one of the best gifts i've ever gotten him. He loves it so much. He said that it was incredibly warm. We live in Chicago, and the weather has been unusully warm for us. He said that it's for a bit colder weather. That means it is WARM AND COZY.It's also incredibly beautiful. It looks amazing. Looks like it costs $300", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Consider sizing up if you have a large belly.', 'author': 'Junie B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased the light gray Amazon Essentials Men's Long-Sleeve Polar Fleece shirt/jacket in size medium and have worn it as a jacket several times since 12/24/23. I 'm a 138 lb., 5' & 1.5‚Äù tall, 38C bra female with slender arms and excess stomach weight. Obviously, this masculine shirt/jacket is long on me (comes just to the bottom of my seat when unbuttoned) and has arms that are too wide for me, but I like it anyway. In chilly days in the South, it provides good warmth as a jacket. Made in Vietnam, it's clearly a quality garment, with neat stitching, buttonholes that line up perfectly with the buttons, a wider collar that can be positioned upward, inside pockets that are 9.5 inches deep and 5.5 inches wide, and firmer outside pockets (which functionally are not as deep because of the angle of the opening). This soft fleece shirt/jacket is comfortable. The buttonholes are a little tight, but that is better than buttons being too loose to remain fastened. There is a spare button adhered to the inside left tag. This shirt/jacket has more of a straight cut which means that someone with a large belly would probably need to size up if planning to wear it buttoned. Of100% polyester, this shirt/jacket has a side tag indicating the garment should not be dry cleaned, but can be machine washed inside-out, using cold water and a gentle cycle, and machine-dried on a gentle cycle. After washing I plan to put it in the dryer for just a few minutes, and then hang to dry, as I do with most of my clothes. An update will be provided if any problems occur after washing it.I‚Äôd previously bought this shirt/jacket in dark green as a gift, but after seeing its quality, purchased the light gray for myself. The dark green color is similar to, but actually lighter than the illustration. The illustration for the light gray shirt/jacket, however, is representative of its actual color. I like the jacket so much that I just purchased a 3rd one in the indigo blue heather color. It is reported to be darker than the light blue denim color illustration. This Amazon Essentials garment is well-made and is a good value.02/12/24 Update: Subsequently purchased a shirt/jacket in Medium in blue heather. The lower stomach area is narrower than that of both the green and light grey ones. The label was checked but reflected medium- the same size as the 2 previously purchased. Whether just an anomaly for this particular jacket or all are smaller in blue heather isn't known. I can't close the bottom 2 buttons on this one but can on both the green and the light gray, both of which fall straight (no gap) after having been buttoned. Due to sizing inconsistency, I've changed my rating from 5 to 4 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs A Little Small', 'author': 'CrazyGMiniFarm', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this for my son for Christmas, he really liked it, but it does run about a size small. My son is 6\'4" and 280 and he needed a 2xl not and XL. Plenty warm with a shirt underneath it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Loose Fit Firm Duck Insulated Flannel-Lined Active Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Carhartt for the win!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an amazing jacket. I needed a nice, heavy winter jacket for the cold and windy coastal Santa Cruz weather after moving to college, so I wanted something that would keep me warm but also look cute. This jacket is exactly what I wanted. I get compliments almost every time I wear it and now all my friends want one!Pricing:I don‚Äôt usually spend more than $30 on clothing, but I really wanted this jacket, so I decided to splurge a little. Plus, Carhartt is a reliable brand, so I know it will last me a very long time. I looked into a few other brands (Dickies, Patagonia, etc.), but I felt that Carhartt was a better fit for what I was looking for. I considered getting a jacket from Dickies ($139.99) that was close to identical, but I decided to go with Carhartt ($109) because not only was it more cost-efficient, but it seemed warmer and more stylish as well.Pros:The jacket is nice and warm without being too heavy and goes with almost any outfit. I also love that Carhartt tends to look even better with a little wear and tear over time, unlike some other brands. This way I don‚Äôt have to treat it like a new pair of white shoes and be worried about getting a little scuff or dirt on it. It is extremely durable, so if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for, look no further!Potential Cons:You should be aware that when you first get the jacket it may feel bulky and tough, but it is easy to break in. I washed it a couple of times according to the instructions on the tag and it is much better now. It was a bit big on me (as I was expecting), so I threw it in the dryer after I washed it and it did shrink a little bit, but definitely not too much. For reference, I am 5‚Äô2 and 110 lbs and I got the mens small. It is still a little big on me even after shrinking it, but that‚Äôs exactly what I was aiming for. The zipper can be a little sticky at times, but it hasn‚Äôt been a big issue for me so far. One thing you should know is that it is not waterproof or water-resistant. I wore it in the rain once and the water soaked right through the outer shell. Still not a problem for me though! Just thought I‚Äôd mention it.Overall:Overall it's an amazing jacket and is one of my favorite clothing items that I own. I don‚Äôt know how I went all this time without it! High quality, plenty of pockets, comfy, warm and stylish. I definitely recommend getting this jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money!', 'author': 'Shanon DeWitt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this jacket for a Big&Tall gentleman, and it fit perfectly. The quality of the material is superior, nice and thick but soft. Very durable exterior and will make for a great outdoor work coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars first impressions are great', 'author': 'J. Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s big. It\'s warm. It feels very tough. You will look more intimidating (not what I wanted, but there it is). I got fed up with cheap things not working right and giving out after a year. So I bought this. It\'s a bit costly, for my budget.I\'m 6\'2", 300 lbs. I wear mostly 3xl, sometimes 4xl. I bought the 3xl jacket. There is some room to spare, but the fit is very good. It is long enough, and I can move easily in it. It is bulky and sweeps things off counters and tables as I pass by. It is warm, quite warm. The exterior feels almost like canvas. Brand new, it is fairly stiff. The hood is stiff, and I had to persuade it to stay down. Again, I assume time will ease the stiffness somewhat. The interior is soft flannel. Waist and wrists have elastic to keep snow out, but they do not chafe. Overall very comfortable. It has a plasticky, painty scent that I assume will fade with washing. Strong metal zipper. Two pockets are inside, one zipper the other velcro. They are each big enough to hold my Kindle. This looks like an excellent jacket. I will update if anything surprising happens.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My son was ecstatic.!!', 'author': 'Owl Glasses', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'd call this a 'heritage coat,' as the quality is so very wonderful, these are often handed down from father to son. This was a dream of my sons for a long time. It was a most wonderful holiday gift. We are having a very cold winter throughout much of the US. It keeps him toasty even on the long walks he's fond of. It would take a lot to sustain any damage to it as the materials used are of the highest quality. It's great for a date, even better for hard work. I will never regret buying this for my dear son. And it is just so flattering for any man to wear. He loves it and I love it that he's so over the moon. Carhartt is a long-honored brand for a reason!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!', 'author': 'Care Raine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cheapest price I‚Äôve found for these this year. title: Hoodies for Men Full Zip Up Fleece Warm Jackets Thick Coats Heavyweight Sweatershirts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars warm, dense, generously sized hoody, seems to repel water, keeps out wind and chill', 'author': 'Precise Disarray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Medium thick, dense, slightly stretchy, smooth hoody. Even better in person, but if you want a really good description of this hoody, watch the video they included among the product pictures. I immediately thought that he was saying all that I was thinking, lol.I have this in size 3XL, and it is pretty accurate to the measurements listed. Generous, American sizing. I went ahead and took my own rough measurements. Slightly more roomy with my measurements. The material has some stretch, which can be nice for creating a more fit look while still feeling casual and comfy.--Shoulder width, measured shoulder hem to shoulder hem: 26"--Width, measured arm pit to arm pit: 27.5 (so 55" around)--Width measured at hips: 26" (so 52" around)--Arm length, measured from shoulder hem to arm opening, 30"--Back length measured from neck line to bottom edge: 31"The outer material is smooth. This helps repel water and to also repel debris, fur, and hair. I rarely pick up any dog or cat fur, but when I do it is very easy to just swipe it away with my hand. The interior is a short dense fluff material. This lines the entire inside (body, arms, hood). This will keep you warm, and the overall density will keep wind from seeping in. Also, the ribbed stretchy arms holes and hips also help keep out cold and wind.A side hand pocket on each side. Smooth liner material (not the fluffy stuff). Not real deep. I\'d say wrist depth. Can fit a phone, but I would be mindful of it being there as the depth may not be secure feeling enough.While I think anyone could wear it, it definitely has a more boxy manly look to it. (I havent decided if I will pass this on to my husband or continue to wear it) But by all means if you want a very warm, very comfy ("like wearing a blanket") zippered hoody sweater/jacket, then go for it. I think you will be impressed and pleased by the quality, look, and feel of it. I like it for taking my dogs out to do their business in the chilly early morning hours.Size and Care instructions are included on a tag sewn inside, on the side.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfy', 'author': 'Lisa Tulak', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I loved the lining, keeps me warm, but it does run a little small for the size. title: Men's Stand Collar Leather Jacket Motorcycle Lightweight Faux Leather Outwear
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This was a new jacket for a birthday!', 'author': 'Linda C. Phillips', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I loved this jacket and loved the price. You can't tell it is faux leather. I got it for my husband's birthday. He had lost some weight and it looks so nice on him. Very form fitting!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressive fake leather jacket. Go with "brown"', 'author': 'Mrs Pokoski', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket looks great. I\'m pretty impressed with the heft and look. I ordered a small for my son and it does run a bit larger than is typical for a men\'s small, but it\'s not ridiculous or anything. Came here mostly to provide some insight between this style, "brown", vs "brown 1301" which I also ordered. The "brown" looks better in person than it does in the photo. In the photo the color looks a little more splotchy with grey undetones. In fact it is the same color as the "brown 1301"- a rich golden tan. "Brown" has plain shoulder and the chest pocket is functional. The "brown 1301" has pleated shoulder detail that is much more prominent in life than in the photo. Also the chest pocket on "brown 1301" is not functional.There was a very slight odor to "brown 1301" and none to "brown"On "brown" the hand pockets are zippered closed and the sleeve can be zippered to a slim fit. All zippers function well. The same is true for "brown 1301".Nice jacket.The lack of functional chest pocket in "brown 1301" is the reason I sent it back and kept this as that\'s the kind of thing I find maddening. (And yes I did look to see if it was just sewn shut like a quality blazer pocket--no it is not.) I also think my son will prefer the look of the simpler shoulder. But all in great jackets especially considering the price point.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice jacket', 'author': 'Bluewolf', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I initially got this for an Eddie Munson from Stranger Things cosplay and to just wear after as well, but it ended up being a lot bigger than I thought so it is just for Eddie now. That is really the only reason I'm not giving a 5‚≠ê because I checked my measurements multiple times and it was still too big, but other than that it's a very nice jacket and definitely worth it!! Very nice material, the leather does not seem like the type you see in shops that look like it'll peel or tear very easily, like you are scared to move in it. It also has a very nice weight to it, to keep you nice and warm, as well as the lining inside is very nice and comfortable, zippers work great as well and it is all around a very good jacket!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp Jacket', 'author': 'Tom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift to my son and he loves it. It fits well all around and the look is special. The natural leather color is smart and the weight is perfect for the cooler months in north Texas. Very pleased!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice faux leather jacket for the price.', 'author': 'TRS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 6\' 1" and 172 lbs. Originally ordered an XL mainly because I usually need extra sleeve length if Large Tall isn\'t available. The XL was a bit boxy on me and the sleeves a tad long.
