The jacket has a nice leather look and feel.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars nice but small', 'author': 'Dennis D.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'looks nice but it runs really small. i would guess about 2 sizes small', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this jacket as a surprise for my boyfriend so I had to guess the sizing based on reviews that said the arms may be tight or too long or short, he is about 6‚Äô2‚Äù and around 215 pounds, he does have broad shoulders as he was a swimmer. title: Men's Lightweight Water-Resistant Packable Hooded Puffer Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Deal! Love the compact storing feature! Stores away easily taking up no space until the next trip.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value', 'author': 'PedalingAstronomer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I first ordered a Size Medium, which fit well enough in the shoulders and chest, but was several inches too large in the waist. The design is basic, but well constructed and surprisingly warm, despite its light weight, I also ordered a Size Small to see if that would fit better.The Size Small was too tight in the shoulders and chest, but fits well in the waist. Given that they were so affordable, I ended up keeping both and layering the Medium over the Small when temperatures become dangerously low, sometimes topped by a rain shell. When not so cold and wet out, I wear the Medium over a fleece sweater, a combination that is both warm and comfortable.The hood of both sizes is generously cut with elastic around the face that helps to deflect wind. The sleeve wrists are also trimmed in elastic.I travel by bicycle in all four seasons, so am outside more than in. Breathability is low, so the jackets are too warm to wear while pedaling, but are lifesavers when I‚Äôm stationary in camp. I wear the medium when in my sleeping bag on coldest nights.All considered, these jackets are an exceptional value.For size reference, I‚Äôm male, 5‚Äô9‚Äù and 145 pounds, with a 38‚Äô chest, 29‚Äù waist, and 32‚Äù sleeves.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost a perfect fit', 'author': 'William Scott Streitfeld', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought a few similar jackets from different manufacturers and the plan was to keep the one that fit the best. This one came in second place, and I had to return it because another one fit me a little better. I ordered the small, and I am 5\'6" tall and 150 lbs with short limbs and a wide frame. Nothing fits me well, so I usually have to settle for something that is close but not perfect. This jacket fit perfectly, but the sleeves and overall length were just a little bit longer than a competitor. I honestly would have kept this jacket if I had not tried the competitor\'s, because the extra length was negligible and comfortable. Generally speaking, this jacket style runs a little long in the sleeves for people like me with short arms. Then, if you buy a size extra-small (usually not available), it\'s too tight or too short in the overall length. This is a nice, well-constructed, lightweight jacket that feels warm. It\'s much lighter than a parka but it seems like it will work for cold and wet weather around 40-45 F. The hood also fits well without a hat and it seems like a very functional go-to jacket for cold rainy weather. The wrist elastic could be a little tighter in my opinion, but it\'s basically snug around the wrist. You can probably put a few stitches in the material and make it tighter with some clever sewing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beyond 5 Stars Unmatched Excellence in the Amazon Essentials Packable Hooded Puffer Jacke', 'author': 'Hayder Alobaidi', 'rating': 5, 'content': "If I could give the this Jacket more than 5 stars, I absolutely would! It's even got a huge pocket on the inside that could literally fit a fifth or bottle of wine! 5 stars all day!üëç", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great jacket, but not quite for me', 'author': 'Gunny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love the color of this jacket (green) and the feel and the weight, but it was just one of those things where the fit didn‚Äôt quite work for me. I still think this is a great jacket and worth trying, it will likely fit and be comfortable for most people, I just have odd body dimensions. It was real nice and warm too and I love that it can be packed into a bag.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Jacket At A Great Price', 'author': 'Kirby J Flanagan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A warm comfortable mid-weight jacket with deep exterior and interior pockets with a hood. There are elastic bands at the wrist and the hood, but it would be nice to have adjustable closures at the wrist with Velcro and drawstrings on the hood for better fit. Obviously that would increase the price. But as it is, it's still a great jacket at a great price without the logo and the famous brand name.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good, but not close to great', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': "If you are looking for a insulated hoody to stand around in moderately cool temps at a great price, then this is the hoody for you. Does a decent job of keeping you warm and isn't uncomfortable.If you are looking for a jacket to move around in, look elsewhere. If you raise your arms, the jacket will come up to chest. The pits have the worst cut I have ever seen. The material is also sticky when perspetating.It works as a normal jacket, but isn't going to replace the much more expensive brands for hiking, backpacking, insulating layer, etc.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Little PUFFER Jacket That Could!', 'author': 'Brill', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This puffer jacket really surprised me - in a good way.When I first took it out of the package, I was underwhelmed. It seemed like the "puffer cells" were underinflated (or understuffed with insulation). In other words, it seemed flatter (and lighter weight) than I anticipated it would be. I wondered whether this thing would provide enough warmth in expected temperatures hovering at, or below, the freezing mark.Well, the answer turned out to be a resounding "yes". It did. This was the surprise, for as lightweight as this jacket was, for temps say in the 40\'s, this jacket and a single shirt underneath were sufficient. As the temperature dropped below freezing, I added thermal underwear and/or a fleece overshirt (depending on how long I was going to be outside) and - remarkably - the layers with the jacket kept me warm.And I\'m from Florida!I guess it\'s true: Air really is the best insulator. Because that\'s the principle behind this thing.As for being "water resistant"... exceeded expectations again. I found myself in several snowfalls hovering right around the freezing mark temperature-wise. This meant that most of the flakes ended up melting right on the jacket. True, it was somewhat damp by the time I got back to my hotel, but it was dry by morning just by hanging it in the closet.For something like $35 (on sale in late 2023) I feel I really got my money\'s worth with this little puffer!P.S. BTW, if you want to blend with the winter crowd in Europe, this jacket will do the trick. It seemed like literally 50% of people I saw while visiting various Christmas Markets in Dec 2023 (Austria, Slovakia, Poland, Germany) were wearing a black hooded puffer jacket of this type. Add in a black knit cap, light gloves, and jeans (though black) and - Voila! - you\'ll be mistaken for a local!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Good Fit and Doesn't Take Up Much Space", 'author': 'KL03', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I found this jacket to be pretty comfortable. I ended up wearing it as an outer layer while sitting around a camp fire so I wouldn't have to worry about getting burn holes in my more expensive clothing. When the temperature dropped below 0 degrees F this wasn't enough, but it was thin enough that I could easily put my more expensive winter jacket over it. It comes with a small bag that you can squeeze it into to so it doesn't take up much space when traveling.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! title: Men's Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I Take this for every plane flight!', 'author': "Mays' Healthy Lifestyle", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Amazon Essentials Men\'s Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket is easily one of my favorite Amazon Basics products. This versatile jacket has become a constant companion, especially during travel. Its "easy on, easy off" design is a game-changer, making it a breeze to put on or take off, especially during those quick transitions at airport security.What I love most is its exceptional warmth. Despite its lightweight feel, this jacket keeps me perfectly snug during chilly flights. The soft and cozy polar fleece lining is a treat for comfort, and the quarter-zip allows for temperature control. The fit is just right, providing freedom of movement without feeling bulky.The quality and durability of this jacket have truly surprised me. It\'s held up remarkably well through numerous trips and washes, which is impressive for its price point.Overall, the Amazon Essentials Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket is a travel essential. It combines practicality, comfort, and style in one package. I wouldn\'t embark on a flight without it, and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable, travel-friendly jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy and Versatile', 'author': 'Real Deal', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Amazon Essentials Men's Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket has become my go-to outerwear for staying warm and stylish during chilly days! This quarter-zip jacket offers a cozy and versatile option that perfectly fits my comfort and fashion needs.I am impressed with the high-quality construction of this polar fleece jacket, featuring soft and plush material that provides excellent insulation against the cold.The quarter-zip design allows for easy on-and-off, making it convenient to layer over shirts or wear as a standalone piece.I appreciate the stylish and timeless look of this jacket, making it suitable for various occasions, from casual outings to outdoor activities.The jacket's lightweight and breathable nature ensure comfortable wear, without feeling bulky or restricting movement.I love the attention to detail in the design, including the zippered pocket for secure storage of small essentials.In conclusion, the Amazon Essentials Men's Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket is a must-have for any man seeking a cozy and versatile outerwear option. Its high-quality construction, practical design, and stylish appearance make it a top-notch choice for chilly weather. Whether you're heading out for a hike, running errands, or simply lounging at home, this jacket will keep you warm and comfortable throughout the day. Embrace the coziness of the Amazon Essentials Men's Quarter-Zip Polar Fleece Jacket and add a touch of comfort and style to your wardrobe!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Pullover, Thin material and build.', 'author': 'FloodRunner', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the most part I really like this shirt. Not sure how I feel about the banded cuffs, kind'a wish they'd been done differently but that's nit picking. Standup collar is nice, not too short and not too tall and front pocket, whether useful or not, is something you don't see very often in a garment like this. Hasn't been washed yet so we'll see how that goes. Overall this is a good value so I'll probably buy a couple more in different colors. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket,the A-Khaki is the most faux suede realistic looking.', 'author': 'agiftforyou', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Comes wrinkles. Laundered it as directed, hung to dry and it came out looking mottled like crushed velvet or cheap velour. I thought it was ruined but more than a few minutes with a handheld steamer and it returned to presentable. I don;t know about anyone else but I don't buy an inexpensive jacket to take to the dry cleaners.I will say that I am spoiled after 20 years with a nice, soft easily mistaken for a suede jacket that laundered like a champ, wore well, had an inside pocket but got old.Overall this is a decent, inexpensive faux suede jacket but it remains to be seen how long I'll tolerate the extra maintenance. title: Men's Watertight II Rain Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent rain jacket', 'author': 'HB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for my friend who is a tour guide on the Inca trail in Peru. It‚Äôs sharp looking, slim fit, lightweight, breathable and waterproof. Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars More Than a Rain Jacket', 'author': 'Adam Hu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A Review of the Columbia Men‚Äôs Watertight Rain JacketThe Columbia Men‚Äôs Watertight Rain Jacket is a lightweight waterproof jacket with a slim design. As the name suggests, the jacket is very much capable of keeping you dry on a rainy day; however, its value goes way beyond a rain coat. Here are several features that make this jacket a wonderful addition to your wardrobe.Waterproof and WindproofThis jacket is truly waterproof. It helps you stay clean and dry even in the pouring rain. With the waterproof technology comes the wonderful stain repellent feature. No matter how dirty the jacket gets during a rainy day, a simple wipe is enough to take care of it. The windproof feature provides an extra protection against the cold. Meanwhile, the fabric is still breathable that it allows moisture vapor to move away from the skin. The only downside is that the waterproof feature can post difficulty when it comes to washing this jacket. You may find a pouch of water when you take it out of the washer. An extra cycle of drying will take care of the issue if this ever occurs.DesignThis jacket is lined with a soft layer of mesh and is very light weight. The longer arm length and body length provide enough coverage to keep you dry no matter how hard the wind is blowing. The hood comes out far enough forward to shield your face while the drawstring helps keep the hood on even in strong wind. Two front pockets with zipper are big enough to protect a phone, a wallet, a set of keys, and even a pair of gloves from getting rained on. The slim design delivers a more modern look than its competitors, helping you keep the style even on an awfully crummy day. Meanwhile, the jacket is still generous with space around your chest so that you always have enough room for a sweater or a hoodie or even a coat. Another notable feature is that the entire jacket can be packed into the front left pocket, which comes with a double-sided zipper.VersatilityFew jackets are as versatile as this one. The waterproof and windproof features make this jacket practically perfect for a fishing trip. The breathable fabric makes sure that you can throw this jacket over your favorite tee on a rainy day in the middle of the summer. You can also layer up under this jacket for fall or winter use. The matt finish and the slick look ensure that no one knows you are using a rain jacket as a spring/fall windbreaker. You can also use this jacket to protect your pea coat from getting wet on a snow day.Overall, the Columbia Men‚Äôs Watertight Rain Jacket is a high quality jacket that can be worn in many occasions. It surely has room for improvements. But for the price you are paying, you can hardly find a better deal than this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Greqlat quality wind breaker.', 'author': 'Saqib', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect fit, good for rain and wind breaker.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good fit, quality', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've ordered rain gear before on Amazon, and I've always been disappointed with the cheap plastic feel of the off-brands. I decided to get the better quality Columbia jacket this time, and I'm happy with it. I went with the medium because I don't like an overly baggy coat. The fit is perfect. I'm 6 ft and slim build. The arm lengths are just right. It is a light weight sturdy jacket. Good for keeping you dry, but probably not too warm (nice for hiking).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket & good value', 'author': 'AJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits perfectly and seems like a well made product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Watertight? Check', 'author': 'Scott Craven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When you name your jacket for its main function, it better do just that. Good news, the coat lived up to the billing. There are a couple of velcro bindings along the zipper, making for a tight seal. It fit a little loose, which I liked because I could wear a warmer jacket underneath on days as cold as they are wet. The hood flaps a bit in light wind, but I can live with that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I was expecting', 'author': 'Ruiz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have owned one of these jackets for over 15 years, and have loved it. The interior lining began deteriorating recently, little white specs, all over everything whenever you wore it. Ordered a new one, same size and color as I had, and it is exactly the same size and cut as my original. I say this because I have read reviews about the fitting and sizing. I am 5 foot eight 160 pounds and have a 39 inch chest, and the medium is absolutely perfect. It is only a raincoat people, not a jacket, very thin and light and packable. I hope to get 15 years out of this new one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Durable weather jacket', 'author': 'Ra', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Stayed dry for hours in the rain... title: Men's Loose Fit Firm Duck Insulated Flannel-Lined Active Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Carhartt for the win!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an amazing jacket. I needed a nice, heavy winter jacket for the cold and windy coastal Santa Cruz weather after moving to college, so I wanted something that would keep me warm but also look cute. This jacket is exactly what I wanted. I get compliments almost every time I wear it and now all my friends want one!Pricing:I don‚Äôt usually spend more than $30 on clothing, but I really wanted this jacket, so I decided to splurge a little. Plus, Carhartt is a reliable brand, so I know it will last me a very long time. I looked into a few other brands (Dickies, Patagonia, etc.), but I felt that Carhartt was a better fit for what I was looking for. I considered getting a jacket from Dickies ($139.99) that was close to identical, but I decided to go with Carhartt ($109) because not only was it more cost-efficient, but it seemed warmer and more stylish as well.Pros:The jacket is nice and warm without being too heavy and goes with almost any outfit. I also love that Carhartt tends to look even better with a little wear and tear over time, unlike some other brands. This way I don‚Äôt have to treat it like a new pair of white shoes and be worried about getting a little scuff or dirt on it. It is extremely durable, so if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for, look no further!Potential Cons:You should be aware that when you first get the jacket it may feel bulky and tough, but it is easy to break in. I washed it a couple of times according to the instructions on the tag and it is much better now. It was a bit big on me (as I was expecting), so I threw it in the dryer after I washed it and it did shrink a little bit, but definitely not too much. For reference, I am 5‚Äô2 and 110 lbs and I got the mens small. It is still a little big on me even after shrinking it, but that‚Äôs exactly what I was aiming for. The zipper can be a little sticky at times, but it hasn‚Äôt been a big issue for me so far. One thing you should know is that it is not waterproof or water-resistant. I wore it in the rain once and the water soaked right through the outer shell. Still not a problem for me though! Just thought I‚Äôd mention it.Overall:Overall it's an amazing jacket and is one of my favorite clothing items that I own. I don‚Äôt know how I went all this time without it! High quality, plenty of pockets, comfy, warm and stylish. I definitely recommend getting this jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money!', 'author': 'Shanon DeWitt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this jacket for a Big&Tall gentleman, and it fit perfectly. The quality of the material is superior, nice and thick but soft. Very durable exterior and will make for a great outdoor work coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars first impressions are great', 'author': 'J. Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s big. It\'s warm. It feels very tough. You will look more intimidating (not what I wanted, but there it is). I got fed up with cheap things not working right and giving out after a year. So I bought this. It\'s a bit costly, for my budget.I\'m 6\'2", 300 lbs. I wear mostly 3xl, sometimes 4xl. I bought the 3xl jacket. There is some room to spare, but the fit is very good. It is long enough, and I can move easily in it. It is bulky and sweeps things off counters and tables as I pass by. It is warm, quite warm. The exterior feels almost like canvas. Brand new, it is fairly stiff. The hood is stiff, and I had to persuade it to stay down. Again, I assume time will ease the stiffness somewhat. The interior is soft flannel. Waist and wrists have elastic to keep snow out, but they do not chafe. Overall very comfortable. It has a plasticky, painty scent that I assume will fade with washing. Strong metal zipper. Two pockets are inside, one zipper the other velcro. They are each big enough to hold my Kindle. This looks like an excellent jacket. I will update if anything surprising happens.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My son was ecstatic.!!', 'author': 'Owl Glasses', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'd call this a 'heritage coat,' as the quality is so very wonderful, these are often handed down from father to son. This was a dream of my sons for a long time. It was a most wonderful holiday gift. We are having a very cold winter throughout much of the US. It keeps him toasty even on the long walks he's fond of. It would take a lot to sustain any damage to it as the materials used are of the highest quality. It's great for a date, even better for hard work. I will never regret buying this for my dear son. And it is just so flattering for any man to wear. He loves it and I love it that he's so over the moon. Carhartt is a long-honored brand for a reason!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!', 'author': 'Care Raine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cheapest price I‚Äôve found for these this year. My fianc√© was in need of a new coat and mentioned carhartt to me, I searched for a couple months. Finally got this and it came so fast and is perfect. Definitely a little big for a medium but most carhartt loose-fit items do run a little bigger, I‚Äôd recommend small if you normally wear a medium in shirts and want a tighter fit. He says it‚Äôs perfect however, great for wearing layers underneath and very warm!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Material hard, stiff, and crunchy', 'author': 'Eileen Lauer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôm sending this back because the material is so stiff and hard. title: Men's Waterproof Ski Jacket Warm Winter Snow Coat Mountain Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Fayth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was very skeptical about this brand since I never really heard of it but I went ahead and tried it. I like the material. It is warm and comfortable to wear. It is water resistant but make sure you have the hood on or it gets wet from the top part easily. I love the storage compartments. It's easy to put my phone in and wallet inside the coat. It didn't slide out easily but it looks like it might if you jostle it hard enough. If I have any issues I'll comeBack and add to the review but for now it's a great coat!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ghostbusters Frozen Empire Base Model', 'author': 'Adam Nori', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this jacket as there is a surge of PKE behind a red winter coat and the Ghostbusters community in anticipation for the upcoming, GHOSTBUSTERS FROZEN EMPIRE film coming March 22, 2024.The community has sold out of these coats since the first trailer showing the new gear for the hero actors late 2023. There have been a lot of base models used but for me, I needed something sporty, action filled, and easy to modify.This jacket at the price point fit the bill with the look and feel of the coat that I hope to achieve.The jacket came fast and was packed well. I did remove the hood with the easy snap system and threw that in a closet to be lost to time and space. I also cut out the snow shield elastic barrier in the coat as it was restrictive. I get where this would help keep in heat and keep snow out if you were skiing or snowboarding.The coat is warm and will serve it's duty well in Northern Minnesota's often frigid temps. I highly recommend this jacket for the purpose of being stylish and a great winter coat.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm and stylish', 'author': 'Andoria King', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Really great coat, looks great is very warm, I probably got a size too big cause I wasn't sure how small it would run but still looks great, and brand new, only weird thing is it came from the distribution center in a very dusty old clear bag with holes that looked like it had been used several times and was a old comforter bag, but the cost was brand new and undamaged.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I got one to fit on 2nd try', 'author': 'madmex71', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I was looking for a light but warm winter jacket, so I went with this one. It has sufficient pockets, zipper works well, hood attaches by zipper. The hem drawcord works well, this is nice feature to keep jacket close to the body. This jacket is exactly what I was looking for, its warm enough for 20 degree + or add another layer to stay warm if going to be still outside. If you\'re out being active, then this would be more than sufficient in less than 20 degrees.It does block wind, it does repel water/snow well. I saw comments in reviews about chemical smell, I did not experience this. I did wash it once & hung it to dry with no issues.My only issue was fit. Size charts listed were confusing, contradicting but based on one of the size charts & my measurements, I ordered an XL. This was too big! I returned it & tried again.I\'m 5\'8" 170 lbs, normal build. I was hesitant but went with a medium 2nd time around. The Medium fit perfect. Overall, I\'m happy with purchase', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great warm jacket', 'author': 'Floyd Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great jacket warm it is waterproof and fits comfortably it's not too heavy", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfort and warmth', 'author': 'John W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a great jacket for the cost. I was very warm during a very cold ski trip', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size runs small (3XL=2XL), warm, & long', 'author': 'LV CFW Retiree', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wear 2XL, this needed 3XL to fit. Nice and long! Velcro a good replacement for snaps when you do not need fully zipped up. Snow/draft bottom barrier tight if snapped!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I needed', 'author': 'Selena', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I needed a jacket for cold winter visits to my family in Tennessee and Canada. Being a native Floridian, I don't do cold. The stretch band inside the jacket around the waist is nice to keep heat in. The inner lining is super soft. I ordered a 2X incase I needed to layer and it will definitely allow that. My only issue is since the zipper is so low I had trouble getting leverage. I am short and stocky and the coat is longer on me, but it should be easily solved with either some braided or tied paracord attached.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Probably the first 5 star I have given', 'author': 'Seattledave', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a ski jacket that is over twenty years old and still in pretty good shape. It has served me well. However it is time to replace it. When purchased this jacket cost around $200 and included what was, at the time, hi-tek design and materials (in todays dollar that would mean more than doubling the price). .I just received this new jacket costing around $40 (Amazon deal). Having used it once, I am most impressed.First, some comparisons to my old jacket: both jackets are well designed. Seams are all straight and tight. Its length (I was a bit concerned about this as the seller did not provide dimension information) is perfect hanging just below the hips. While my old jacket had velcro wrist bands, the new one improves on how they are used and avoids inner materials from bunching.The jacket has an internal set of snaps with a snow band to keep warm air inside the chest area and snow out when in deep snow or when one falls. The design allows for a loose or tube fit or a way to have a form fitting wear. I also noted that this new jacket is noticeably lighter than my old oneThe materials and design allow for heat retention, even in windy conditions, probably down to the sub teens and significant wind.My old jacket pre-dates smart phones and electronically sensitive ski passes. The new one has all the pockets I need to store phones, passes, ear buds, gloves and other items and still look good.Given the price point, I am not taking off any stars for zippers. However, if the seller wants to improve this jacket that is where I would put a few extra bucks: better quality of zipper and a two way front panel zipper.Hope you all enjoy this coat as much as I will.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice', 'author': 'Robert Wayne Kifer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It keep me warm in this winter weather like none of my other winter coats did. I appreciate that u can snap to top of it and connect the Velcro to cover your nose and mouth!A++++', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars My old jacket was showing it's age...", 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My old Levi jacket has been around the block many (many...) times and was wearing at the cuffs and collar. This new one is just like the old one (except not so worn and faded). The big pockets (inside) were a necessity for me to hold all the important items (check book, phone, etc.). Levi is always a good looking jacket and I am glad to have a new one at a fair price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Took 3 tries to get this right', 'author': 'Toni Rose S. Joaquin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Purchased for my husband who is 6\' and about 175 lbs. and typically wears between sizes medium and large, depending on how he wants it to fit and the brand. I ordered a Levi & Strauss Co. Gold Label Signature Trucker jacket. Not sure how the "Gold Label" classification differs from other Levi lines.First try: ordered a larger size as per reviewers recommendations. The sleeve length was fine, but the torso was short (above the waist) and boxy. Returned.Second try: ordered the "correct size" (medium), but was still incorrectly sent a large. Returned.Third try: The prices are now increasing, so I had to settle for a different color - a medium faded blue. The fit is fine (sleeve length is correct, torso hits a little longer than the waist, which is my husband\'s preference). The fabric is not super stiff or too thick, so it has good layering options. I received what I would expect of a basic denim trucker jacket. My only dissatisfaction is the color. The photo represents it as more faded, which gives it a more vintage look. The color I was sent is the classic denim blue. I believe this was sent to me by mistake, but I\'m tired of trying to get the right product, and I\'m generally satisfied with this. It\'s not a bad color, and will fade with time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Always Levi', 'author': 'Sandi r', 'rating': 4, 'content': "If you want a great looking jacket, this is it. My hubby loves it! He mentioned he would like a new denim jacket. I surprised him on Valentine's day! Perfect, after I exchanged xl for large. Don't followed their size chart. It runs big.Only downer was the package was just a plastic see through bag. My surprise was ruined. He took it out of the mailbox, so my presentation was a plastic bag, instead of gift wrap!NOT COOL AMAZON........YOU LOSE A STAR", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Lightweight and weatherproof. Super comfortable and a bargain at that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket - The Search is Over', 'author': 'E. A. Jacques', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have been looking for a good spring\\fall jacket like this one for a long time. I had one years ago and my son borrowed it and of course left it somewhere and I have been on a search for a replacement ever since. I have purchased at least three replacement and none of them had the qualities I was looking for similar to my old one - comfortable fit, wrinkle resistant, wind resistant and easy to clean. This jacket has all that and more.I ended up purchasing two jackets that seemed to fit the bill, this one and the London Fog Men's Auburn Zip Front Mesh Lined Golf Jacket. I could not decide between the two so I got them both and ended up sending back the London Fog. So this is somewhat a comparison review between the two.The London Fog had a few nice features I liked over this one, the sleeves were a bit longer and did not have cuffs, and the pockets had a zippered pocket next to a regular open pocket which I thought was pretty slick. Plus the front zipper was hidden which gave it a nice look. But it was a bit short and the mesh lining did not feel good against the skin. The main reason I went with this jacket though was the microfiber material. It came out of the shipping bag with virtually no wrinkles and what it did have disappeared in minutes after unpacking. The London Fog in no way could compare when it comes to being wrinkle free and that is what I liked most about my old jacket. You can wad this jacket into a ball and tuck it in a drawer for a day, pull it out, give it a shake and you're ready to go. It's that wrinkle resistant. The lining on this jacket is much more comfortable against the skin too. Very comfy to wear even when driving.At first I did not think I would like the stretch style cuffs and waist band, but now that I have worn it for a bit I like it a lot. I carry a concealed weapon and it helps hide any bulges nicely. I also wear a lot of shirts that do not tuck so when I go out I curl them up under the waist band until I get where I'm going. It works out well.The jacket is perfect for cool mornings when I walk into work from our company parking structure where it can get pretty cool. Even when it's 70+ degrees it's not too uncomfortable to put on for the walk back to the car after work. It keeps you pretty warm down to the mid 40's no problem. It breaks the wind well and while it's not waterproof it does the job when there is a light rain and dries quickly afterwards. I keep it in the back seat of my car so it's there when needed. You could easily use it as a golf jacket, but I don't since the sleeves are a wee bit short for that. Not to short for normal wear but to swing a golf club it would feel restrictive. But I have very long arms so it's common for me to deal with this problem, if you have more normal length arms, it would work well for this too.I like it so much I plan to get a second one of a different color. I have had more than one person comment on how nice a jacket it is so there is that. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a stylish, practical spring/fall jacket. If you have any questions feel free to let me know, I'd be happy to help with your buying decision.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The jacket is a perfect solution for weather during the spring and the fall. The material and color is beautiful. Fits as it should. First time wearing it I received many compliments. The quality and appearance is one of a jacket twice its price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Close enough to the original', 'author': 'Wcskjb', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this same Weatherproof golf jacket when it was on sale in a store about 15 years ago. I paid $20 for it back then, and have been looking to replace it at a decent price. I ordered this one, and it seems to be mostly as well made as the original. The color, which I'd describe as olive, is a bit lighter than the other one, and zipper doesn't seem quite as sturdy, but I'm still expecting good things. The seams, cuffs and collar all look they were sewn the same way. My ratings, as always, are based on the transaction quality and my first inspection of the item. I'm not making any claims about how well it will hold up. The collar, cuffs and hem is elastic and offers a good amount of stretch without binding. The lining on my sample is brown and not white as pictured in the product listing. The zipper, is just ok. I had hoped it was a more heavy duty zipper. The stitching looks to be fine. The two side pockets are deep, but the material is the same as the lining and it\'s a bit thin. I can feel the elastic band through the pockets. If the pockets were slightly higher and a little shallower, I think I wouldn\'t have notice it as much. The fit is about as expected. I can picture this jacket with a sports team logo on it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My wife said I look, "cool"', 'author': 'T. Page', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've literally never owned a piece of clothing that my wife commented on it that I looked cool. It's a unique experience for me there for sure.The fit on the jacket is great. Just as I'd expect. I'm an XL comfortably, so a bit loose, and it fits just as well for that. title: Men's Ecosmart Fleece Sweatshirt, Cotton-blend Pullover, Crewneck Sweatshirt for Men, 1 Or 2 Pack Available
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great value', 'author': 'Julian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Hanes Men's Ecosmart Fleece Sweatshirt has become a cherished addition to my casual wardrobe, providing a perfect blend of comfort, warmth, and eco-conscious design. This sweatshirt from Hanes has not only met but exceeded my expectations, offering a cozy and sustainable option for everyday wear.The standout feature of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt is its commitment to sustainability. Crafted from a blend of cotton and recycled polyester fibers, this sweatshirt exemplifies Hanes' dedication to reducing environmental impact. The use of recycled materials not only contributes to a softer feel but also aligns with the growing demand for eco-friendly fashion choices.Comfort is paramount when it comes to a fleece sweatshirt, and the Hanes Ecosmart delivers in spades. The cotton-polyester blend creates a plush and soft texture against the skin, ensuring a cozy and comfortable fit. The fleece lining adds an extra layer of warmth, making it an ideal choice for cooler weather or casual lounging.The fit of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt strikes a balance between relaxed and tailored. It provides enough room for easy movement without appearing overly baggy. The ribbed cuffs and hem contribute to the overall structure, ensuring that the sweatshirt retains its shape even after multiple wears and washes.Durability is a key strength of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt. The double-needle stitching on the neckline, cuffs, and hemline adds reinforcement, enhancing the sweatshirt's longevity. I've found that it holds up well to regular washing, maintaining its color vibrancy and shape over time.Versatility is another notable feature of this sweatshirt. Whether paired with jeans for a casual outing or thrown over workout gear for added warmth, the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt seamlessly transitions between various occasions. The availability of a wide range of colors ensures that there's a shade to suit every style preference.The affordability of the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt makes it an attractive choice for those seeking quality comfort without breaking the bank. The accessible price point, coupled with the sweatshirt's durability and sustainability features, positions it as a practical and budget-friendly option for a broad range of consumers.The purchase experience was hassle-free, with the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt readily available in many retail outlets and online platforms. The consistent sizing and clear care instructions add to the overall positive experience, making it easy to incorporate this sweatshirt into my regular rotation.In conclusion, the Hanes Men's Ecosmart Fleece Sweatshirt has earned its place as a reliable and sustainable go-to in my wardrobe. Its comfort, durability, and commitment to eco-friendly practices make it a standout choice for those seeking both coziness and conscientious design. Whether you prioritize comfort, sustainability, or a combination of both, the Hanes Ecosmart Sweatshirt offers a winning formula for a timeless and versatile wardrobe essential.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fleece sweatshirt', 'author': 'Sally Skole', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this to wear around the house. It fits exactly as expected, washes up great and it's comfortable. The sweatshirt is what you expect when you think of sweatshirts (sturdy and cottony) and the waistband and wristbands are good quality. The white is fresh and clean looking and a good tone of white. I wear the shirt quite a bit and it's great!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and comfy', 'author': 'Sullivan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hanes quality.Colors as shown, attractive.Super soft.Material is thinner than some others, but durable and warm --but not for extreme cold winter warmth unless layering.Runs just a little large, as a sweatshirt should.Already bought more!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable but Prone to Pilling', 'author': 'Aiden Robertson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The Hanes Crewneck is a comfortable and versatile piece of clothing. The fabric is soft, the fit is true to size, and the tagless design enhances the overall comfort. The range of available colors is also a plus.However, one issue I‚Äôve noticed is that the shirt tends to pill after a few washes. Pilling refers to the formation of small, fuzzy balls on the surface of the fabric. It‚Äôs a common problem with many types of clothing, especially those made from synthetic fibers. While it doesn‚Äôt affect the comfort or fit of the shirt, it can make it look worn out and old.Despite this, I still believe the Hanes Crewneck offers good value for the price. It‚Äôs not perfect, but it‚Äôs a reliable, everyday shirt. Just be prepared for some pilling after a few washes. If Hanes could address this issue, it would greatly enhance the longevity and appearance of their crewnecks.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I really like the texture', 'author': 'Rachelle', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got these shirts for work, one in 'deep red' and one in 'denim blue', to wear in colder weather. I usually wear sizes in the neighborhood of women's 2 - 3x, so I figured a men's 2x would do the trick. It fits very comfortably and did not appear to shrink at all after being washed. The sleeves are a touch long but that is alright. The feel of the fabric is very pleasant especially the inside of the shirt, which is very soft and cozy. I can be picky about fabric textures sometimes due to sensitivities, but this was nice enough that I almost didn't want to take it off. I'm quite happy with them, work said the blue I got wasn't quite the right shade (though they were happy with the red one) and while I suppose I could have returned it I liked it enough that I was happy to keep it for personal use. Very happy with my purchase. :)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great price/quality', 'author': 'G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'They run a little small, so go up one size.Very comfortable, wrinkle free and looks solid.Can‚Äôt beat the price. Ordering more.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good purchase', 'author': 'Genia Turner', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'soft ,thin but nice .size is true', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Several things to be aware of', 'author': 'A.J.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'FOR REFERENCE: I bought 2 of the sweatshirts in Stonewash Green, sizes Medium and Large.My intent was to find something reasonably priced, warm, and comfy to wear - mainly so I could quickly put together a basic, casual, and decent looking outfit that was suitable to wear in public. I wanted a sweatshirt I could launder at least 15 times before it became too worn out looking to try to wear at a social event. Even after the appearance degraded, I still wanted the sweatshirt to remain warm, comfy, and in tact so I could wear it while lounging inside my home or during other situations that didn\'t require me to look quite as put together.I\'m a female, 5\'6 tall, about 115 lbs, 32C bra size, 26 inch waist, and 36.5 inch hips. I have slightly broader shoulders and a slightly longer torso than the average female of my size. I have a slender build.I wanted one sweatshirt to fit pretty loose (for layering and comfort) and another to have a trendy oversized looked.I definitely should have bought larger sizes, and I don\'t think these sweatshirts will hold up the way I had hoped.MAIN THOUGHTS: Overall quality is "barely okay." (I guess it really depends on how you intend to use this sweatshirt and the pricing. You may find the quality to be acceptable... or very disappointing.) Shrinks a lot after just one wash - almost by a size and a half. Shrinkage is more drastic in the length of the body and sleeves, but also affects the width. Overall, does not launder well under "normal conditions." You may have to be very careful to avoid any heat or abrasiveness to keep this sweatshirt looking its best for as long as possible. (Not worth the effort, IMO.) Stains show easily on this particular color and are surprisingly difficult to remove. Possible dye issues. The large sweatshirt came out with what appears to be bleached/faded spots on the bottom banding. (We don\'t use bleach or a lot of harsh chemicals in my home due to allergies and skin sensitivity issues. So, I\'m not sure how this occured. No other clothing item came out of the laundry with the same problem.) Already noticed some slight pilling in spots. Barely noticeable now, but this is only after one laundry session. Sweatshirts aren\'t very warm, but they are comfortable (as long as you get the correct size).If you choose to buy this sweatshirt, I\'d recommend you buy 1-2 sizes larger to account for shrinkage and to allow for layering. If you only plan to wear a thin tank top underneath, you probably don\'t need to size up too much. But if you plan to wear a long sleeve thermal underneath and still want a loose fit, I\'d go up 2 sizes.MORE SPECIFIC DETAILS: This sweatshirt is between light-weight and mid-weight thickness. It\'s more suitable to wear during chilly/cooler days in the Fall or Spring. It\'s not enough to keep someone warm during very cold Winter weather without adding several layers underneath and on top.I wore both sweatshirts twice before washing them. Once with only a tank top underneath, and once with a thin long sleeve thermal underneath. Then I machine washed them in semi-warm water and dried them on medium heat (being careful not to leave them in the dryer more than necessary).BEFORE LAUNDERING: Both sweatshirts felt slightly rough (nothing really bothersome or too noticeable) and disappointingly thin. The color was as expected - a lovely muted, pale green. One sweatshirt arrived with excess threads hanging from the bottom. But I was able to safely cut them off without risk of anything unraveling. I liked the way both tops fit and draped. The sizes were as I hoped they would be. I accidentally spilled a cold, milky coffee drink on the smaller sweatshirt. I treated it with a pre-wash stain remover. Then threw both sweatshirts in the washer with a pair of jeans and no-lint sports towel (all similar colors as the sweatshirts).AFTER LAUNDERING: Both tops became softer and slightly fluffier after washing. This made them feel a bit thicker and warmer. Both were noticably smaller, though. The large top now fits similar to the way the medium used to fit. Except it\'s a tad bit shorter. Both tops no longer drape the way they did before I washed them. It\'s not a huge issue for me, though. The banding on both tops also shrank a bit. I no longer like the way the medium fits me. Prior to washing, the end of the sleeves reached halfway down my fingers. The sleeve cuffs were loose enough that I could have them drape that way, but just snug enough that I could pull them back around my wrists. Now the wrist cuffs sit snuggly around my wrists. When I reach for items above my head, the sleeves pull back a bit, exposing more of my wrists... and the waist hem rides up so that I have to yank it down when I drop my arms back down to my sides. (That\'s how badly the top shrank in length after just one wash!) The brown color from where I spilled my coffee on the medium top was gone, but there\'s still a visible stain. It just looks a couple shades darker than the sweatshirt color... like I spilled water on myself and it\'s starting to dry a bit. (I\'m going to try a different stain remover and wash it again. Hopefully it works, otherwise this top will permanently look dirty.) As I already mentioned, the larger top had some pale pumkin-yellow spots on the lower banding - similar to what bleach spots would look like. I\'m okay with the fit of the larger size sweatshirt even after it shrank. So, it\'s a shame that the color bled the way it did.Overall, I\'m disappointed with my purchases. These are already going to be dedicated lounging and housework shirts. They are a bit warmer and very soft inside, which is nice. And nothing has unraveled, so it seems the stitching is good. I don\'t think these would be great for screen-printing, simply because of the amount of shrinkage and the fact that they\'re already showing signs of pilling in areas that don\'t get much friction.Hope this info helps. If anything, these aren\'t bad sweatshirts to have on hand to adapt to temperature fluctuations. They\'re stretchy, so they\'re easy to quickly throw on as an extra layer and take off as needed. Just be mindful they leave some lint behind on 100% cotton shirts. The lint problem will probably diminish after a few washes, though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice, casual, medium weight sweatshirt.', 'author': 'N. HALL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hanes has been around for eons...I proudly wore their tighy-whities as a kid...and I\'m sure may kids still do. I think this is the first garment I\'ve owned by them that was NOT underwear...but I like it a lot. It\'s not too thck or heavy...but definitely not flimsy or thin. It\'s kind of in that Goldilocks weight for just casual, being a slug around the house...or maybe going for a jog if it\'s cool out (haha...I don\'t EVER jog...was talking about someone else). it\'s very soft insude...which I expect will "pill up" a little with several washings/dryings...but that\'s par for the course with sweatshirts. Being that it\'s a 50/50 blend, it didn\'t shrunk 2 sizes as 100% cotton garments often will...and I love that I CAN throw it in the dryer without worrying about that. Many a clothing item of mine has slipped past my noticing...and inadvertently gone into the dryer...and then were instantly retired for being too small. Don\'t get me wrong...this is not something that you\'re going to wear to that 3-Michelin-star restaurant you were going to propose to you girlfriend at (don\'t do it...>50% of marriages fail)...but it\'s perfect for the upcoming Super Bowl...or the like.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's all my teenage son wears to school atm!", 'author': 'JBKB', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These fits relaxed, hang nice without being bulky. My son is very particular about how sweatshirts fit and he\'s a big dude for 16 years old at 6\' 3" with broad shoulders. We ordered an XXL, and he likes that they are oversized but he\'s not swimming in them, and they are not tight around his upper arms or across his chest. I\'ve ordered them three times now to stock up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Cotton Lightweight Multi Pockets Zip Front Stand Collar Military Jackets Windbreaker
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars EXTREMELY WELL MADE JACKET, KUDOS!!', 'author': 'K. J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I HAVE TO SAY, THIS IS ONE REALLY NICE LOOKING JACKET! I\'M EXTREMELY SURPRISED JUST HOW WELL MADE AND COMFORTABLE IT IS. FOR THE PRICE I EXPECTED FAR LESS. I LOOKED IT OVER AND THE SEWING IS VERY GOOD, SEAMS ARE STRAIGHT, THE CUFFS AND WAIST BAND ARE ALL TOP NOTCH. THE FIT IS SPOT ON. A LOT OF TIMES THE ACTUAL SIZE OF JACKETS SOLD (HERE), RUN POSSIBLY 2 / 21/2 INCHES SMALLER. BUT I WEAR A SIZE XXL AMERICAN MADE JACKET AND THIS SIZE XXL FITS ME JUST FINE!! THE ARM LENGTH OF THE SLEEVES ARE QUITE LONG. AND, THE OVERALL LENGTH OF THE JACKET HANGS RIGHT AT MY WAIST. THE ZIPPERED POCKETS ACTUALLY ARE WORKING POCKETS! THE AREN\'T DEEP, BUT COULD HOLD A KEY FOB OR SOME SCREWS OR NAILS IF YOU\'RE PIDDLING WITH A WEEKEND PROJECT OUTSIDE. BACK TO THE ZIPPER UPPER ISSUE YOU MIGHT\'VE READ ABOUT IN OTHER REVIEWS. THE LEFT SIDE ZIPPER IS NOT A MALE / FEMALE THING OR A LEFT-HANDED/ RIGHT HANDED THING EITHER. IT\'S A EUROPEAN / ASIAN VERSUS NORTH AMERICAN THING!!! ON OUR SIDE OF THE BIG PONDS THE SLIDER ( OR PIN ) PRETTY MUCH HAS BEEN UNIVERSALLY PUT ON THE RIGHT SIDE ( THESE DAYS, BOTH MEN AND WOMEN ). BUT, OVERSEAS, IT\'S THE OPPOSITE, THE SLIDER GOES ON THE LEFT SIDE. THE THING WITH THESE JACKETS IS THAT THE MANUFACTURER HAD DESIGNED AND BUILT THESE JACKETS FOR AN OVERSEAS SALES DESTINATION. HOWEVER, THEY PROBABLY SAW AN OPPORTUNITY TO SELL TO THE AMERICAN MARKET AND HAVE SINCE STARTED TO SELL HERE. ALSO, THEY PROBABLY SAW NO ADDED VALUE TO MAKE BOTH LH AND RH ZIPPERS. SO, IF YOU WANT ONE OF THESE JACKETS, YOU DEAL WITH THE ZIPPER. I TELL YOU, ONCE YOU ZIP IT UP, NO ONE ELSE WILL KNOW BUT YOU .???? THE COLOR OF THIS GREY JACKET IS PERFECT THE MAIN POCKETS ARE PLENTY DEEP ENOUGH AND THERE\'S AN INSIDE POCKET ON THE WEARERS LEFT SIDE. OVERALL, I\'M A BIG GUY, GRAVITY HAS DROPPED MY BIG CHEST STRAIGHT DOWN TO MY WAIST! NOW, IT\'S A 54 INCH CHEST AND (GULP) GUT!! THIS JACKET ZIPS RIGHT UP, NO WORRIES! JUST DON\'T KNOW WHAT ELSE ANYONE COULD ASK FOR CONSIDERING THE PRICE. I LIKE IT SO MUCH, I THINK I\'M GOING TO ASK FOR THE DARK KHAKI JACKET FOR CHRISTMAS üéÑ! ( I\'LL ACT SURPRISED ) !! BUY ONE, THEY\'RE WORTH YOUR HARD EARNED CASHOLA!!LASTLY, THE ANSWER IS " NO " I WAS NOT COMPENSATED BY ANYBODY FOR THIS REVIEW!!!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket', 'author': 'Regeneration', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was surprised to see how good this jacket is. Quality fabric! thick and warm. Runs a bit big so you should size down (if you're Medium in regular shirts, take the Small size for a slim fit). The sleeves aren't insanely long, which is a relief. Looks good, feels like, and well-priced. Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Stylish Jacket with Fit and Zipper Quirks', 'author': 'George', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I fell for this jacket\'s military style ‚Äì the sharp collar and structured shoulders are totally my vibe. But being a tall, lean guy with a bit of muscle, getting the right size turned into quite the saga. At 6\'4" and a lean/athletic 245 lb build, nailing the right size meant playing Goldilocks with not one, not two, but three different jacket purchases. The large was laughably small, the XL nailed the sleeve length but was tight across the shoulders and baggy around the waist, and the XXL settled the shoulder issue but left me swimming in sleeve and torso fabric. If only more manufacturers offered tall sizes. You‚Äôd be surprised how many of us there are out there that would buy more online if those existed.Tailoring was the secret sauce to making the XXL work, a necessity for the style-conscious athletic build.Now, let\'s talk about the zipper ‚Äì it\'s the bane of this otherwise great jacket. I want to say it\'s a 50-50 shot whether I\'ll be zipping smoothly or stuck in place. In reality, it happens about 9/10 times. Despite foreseeing this from reviews, the annoyance was real. It\'s likely getting swapped out soon. After some adjustments, the jacket\'s look is a win, making the extra effort worthwhile.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The thickness and size', 'author': 'Sti', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The jacket is very nice. Many pockets and looks great.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great spring/fall jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's nice looking and well-crafted jacket with a heavy-duty zipper and many pockets. The one I ordered fit perfectly, however if yours doyI would definitely return it for the right size, but I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll have to if you measure before you order. I just love it. I wear a scarf with it and it‚Äôs a sharp looking jacket. I have never liked coats going below the waist so this is exactly what I eant for winter. It would be cool if they had a leather version of it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket, but.....', 'author': 'Tim7', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Nice looking jacket, but for a men's jacket the zipper toggle is on the wrong side. title: Men's Jacket - Weather Resistant Fleece Lined Softshell Coat - Lightweight Casual Jacket for Men (S-XXL)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks Great On Me!', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It is introducing the Perry Ellis Men's Jacket‚Äîa versatile outerwear essential tailor-made for guys like you.Finding the perfect jacket can be challenging, standing tall at 6 feet and weighing in at 200 pounds with an athletic frame. But fear not, because the large size of this jacket fits like a dream on you. Its thoughtfully crafted design accommodates your height and muscular build with ease, providing a comfortable and flattering fit that's just right.Picture this: as you slip into the jacket, you immediately notice how it hugs your frame in all the right places. The sleeves are perfect, reaching just past your wrists without feeling too short or long. The shoulders have ample room to move, allowing you to go about your day quickly. The body of the jacket drapes smoothly over your torso, offering a sleek and streamlined silhouette that complements your athletic physique.But the best part? Despite its tailored fit, this jacket doesn't sacrifice comfort. Thanks to its lightweight construction and flexible fabric, you can move freely and comfortably throughout the day without feeling restricted. Whether running errands around town or embarking on an outdoor adventure, this jacket keeps up with your active lifestyle every step of the way.So, if you're in the market for a jacket that looks as good as it feels, look no further than the Perry Ellis Men's Jacket. Awesome value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value and performance', 'author': 'Perfwise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with this jacket. I live on the side of a volcano in Hawaii, tropical and extremely wet. This jacket is lightweight but very waterproof and thus is perfect for wearing about as I do chores on the land and travel about the island. There is an inner net to keep the outer shell off the body and encourage breathability. The sleeves are lined with a silk-like material so it is easy to slide into even with a long-sleeved shirt.. Despite the lack of any further inner lining, the jacket while breathing well is an excellent wind-breaker. This is important: due to the elevation it can be cooler here than one might expect, especially at night. Exactly what I wanted and a great value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A good raincoat. Didn't make me sweat, didn't stick to me and is very rainproof.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for wearing in tandem with a winter coat.', 'author': 'Nobody in particular', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the XXL in the hopes that wearing it over a non-waterproof winter coat would keep both myself and the ‚Äúunder coat‚Äù dry without also making me look like a badly parked Volkswagen waiting at a bus stop.I am six foot and about 200 pounds, and while undeniably roomy on its own, the overall fit when worn over a winter coat I felt was perfect for my particular needs. Its hangs about 6 inches below my waistline, and the sleeves reach out past the knuckles, allowing curled-up fingers to be well protected in case I don‚Äôt happen to have gloves with me.I don‚Äôt disagree with other reviewers that suggest the XXL was for them more like a circus tent. For myself, the fit is not distractingly overlarge an all. So if you are looking for complete weather protection from cold, wind and rain like I did, consider going one size up and using this lightweight rain jacket over your usual winter wear.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Classic Zip Front Polar Fleece Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nicely made and very attractive', 'author': 'Judy Reynolds', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gift for my husband. Looks great on him. Comfy, warm and attractive. Very well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'David Asaad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent, looks nice, true size, very good quality and material', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm & Smart looking, But the sleeves run long', 'author': 'Farhan K', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The Tommy Hilfiger is a smart looking looking fleece jacket that looks great on jeans and is is pretty warm and cozy as well. The fleece material is thicker and of better quality than what you would typically find in a Fruit of the Loom or a Hanes Fleece Jacket. It fits well around the chest and has sufficient length , the only issue is that its sleeves run a bit long. I had to fold them up to use them for my L sized jacket(I usually wear Large) . I\'ve included the main measurements of this jacket for its \'Large\' size in case you\'d like to refer for sizingDESIGN & QUALITY- Full sleeved zippered jacket with a turtle neck & no hoodie- Two zippered front pockets as well as two inner pockets on either side- The turtle neck collar is double layered- The zippers glide smoothly and feel that they are of good quality- The piped design/stitching that runs across the chest and back looks much better in real life than in pictures alone and adds to its overall smart looks- Both the exterior and interior pockets are deep enough to fit wallets, keys , large cellphonesDIMENSIONS (SIZE: LARGE)Sleeves :27" InchesShoulder :6.5" InchesLength :29.5" InchesWidth chest :24" InchesTHE GOOD:- Smart looking jacket that pairs well with jeans and contrasting t-shirts , whether you zip half or all the way up- The thick fleece material and the double layered turtle neck makes the jacket very warm and cozy - sufficient for 48F ~ 50F weather without any additional layers- 4 Pockets and smooth flowing zippers- Fits well around the chestTHE NOT SO GOOD- The sleeves run long , I had to fold them in my day to day use (see pics)- The fleece + black color of my jacket is a magnet for lint and hair, an important consideration if you have pets (common with most fleece jackets)- The tags in the neck area can be bothersome if you\'re wearing round neck t-shirts- For these reasons I take away one starFINAL THOUGHTSOverall the Tommy Hilfiger fleece jacket is very smart looking, warm to wear and is better in terms of quality than other common brands. The only thing I would recommend considering is that the sleeves tend to run long and that it does attract a lot of lint and hair', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars nice and thick', 'author': 'PeterC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'like the tight and thick feel for this Jacket, zipped pockets are must for me for outdoor running with phones, keys.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality fleece type jacket', 'author': 'Richard Jones', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Come in a nice variety of colors but sized run a tad smaller.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fleece Jacket', 'author': 'Gladys Cheung', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'One of my favourite brands sustains reputation for good quality of apparel, warm and light :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Handsome.', 'author': 'Joanne Wilshanetsky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great quality.
