title: Midweight Soft Shell Jackets for Men - Men‚Äôs Water Resistant Windbreaker with Stand Collar (S-3XL)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coat - LT 6\'4 230 long arms 36" waist', 'author': 'Roy Baty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gave away my business casual lightly insulated jacket to some homeless kid when I was on a walk downtown with my wife last year - and felt good about myself until I realized how hard it was to replace that jacket :)! So this year as fall hit, I was looking for a ~200$ HH or Kuhl lightly insulated jacket but I had no luck finding anything I liked in an LT size. After hours of comparison shopping I found this one on Amazon. It was priced lower than I preferred as I wanted a business casual coat that I would feel good wearing at the office and I wanted something that looked expensive. I have never heard of Weatherproof but they trumpet their \'since 1949\'. Strangely for a company so proud of the brand they didn\'t have a single logo anywhere visible on the outside of the coat, just the tags inside the coat. OK - whatever. The coat itself fits absolutely perfectly and looks great. The first order was hilarious as I am an LT and Amazon sent me a 4XLT so when I put it on I looked like I was in a tent. Amazon issue not the coats - and amazon processed the return and had me a replacement in 3 days so it was all good. So I am 6\'4\' 230 with broad shoulders, long arms. 36\' waist. This LT size is form fit for those dimensions. I typically have trouble with too short arms and too short a waist and occasionally too big a waist on the coat. This coat had none of these issues and just fits. All zippers work and the seams are well sown. Velcro sleeves aren\'t too bulky. I like the material for the outside and it just feels sturdy. The insulation was much better than expected and I wore it in 35F weather this week and while I won\'t say I was toasty I was OK. I would want to "layer up" colder than 35F for sure. The wife says it looks slimming and I feel good wearing it. So I feel like I met my goals of expensive look and feel, perfect fit, (bonus - decent insulation without bulk). I did not get any of the brand names I was after but I paid less than 1/2 my budget so I\'ll get over it. Highly recommended - I would get another in a heartbeat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Quality Jacket!', 'author': 'RedShiftRider', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This ended up being exactly what I was hoping for!Quality is great. The fit is perfect too. I bought a medium and it fits perfectly. It‚Äôs a mid-weight jacket just as the description states. Perfect for a fall/spring weather outer layer. Though it is warm enough to be paired with a hoodie underneath and used during the winter. The inside is fleece lined and soft. The exterior is a nylon type water resistant material. Really nice quality and gives the jacket a very clean and crisp look. Which means it‚Äôs also a great option for more formal situations as well. It‚Äôs a great all-rounder.This will be my new go-to for any situation that doesn‚Äôt require a full on bulky winter coat. I‚Äôll most likely reach for this during the winter when heading to work as well. It‚Äôs warm enough for short walks to and from the car. I can‚Äôt think of any reasons I wouldn‚Äôt wear this, other than needing a hood, or when I need a full-on winter coat. New #1 coat.The only criticism I could offer is that it did take a full 2 weeks to receive mine. My order wasn‚Äôt processed and shipped for probably 3-4 days after I ordered. Then it took another 2-3 to arrive, only to find out they sent me a small. I exchanged it for a medium no problem, but that order took another 4-5 days to ship out, and another 3-4 to arrive. Finally received the correct medium exactly 2 weeks after ordering. Both items shipped USPS which probably didn‚Äôt help anything. A little frustrating when you‚Äôre used to 2 day shipping on everything. But not the end of the world. Just something to keep in mind.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Quality Jacket', 'author': 'Frequent Amazon Shopper', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Good quality jacket at a very reasonable price. Very comfortable and looks very nice for the price. A medium weight, rain-resistant jacket as advertised, perfect for fall, winter and spring here on the mild Central Coast of California. As other reviewers have noted, the sleeves are unusually long on the Medium jacket, which is odd because the torso is not long at all. But by adjusting the velcro at the sleeves you can prevent the sleeves from covering your hands. Other than that, it's a perfect jacket. My wife bought a jacket from this manufacturer years ago, and it still looks like it's new after heavy use, so I expect the same for this one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars stylish and functional', 'author': 'Ronald J. My husband loves it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks and feels amazing!', 'author': 'John', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits perfectly, feels great, simple, affordable, and arrived the day after I ordered', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Jacket', 'author': 'Vince C', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely LOVE this coat. title: Men's Camp Night Berber Lined Hooded Flannel Shirt Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great every day jacket, and so comfortable. Just bought another color.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wanted one of these and I absolutely love this jacket. It is warm, and comfortable and is not too thick, and not a big bulky jacket. I wear it every day, and it looks great, especially with the elbow patches, which make it look classy. I find sizing is right on, and just bought another one in different color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable, very warm, my new everyday jacket', 'author': 'Will Maynard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm trying to make it the entire winter without heat. With this jacket on I'm comfortable down to around 40-45F without layering; just my regular short sleeve polo underneath. I have plenty of room to layer when the temperature drops further.Unlike most flannel it's really quite thin, which I love - flannel is usually so thick and overbearing I dislike wearing it. The lining is fantastic. The hood is on the snug side compared to other jackets I have, but this actually helps a lot when it comes to trapping warmth; there's less heat loss and my head stays warmer.I'm particularly fond of the generous sizing. I'm a big guy; I'm between 2-3XL depending on manufacturer, but the 2X here was a very comfortable fit and pretty much the perfect size for me.I don't have any complaints - if anything, I wish the same jacket was available in a pattern other than plaid. Definitely going to be buying more from LW in the future!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks good and feels warm!', 'author': 'Bernice Paita', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this for my boyfriend who is small to medium built and is 5‚Äô5‚Äù and a half tall. Fits him perfectly. He says it feels cozy and durable. Good for cold weather. The earthy color combination looks nice as well. Great purchase.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Legendary Whitetails Men's Camp Night Berber Lined Hooded Flannel Shirt Jacket", 'author': 'Debbie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this jacket for my future son-in-law. He loved it. I got him the Upland Plaid color in XL-Tall and he couldn't have been happier. He said it was extremely soft as well as warm and cozy. The hood is lined with berber and has Legendary signature buck snaps. It also has side pockets to keep your hands warm on cold, chilly day/nights. The jacket was a perfect size, and he was able to move around comfortably. It also has quilted leaves and durable elbow patches. He said it is the perfect jacket for where he is from up north and couldn't wait to wear it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My husband loves this shirt. I already have a bunch of fleece jackets, some pull overs, and this one just seemed a little less sexy than most of the others that I have. So I gave this to my wife, and she wore it once or twice, but it was too big for her.One day for no particular reason I started wearing this again and I noticed after a day or two that it was extremely comfortable. It‚Äôs nice that you can button it up when you‚Äôre cold and unbutton it as it gets warmer. The side pockets are really hefty and you can stick your phone in there and other stuff. The ‚Äúbuild quality ‚Äú on this is impressive. The material is just the right thickness. It‚Äôs a little too heavy to be called a shirt, I would call it a light jacket. I wear it mostly indoors, this would not be warm enough on a cold Colorado day outside. You could maybe run to get the mail but that‚Äôs about it.Anyway, I fell in love with it and I‚Äôve basically worn it consistently during the winter of 22/23. It dawned on me the other day that I like this so much , that I really should buy another. Amazon was still selling them, and the price was so incredible, I went ahead and bought one in several different colors. So I think I have a total of six of these now. For the price these just can‚Äôt be beat. I‚Äôm 6‚Äò4‚Äúand about 240 pounds and the double XL fits nicely. It doesn‚Äôt go really far below the belt level on me, but it goes far enough.I suspect your experience will be similar to mine, and you‚Äôll find yourself wearing this all winter long.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm and soft', 'author': 'JokerFan73', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really like this fleece jacket. Says it‚Äôs warm and not real heavy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs my go to.', 'author': 'Michael P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love the fit, feeling, and look.I wear it all the time. Warm too', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Well-made and a good value. Consider sizing up if you have a large belly.', 'author': 'Junie B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased the light gray Amazon Essentials Men's Long-Sleeve Polar Fleece shirt/jacket in size medium and have worn it as a jacket several times since 12/24/23. I 'm a 138 lb., 5' & 1.5‚Äù tall, 38C bra female with slender arms and excess stomach weight. Obviously, this masculine shirt/jacket is long on me (comes just to the bottom of my seat when unbuttoned) and has arms that are too wide for me, but I like it anyway. In chilly days in the South, it provides good warmth as a jacket. Made in Vietnam, it's clearly a quality garment, with neat stitching, buttonholes that line up perfectly with the buttons, a wider collar that can be positioned upward, inside pockets that are 9.5 inches deep and 5.5 inches wide, and firmer outside pockets (which functionally are not as deep because of the angle of the opening). This soft fleece shirt/jacket is comfortable. The buttonholes are a little tight, but that is better than buttons being too loose to remain fastened. There is a spare button adhered to the inside left tag. This shirt/jacket has more of a straight cut which means that someone with a large belly would probably need to size up if planning to wear it buttoned. Of100% polyester, this shirt/jacket has a side tag indicating the garment should not be dry cleaned, but can be machine washed inside-out, using cold water and a gentle cycle, and machine-dried on a gentle cycle. After washing I plan to put it in the dryer for just a few minutes, and then hang to dry, as I do with most of my clothes. An update will be provided if any problems occur after washing it.I‚Äôd previously bought this shirt/jacket in dark green as a gift, but after seeing its quality, purchased the light gray for myself. The dark green color is similar to, but actually lighter than the illustration. The illustration for the light gray shirt/jacket, however, is representative of its actual color. I like the jacket so much that I just purchased a 3rd one in the indigo blue heather color. It is reported to be darker than the light blue denim color illustration. This Amazon Essentials garment is well-made and is a good value.02/12/24 Update: Subsequently purchased a shirt/jacket in Medium in blue heather. The lower stomach area is narrower than that of both the green and light grey ones. The label was checked but reflected medium- the same size as the 2 previously purchased. Whether just an anomaly for this particular jacket or all are smaller in blue heather isn't known. I can't close the bottom 2 buttons on this one but can on both the green and the light gray, both of which fall straight (no gap) after having been buttoned. Due to sizing inconsistency, I've changed my rating from 5 to 4 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs A Little Small', 'author': 'CrazyGMiniFarm', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Bought this for my son for Christmas, he really liked it, but it does run about a size small. So we had to send it back and get him the next size up. Also DO NOT dry it, it will shrink. He really liked how it felt, the softness and the look of it. Does not have a hood on it, which I didn\'t pay attention to but he does like a hood on it. But overall it was made good, like I said earlier it does run small, so I would size up. My son is 6\'4" and 280 and he needed a 2xl not and XL. Plenty warm with a shirt underneath it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Winter Snow Coat Warm Ski Jacket Waterproof Hooded Work Outerwear
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'dolores w.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My son loves this jacket. It keeps him super warm and is fashionable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very comfortable and warm', 'author': 'Ashley wallace', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought for a trip to Montana in Jan 24 and am very pleased. This kept me warm and dry the entire time. The fur on the hood would get in my eyes a little but I just took it off which was nice. When hiking in Glacier National Park it snowed and was windy and my torso stayed very warm in this jacket. While skiing this jacket kept me a bit too warm but that just comes with skiing, after unzipping it a little it was okay.This jacket has plenty of zipped pockets that allow you to put things away without losing them. The only downside was with the double zipper at the bottom of the main zipper it was pretty difficult to zip up while wearing gloves. Had to remove gloves everytime I needed to zip it up.Worth it for how warm this kept me. It is not very light weight but once you put it on it isn't very noticeable.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coat!', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very warm, seems well made, I love the hood.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great everyday jacket for the rain/snow', 'author': 'charshew', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought a similar sportier version of this jacket from this seller and liked it so much I decided to try this one on lightning deal. It's a great inexpensive everyday jacket for rain/snow in 20-30ish degree weather. The fuzzy fleece lining is light weight, but warm. The zippers and snap buttons are good quality. The double zipper and extra pockets were a nice surprise. The faux fur doesn't look like the picture, but looks OK. Fit is a little big, which is good for layering. The hood is big enough to fit hats underneath. It comes vacuum packed, which causes wrinkles, but I expect the wrinkles to come out over time (like my last jacket).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best purchase of 2023', 'author': 'Carlos Garza', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This jacket is AMAZING! title: Men's Jacket, Stadium Packable Wind and Water Resistant Jacket (Reg. Or Big & Tall)
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Dry like Uncle Jake's chicken", 'author': 'Dave', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great value. It\'s sturdy (has stood up to many days of playing ball in the rain), doesn\'t leak, and is super packable. It\'s a fully waterproof shell, so lightweight as it is, don\'t expect it to be breathable or anything. But considering it packs down to the size of a handsome sandwich, it doesn\'t need to be. Raining? Put it on. Not raining? pack it up. I wear a large and have 36" sleeves; while the body is a good fit, the sleeves are a little short. But it\'s not a Snuggie, it\'s a rain jacket, so I just push them up to 3/4 length, the elastic cuff holds them in place, and I stay dry inside.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It works and is inexpensive', 'author': 'J. Cook', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s hard to find clothes that fit my 6\' 5" frame, but this jacket fits great! It does the job of being a windbreaker. But what I like the most is that it folds down into a small bag that\'s hidden in one of the pockets. I keep it in the trunk of my car so I\'ll always have a jacket handy if I\'m unexpectedly caught in the cold while out and about.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect: lightweight and packable', 'author': 'Carlos', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was looking or a light windbreaker that would be packable. This jacket is just that. Bonus points for having a more "vintage" cut. Looser all around, but not sloppy.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I Like It - But It Fits Weird', 'author': 'Frank Myers', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall, I like wearing this windbreaker. It doesn't have a full zipper in the front, so it's a pullover. The front 2 pockets are very handy.The fit is a little weird though. I'm 6'1 and about 235, so I order an XXL for a little extra room. It's really baggy around the torso and shorter in the arms. The length to my waist is good, just poofy with shorter arms.I could've returned it, but it works well enough for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The jacket feel nice', 'author': 'Son21', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The jacket look good and feel good for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars good price - good quality', 'author': 'Nikita Barmotin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'very light', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love it', 'author': 'Janae Gomez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have one and I bought one for both of my boys and we all love them, perfect fit', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it', 'author': 'Leigh Bradshaw', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got it as a rain jacket. title: Men's Rugged Wear Unlined Denim Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Read the reviews to choose CORRECT SIZE', 'author': 'Sheryll M. Hicks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A is offering discounts on some sizes, but caution is needed to avoid a mistake. My husband makes this review:* I am 6\' 0" tall; 215 #; chest 44"; waist 39"* XL fits very, very well. This is a "waist jacket", and I am old enough to call it an "Ike" or "Eisenhower jacket"* The fit is flattering; but there is space available for a medium sweater.* I typically wear a size 16 1/2 neck and a 34" sleeve--I have some welcome space at the neck and the sleeve extends about 1-1 1/2" below my wrists--I like this a lot* I wanted the lighter color, BUT I saved about $15 with the darker.* Reading reviews here, I DID wash it the first time with 1/4 cup salt and 1/2 cup vinegar--I believe the suggestion was made for purposes of "fixing" the color. [Warm wash and cold rinse.]* Post-wash girth and length remained the same.* NO SMELL, PRE-WASH or POST-WASH.* "Fit and finish" was very good; no defects of any kind seen; fabric quality is sturdy.* I find it a handsome and useful weight/size. I live in the Central Cal. desert, so we do not see much cold, even in Winter.I expect many years of use for this garment. At current 30% off, this is a COMPELLING bargain.[Sorry, I do not take photos.]', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The Best Denim Jacket Out There', 'author': 'YellowFinHunter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased the Antique Indigo color. I am 6\'4", 210#, 45/46" chest, 40" waist and 37" sleeve length. Size XL Tall fits me perfectly. In my humble opinion this Wrangler Denim jacket is the best out there for the price. I liked it so much, I went back and ordered a second jacket in case Wrangler discontinued this style. It\'s that nice of a denim jacket. In comparison, the CINCH button denim jacket sells for about $100 plus tax and shipping. This jacket is half that price. I have both the CINCH denim jacket and the Wrangler Denim Jacket. The Wrangler jacket is much better quality and fit than the CINCH version. I read most all of the reviews and have to say the Wrangler jacket I received was virtually flawless. The stitching, metal buttons, button holes, fit, fabric and workmanship was perfect. I would not have purchased two if I did not like this jacket. I hope the one you receive is just as good as the two I received.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wrangler Denim Jacket', 'author': 'Joseph OHalloran', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Have always been a fan of denim jackets and I think wrangler is the best brand. Always a great fit, it's comfortable and is strong and durable. Great but for the money!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great coat', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this for my boyfriend and he loved it! Fits great and it's very heavy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great value, weird fit', 'author': 'S. Shalash', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The value is amazing. Unfortunately, the dark color shown in the pictures doesn't reflect the real color in person. Just try it on first without taking the tags off.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is the jacket I was looking for!', 'author': 'Andrew R', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I really love this jacket, the inside pockets are nice, quality and inventive. The style is why I wanted it most. I shopped for a while, thinking many others would suffice. I wanted a Jean jacket that was comfortable and not too big on me, just the antique blue. title: Columbia Women's Benton Springs Full Zip
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit, warm but not bulky', 'author': 'R A A', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice jacket , perfect for running errands in winter or chilly nights', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars this brand seems to be quite good', 'author': 'Gail Burgio', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'very comfortable & fits well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Thick, Comfortable, and Warm', 'author': 'Shauna Davis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The product was very high quality. It has kept me warm in 30-40 degree weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice and comfortable but cheap zipper', 'author': 'dusty0778', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I received this jacket today. I ordered a 2X and it fits as I hoped it would. Just roomy enough. I\'m usually a 1X so I would say to order up one size. The sleeves are a little long but that\'s better than too short. This jacket was not too short in the body length as some people stated. I\'m only 5\' 4" and it\'s a perfect length on me. My only two complaints are the color. I ordered black. It looks very black in the photo but it\'s not a true black. It\'s more of a charcoal gray/slight navy. It doesn\'t bother me but if you are hoping for black, this is not. And the zipper. It\'s very cheap. I could not get it zipped up. I was afraid the little bottom piece would pull away from the fabric. I was very gentle with it but could not get it zipped up while I was wearing it. I had to take it off and lay it face up on my bed and work with it. I finally got it to zip and then zipped it up and down a million times to "break it in" but still could not get it re-zipped once I unzipped it again. Bad quality zipper which surprises me coming from a Columbia jacket. Other than these 3 things, it\'s a nice jacket. The main problem I see is the zipper.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jacket', 'author': 'Leanne B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great jacket. title: Columbia Men's Ascender Softshell Front-zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Giftable', 'author': 'Valitia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift. It fit perfectly, hangs nicely, plenty of pockets, comfortable and looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice for a variety of conditions', 'author': 'Railgee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ended up purchasing two of these jackets in black. One for working in the yard and out in the public, and second I have set aside for more dressy occasions. I was impressed with the fit, the overall quality of the jacket for the price, its lightness and thinness, and its use in a range of temperatures and conditions. I have used it for light winds and 60 degrees, and heavy winds in the high 20s. I have worn it both for shoveling snow and for attending a play. In all extremes, it performed perfectly. Both the outside of the jacket and inside liner dries quickly. In my opinion, this jacket is an exceptional value for the price. I have much more expensive jackets with big outdoor names, but this one has become my go to choice for all but the most extreme conditions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice jacket, has become my favorite', 'author': 'GVLabs49', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a really nice light to mid-weight jacket and the bonus is, it looks really good. I haven't played golf in it yet, or worn it in the rain, but I will update when I do. Nice material is comfortable and feels very well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket with a few minor issues', 'author': 'B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really like this jacket. The weight is great for anything from cool spring/fall days all the way down to freezing temps. It blocks wind well and does an admirable of keeping me dry while I walk across a rainy parking lot. The classic simple style makes it easy to wear with just about anything.There are a couple of minor things that would make it even better. The sleeves are fleece-lined, which makes for a warm feel but makes it a bit more difficult to pull it off if I'm wearing long sleeves, especially if I'm wearing a sweater. The other thing I'm not crazy about is that the collar will NEVER lie flat. One side always always always sticks up. It's not unique to this jacket, nearly every soft shell I've ever owned has had this problem. I suppose it's handy if you actually zip it up all the way, but who does that?I still wear it a lot. It's my go-to jacket if it's above 25F outside.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, runs a bit larger than expected but that's okay", 'author': 'Robert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great quality you would expect from the Columbia brand. Ran a tiny bit longer in the arms that I expected, but that's good for keeping my hands warm. Proper color quality, Nice and thick, but still lightweight. Not not wrinkly. Good size pockets. title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. This shoe was thoughtfully designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!', 'author': 'monica cerda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wear heeled leather boots as my day to day fashion, I‚Äôve never been a sneaker person and so after complaining to a friend about hiking sneakers I purchased hurting the top of my foot after an hour of wear, they suggested I try hiking boots instead. I felt like a fool for never connecting the dots. Lol.Well‚Ä¶I found these, loved the color options and the reviews seemed pretty legit! I‚Äôve worn them twice so far while running errands to see how they feel and I have to say, no discomfort and so lightweight!!Now down to sizing: With stylish boots, I‚Äôm typically a size 8, and I did order an 8 initially, however with a thin sock, they felt pretty snug and I thought maybe they might start to bother my toes since there‚Äôs more cushion that what I‚Äôm used to and what if I want to wear thick socks?For me that was enough to go up to an 8.5 juuuust to be on the safe side and because‚Ä¶why not find out? $75 is still $75.So glad I did! They feel roomier yet still a great fit, so if you‚Äôre in limbo, I‚Äôd say size up .5 if you want to be able to throw these on without switching your socks. üòâHappy I got these and I‚Äôm looking forward being more active!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Time WAS a Charm! Only took 5 tries to find Prince Charming's Boot!", 'author': 'FLGulfGrnEz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read the reviews wherever I could find them. I had become very confused over the sizing. I have a hard enough time getting the right size without this much of a difference thrown at me too!I was in love @first glance, beautiful dark gray with aqua strings. Ordered size 7 as suggested though I wear a size 6.5 or 6. Feet measures a size 5-5.5, L=8.5" R=8.7". There lies the rub, right foot doesn\'t fit sizes same as left one by a fraction so hit or miss. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Zippers are the bomb for higher topped boots/shoes especially with fat feet, high instep, opens the slimmer top for feet to get to sole.Back to the size sessions; First was great price on 7\'s, looked order back up and saw where I had ordered from the warehouse! Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. Still have plenty of room through toe bed area but TOO PRETTY, COMFY & TIRED to second guess anymore, size 6 it is!Merry Christmas Folks! Good Luck with your sizing, hope this finally solves some problems??? It was the socks that made all the difference which I kept hearing in almost every review but didn\'t hear the bell in head go off... All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! Uh Oh, gotta get lined pants, knit cap, goggles, warmer gloves, down filled vest... Merry Christmas to me.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality but rubbed on my ankle', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The shoe was nicely made and looked to be good quality. When I first tried them on , they were comfortable and looked cute. I walked around in them for about an hour when I started to feel rubbing on my right ankle in the back. I needed these for a long hike and knew they were not going to work for me. I think these would be a great shoe for shorter walks or to wear around the yard. I did size up half a size because I would be wearing heavier socks and they fit great. Just not for a long hike that I was planning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Hiking Shoes', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These shoes rock!! I wore these on a trip to Iceland and they kept my feet warm and dry. We made several long hikes through various terrains (mountain, river, gravel, mud) and they didn‚Äôt hurt my feet or feel too heavy. They are perfectly light weight and sturdy, provide ankle support and traction. These are my go to shoes for hikes now and they have held up well for at least the last year. Definitely worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Right Out of the Box', 'author': 'Michele Kohan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with these boots. They were super comfortable right out of the box and I wore them for three straight hours immediately upon putting them on. I love the classic look of these boots and can't wait to hike in them! I looked at a few different colors that were available in my size (11 women), and initially chose the classic tan and red because of the lower price; but I found I really love the color and am glad I chose thetah. They remind me of hiking boots I used to have when I lived back in Pennsylvania growing up.This new pair of Columbia boots are true hiking boots, with cushion all around the ankle and tongue, a flexible thick sole and also appear to be waterproof by design, although haven't tested that yet.The down side is the boots will be too hot to wear in the summer here in Florida, but are working great for the unexpected cold snap right now. They will come in handy for trips out of state in my camper. A+ boots!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and Cute', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I picked these based on great reviews and was not disappointed. I wear a women‚Äôs 10 in non-athletic shoes and a 10.5 wide in athletic shoes. Amazon recommended a 10, and I‚Äôm glad I got the 10.5 wide. I can lace them tight for a nice fit, and they don‚Äôt press on my bunion.Pros- Not heavy, but feel sturdy enough for rough terrain, snow and ice- Beautiful color and red accents- Don‚Äôt make my big ole feet look too big- Comfortable from the minute I put them onCon- Insole is glued down tightly and not removable. All shoe manufacturers should make their insoles removable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Columbia hiking boots', 'author': 'Deborah Kretsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with my purchases. I ordered a brand new pair and also went and bought the warehouse inspected used one on additional discount. The used pair is in perfect condition, not a mark or sign of wear anywhere on them. They‚Äôre just like the brand new pair. Perfect!I wear orthotics in my shoes, I tried them both with and without them to see how they feel. I will of course wear them with the orthotics otherwise my plantar fasciitis will get inflamed. I want to wear one pair at work which is standing on my feet my entire shift on cement floors and the other for daily use or camping etc. I will also be spraying a treatment on them for additional protection against the elements.I do have wide feet. One being bigger and slightly wider than the other as well. I always wore a 6.5 shoe, but I guess my feet spread out over time so now I wear 7.5-8 shoes/boots. I went with the 7.5 wide on these and they feel just fine. If I got 8s I think they‚Äôd have been too long and I‚Äôd be tripping on my own feet. Definitely glad I got the wides they would have been too narrow if I got the regular ones. The orthotics raise my foot in the shoe so I have to loosen the laces a lot to accommodate and this is the first time I‚Äôve had extra length on the laces to tie rather than a teeny amount to tie my shoes!For today I am wearing these around the house to break them in. They feel fine out of the box but I tend to get foot fatigue easily due to my foot condition so I need to break them in. My baby toes always get the brunt of the pain when wearing shoes and especially new shoes. I haven‚Äôt felt that pain right away like I normally would. So that‚Äôs a plus for comfort!!So far I love these and so glad I bought both pairs! I love the color and the red laces. They remind me of the old hiking boots I used to see growing up, only a more comfortable updated version! The other colors look cute in the pics but I feel limited to what I can wear them with so I feel these are more neutral to the colors I tend to wear. Hopefully these last a long time. I do own other Columbia products and am usually pleased with their products, this is the first time purchasing footwear.Thank you!Edit I‚Äôve been wearing these to work using my orthotics, standing on my feet on cement floor. No discomfort at all, they have been very comfortable! So happy with these boots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In love!', 'author': 'Desiree Mangan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I asked for these as a Christmas present and boy I am so happy I did! I usually wear an 8 however I do have wider feet and knew I was planning on wearing thicker socks so I asked for an 8 wide. I unfortunately have not had the chance to wear these while actually hiking, however I did get to wear them during the recent snow storm. I was waiting for a pair of snow boots that I ordered to come in which they didn‚Äôt but I knew that these were thick and waterproof so I figured why not wear them while shoveling. Clearly they would be much better at keeping my feet warm and dry compared to my Ugg boots. Which it is no surprise that they actually did! My feet were BONE DRY. I was out there for over an hour walking through nearly knee high snow, both shoveling/clearing off cars in my drive way. I love these shoes. Not only this but I had to go to work and play outside in the snow with my preschool kids and same thing, nice and dry. I also wore them all day, 8-5, and my feet feel great! Though I haven‚Äôt used them for what I actually asked for them for, I can tell they will perform just as well as they have already! So buy them you won‚Äôt regret it:)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Awesome value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value and performance', 'author': 'Perfwise', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with this jacket. This jacket is lightweight but very waterproof and thus is perfect for wearing about as I do chores on the land and travel about the island. This is important: due to the elevation it can be cooler here than one might expect, especially at night. Didn't make me sweat, didn't stick to me and is very rainproof.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for wearing in tandem with a winter coat.', 'author': 'Nobody in particular', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered the XXL in the hopes that wearing it over a non-waterproof winter coat would keep both myself and the ‚Äúunder coat‚Äù dry without also making me look like a badly parked Volkswagen waiting at a bus stop.I am six foot and about 200 pounds, and while undeniably roomy on its own, the overall fit when worn over a winter coat I felt was perfect for my particular needs. Its hangs about 6 inches below my waistline, and the sleeves reach out past the knuckles, allowing curled-up fingers to be well protected in case I don‚Äôt happen to have gloves with me.I don‚Äôt disagree with other reviewers that suggest the XXL was for them more like a circus tent. So if you are looking for complete weather protection from cold, wind and rain like I did, consider going one size up and using this lightweight rain jacket over your usual winter wear.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good jacket - Warm, fits good', 'author': 'sn8keyz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Bugaboo II jacket is a little long for a Large. But, no biggie. There are velcro straps on the cuffs, to adjust the tightness, and to keep the sleeves at your wrist.I have worn the jacket, already, in 15 - 20 degree weather, with one undershirt. It does protect against wind, and wet snow. None of the snow dampened the fleece in the liner.The fleece liner is great. One long-sleeve shirt, and the jacket should keep you warm.The hoodie is easily removed, which is great as well.For the price, I do think i got a great deal from a recognized brand.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome jacket!!', 'author': 'Benjamin Aubin', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I absolutely have to say it's a really nice jacket. Comfortable, light and made with quality materials. I feel I honestly got a really good deal, and I'm putting it to use up north in New England on this rainy day", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Columbia jackets are mostly great', 'author': 'Ryan B.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is the second Columbia jacket I've purchased in the last 4 years, and they are comfortable, warm, set up well for skiers, and pretty much have everything you are looking for, with 1 issue.Both jackets I purchased have annoying long sleeves on the jacket liner. I would think that maybe I just need a shorter overall sleeve except the shell sleeves are the correct length for me, and the liner sleeves stick out of the shell sleeve by a couple of inches. This isn't really an issue when you're wearing gloves, or if you use the velcro sleeve adjustment on the shell to keep the liner in place, but I like to wear the liner as its own lighter weight jacket at times, and I have to keep the sleeves rolled up for it to work, otherwise they extend to the tips of my fingers.It's just odd because I have regular length arms, and the rest of the jacket fits me well.Still a great ski jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'JSul82', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars It‚Äôs warm but the sleeves are weird', 'author': 'BB', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'So first it is warm (hood is worthless tho so have a knit hat etc.). reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit and looks good too', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this jacket along with several other brands of the same style. This one was hands down the best fitting and best looking of them all. I also own a far more expensive puffy jacket and I have to say this is every bit the quality and fit for a fraction of the cost. I am very happy with this Eddie Bauer jacket. Super warm and light weight too!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars warm, comfortable and takes very little space in the bag', 'author': 'Niv Francke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this jacket to be my go-to jacket for my daily commute, and so far, I‚Äôm really enjoying it. It‚Äôs surprisingly warm and lightweight, and it folds up very small to fit in my daily commute backpack. The only downside are the zippers. their quality is ok but not much more than that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent jacket', 'author': 'Karley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought this for my husband to replace an old ripped Eddie Bauer jacket that he wouldn't let go of. He loves this coat. It's lightweight but warm. Great pockets. He primarily uses it walking our dog and it's held up well to the freezing temps we've had lately in the Midwest. TTS. He got size Large, 6ft approx 200lbs", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very light weight and warm enough', 'author': 'D. Johnson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This fits well and looks good. I was surprised at how light it was, but it provides moderate warmth at around 50 - 60 degrees, and with a sweater underneath, it's ok at cooler temperatures. The two outside pockets have zippers and I wish there was a zippered inside pocket. It holds its shape well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars warmth and good value', 'author': 'Jan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Warm, light weight and good value.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value for price', 'author': 'Sameer Baxi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice product and it‚Äôs fit me well ; recommended', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as expected', 'author': 'Holly Campbell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered XLT. I‚Äôm 6‚Äô3‚Äù with long arms. Fit perfect. Light weight and warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not very warm', 'author': 'Gift Giver', 'rating': 3, 'content': "It keeps the wind out but that's about it..fits well and has a nice color..even with layers I was still cold", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great buy at the Amazon price, but not worth retail price', 'author': 'sean lynch', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This jacket is a great bargain at the price it sells for here on Amazon.The retail price is $99, but the Amazon price is $59. This jacket is worth the Amazon price, but is not worth the full retail price. Eddie Bauer does regularly offer 40% off coupons that bring the full price in line with the Amazon price. Eddie Bauer also, occasionally, has a 50% off sale which would bring the price down to $49, that would be a really good bargain.If you want a good deal, pay the Amazon price. If you are in no hurry, wait for a 50$ off sale at Eddie Bauer.Why do I think this is a good deal? This is not the best down jacket you can buy. This should really be thought of as a 'down sweater' and not a jacket. This does not have a lot of features. This has good down, but does not have the highest quality down ( 650 dfp (down fill power) vs 850 dfp or 900 dfp. This does not have down treated with a hydrophillic process to make the down more water proof. This does not have an outer shell of some super high-tech fabric like dyneema or pertex.However, this is a really good, bargain down jacket.It has quality down. when dfp ratings started being used, 400 to 500 was the most common, ordinary, jacket fill. 650 used to be considered very 'high end'. Most of the ultra-expensive coats and jackets that Canada Goose sells use 650 dfp down. Things have changed and the high end is much higher now, but 650 dfp is still good. Ask anyone who has spent over $1,000 on a Canada Goose jacket with 650 dfp down.There are better jackets that are much more expensive, but this jacket is a good jacket for $59.If the jacket had 2 of any of the following 3 features, I think it would be worth the retail price of $99:1) A hem drawstring, instead of the elastic it has.2) A zippered chest pocket (inside or outside) for a phone.3) a double zipper on one of the pockets, so the jacket can be stored in its own pocket.This jacket lacks all of those features. They are all pretty basic. If it had any 2 of those 3, I'd class it as a $99 jacket.This is not a jacket that will get you across Antartica on a dog sled, but it will meet the needs of many people out there. I've worn this jacket in weather ranging from 0¬∫ F to 45¬∫ F. Alone, it is good down to about 32¬∫ F, if it isn't freezing rain out. Below that temperature, I usually combine it with a fleece hoody underneath this jacket.It was 24¬∫F today on my way to work and I wore the fleece hoody/EB cirruslite down jacket combo and was pretty warm. If it is wet out, I'll wear this jacket under a waterproof shell. The coldest weather, and I combine the three layers: Fleece hoody, down sweater, gore-tex shell. That can take me down to the 0¬∫ F easily. I'll see if I can use that combo even lower this January. It just hasn't gotten that cold yet.Workmanship is fine. Remember this is a $59 dollar jacket. I found one hanging thread I cut off. It wasn't a loose thread, just extra. The first few days, a few of the very tiny down feathers came out near some seems. I have had this with every down jacket I have owned. The very smallest feathers fit through the larger sew holes. It happens, but it doesn't really leak down.To sum it up, it is worth the price charged here on Amazon. You can get jackets with more feartures, but they cost more. You can get jackets with better down, or better fabrics but you won't get them for $59.Jackets like the Montbell Alpine Lite, REI Magma 850 2.0, or Patagonia down sweater have more features, better fabric and better down. They retail for $209 to $229. You'll see extra features like zipper storm flaps, zippered chest pockets, fleece lined collars, water resistant down and more on these other jackets. Features that are not present on this jacket. They also cost from $140 to $170 more than this jacket does.This is a great bargain for the price, it can be a really good part of any layered winter system, and you can buy 3 or 4 of these for the price of a high end brand name lite down jacket.I've added pictures of the one loose thread, and one of the very small feathers that came out (the feather is so small it is hard to see).I've added pictures of how I layer the jacket with the fleece and the outer shell when needed.This is a good deal, has responsibly sourced down and is pretty well made. If you want more features, there are plenty of other down jackets with more features.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars CHAMARRA', 'author': 'Lidia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'MUY PADRE CHAMARRA DE PLUMA LIGERA POR ALGUNAS FOTOS ME CONFUNDI PENSE QUE ERA MAS ACOLCHONADA EN REALIDAD ES PLUMA LIGERA AUN ASI ESTA DE MUY BUENA CALIDAD Y ME AGRADO', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Loose Fit Firm Duck Insulated Flannel-Lined Active Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Carhartt for the win!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an amazing jacket. I needed a nice, heavy winter jacket for the cold and windy coastal Santa Cruz weather after moving to college, so I wanted something that would keep me warm but also look cute. This jacket is exactly what I wanted. I get compliments almost every time I wear it and now all my friends want one!Pricing:I don‚Äôt usually spend more than $30 on clothing, but I really wanted this jacket, so I decided to splurge a little. Plus, Carhartt is a reliable brand, so I know it will last me a very long time. I looked into a few other brands (Dickies, Patagonia, etc.), but I felt that Carhartt was a better fit for what I was looking for. I considered getting a jacket from Dickies ($139.99) that was close to identical, but I decided to go with Carhartt ($109) because not only was it more cost-efficient, but it seemed warmer and more stylish as well.Pros:The jacket is nice and warm without being too heavy and goes with almost any outfit. I also love that Carhartt tends to look even better with a little wear and tear over time, unlike some other brands. This way I don‚Äôt have to treat it like a new pair of white shoes and be worried about getting a little scuff or dirt on it. It is extremely durable, so if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for, look no further!Potential Cons:You should be aware that when you first get the jacket it may feel bulky and tough, but it is easy to break in. I washed it a couple of times according to the instructions on the tag and it is much better now. It was a bit big on me (as I was expecting), so I threw it in the dryer after I washed it and it did shrink a little bit, but definitely not too much. For reference, I am 5‚Äô2 and 110 lbs and I got the mens small. It is still a little big on me even after shrinking it, but that‚Äôs exactly what I was aiming for. The zipper can be a little sticky at times, but it hasn‚Äôt been a big issue for me so far. One thing you should know is that it is not waterproof or water-resistant. I wore it in the rain once and the water soaked right through the outer shell. Still not a problem for me though! Just thought I‚Äôd mention it.Overall:Overall it's an amazing jacket and is one of my favorite clothing items that I own. I don‚Äôt know how I went all this time without it! High quality, plenty of pockets, comfy, warm and stylish. I definitely recommend getting this jacket!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the money!', 'author': 'Shanon DeWitt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this jacket for a Big&Tall gentleman, and it fit perfectly. The quality of the material is superior, nice and thick but soft. Very durable exterior and will make for a great outdoor work coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars first impressions are great', 'author': 'J. Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It\'s big. It\'s warm. It feels very tough. You will look more intimidating (not what I wanted, but there it is). I got fed up with cheap things not working right and giving out after a year. So I bought this. It\'s a bit costly, for my budget.I\'m 6\'2", 300 lbs. I wear mostly 3xl, sometimes 4xl. I bought the 3xl jacket. There is some room to spare, but the fit is very good. It is long enough, and I can move easily in it. It is bulky and sweeps things off counters and tables as I pass by. It is warm, quite warm. The exterior feels almost like canvas. Brand new, it is fairly stiff. The hood is stiff, and I had to persuade it to stay down. Again, I assume time will ease the stiffness somewhat. The interior is soft flannel. Waist and wrists have elastic to keep snow out, but they do not chafe. Overall very comfortable. It has a plasticky, painty scent that I assume will fade with washing. Strong metal zipper. Two pockets are inside, one zipper the other velcro. They are each big enough to hold my Kindle. This looks like an excellent jacket. I will update if anything surprising happens.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My son was ecstatic.!!', 'author': 'Owl Glasses', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'd call this a 'heritage coat,' as the quality is so very wonderful, these are often handed down from father to son. This was a dream of my sons for a long time. It was a most wonderful holiday gift. We are having a very cold winter throughout much of the US. It keeps him toasty even on the long walks he's fond of. It would take a lot to sustain any damage to it as the materials used are of the highest quality. It's great for a date, even better for hard work. I will never regret buying this for my dear son. And it is just so flattering for any man to wear. He loves it and I love it that he's so over the moon. Carhartt is a long-honored brand for a reason!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!', 'author': 'Care Raine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cheapest price I‚Äôve found for these this year. My fianc√© was in need of a new coat and mentioned carhartt to me, I searched for a couple months. Finally got this and it came so fast and is perfect. Definitely a little big for a medium but most carhartt loose-fit items do run a little bigger, I‚Äôd recommend small if you normally wear a medium in shirts and want a tighter fit. He says it‚Äôs perfect however, great for wearing layers underneath and very warm!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Material hard, stiff, and crunchy', 'author': 'Eileen Lauer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôm sending this back because the material is so stiff and hard. It seems to be very good quality, warm, and durable and it‚Äôs not ugly. If you need something quasi- bulletproof, this might be the coat for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality', 'author': 'Craig Franckiewicz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve used Carhartt products for years. Jackets are a little big.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket. Roomy. Tough. Warm', 'author': 'Jon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this jacket now for two years. I've beaten it up quite a bit but it is tough. Would definitely buy this again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Made for fat Americans', 'author': 'Little Ian', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Like all Carhartt products, this one assumes you are a heavily built individual. I had a size medium of this jacket that I got nearly20 years ago that served me well for many years, it was just overly large on me. I\'m about 5\'9" and 130 lbs, and I\'m usually a size small, so that was to be expected. Unfortunately, the size small that I purchased is simply too short - the jacket just comes to my waist, and the hood is also excessively short - with the hood up, the full weight of the jacket rides on my neck rather than on my shoulders as it should. This causes neck pain after a fairly short time, as its not a lightweight jacket. Overall, this is a very nice jacket, but the poor sizing makes it hard to recommend for anyone slimmer than the average American', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this coat', 'author': 'Ashley Stack', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this for my husband and I'm actually going to order another one a size up. I am going to keep the original I ordered in a X-large and get him an X-large tall. I will say the coat will shrink a bit when washed but it is the warmest and coat. We have always bought Carhartt and have never been disappointed. For reference I am 5 foot 4 inches tall and 125 lbs and the X-Large is too big for me a large would be better to go over my insulated coveralls and my husband is 6 foot 3 inches and about 180 lbs the X-Large fit good until we washed it and it did shrink a bit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great denim jacket, a classic!', 'author': 'Hazel_motes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great and high quality jacket. The stitching on it looks great. title: Men's Waterproof Ski Jacket Warm Winter Snow Coat Mountain Windbreaker Hooded Raincoat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Its comfortable and warm at a great price.', 'author': 'Robinson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Initially, I ordered a size Large, but found it a bit tight, especially since I prefer layering up in the colder months. The exchange process for an XL was easy as it always is with prime. The larger size fits perfectly (XL). It\'s roomy enough for multiple layers underneath but still maintains its shape, so you don\'t feel like you\'re wearing a bulky blanket or look like the "Michelin Man" . Performance-wise, this jacket is great. It has kept me warm and dry. The insulation is effective without being overly heavy. I\'ve been out in snow and light rain, and the waterproofing holds up. It\'s exactly what you need for a cold or snowy winter day.I noticed some reviews mentioned issues with the zipper, but I\'ve had no such problems.There\'s ample space for your phone, ski pass, wallet, and even small snacks.Value for Money is great , I would recommend it to a friend or even buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality - Keeps You Warm', 'author': 'Dee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My apologies, as this coat is a rich black color, however due to the lighting in the room you can‚Äôt tell. This was a gift to my husband, as we live in the northern US where we are deep in snow. First off, this coat is a medium weight, and the inside is all soft fur. Even the hoodie is lined with fur, which worked excellent in keeping his head/neck/mouth area covered from the cold. It was roomy with a Velcro strap to keep it snug, and it is wide enough that it covers the top of the jacket when zipped. There are 3 sets of pockets: down on the side, one on the chest and one inside the jacket. This is great, as you don‚Äôt always get a secure inside pocket to tuck away your wallet, keys, money, etc. The size shown is an XX-Large and is a good length in which it would cover down beneath the bum. My husband went out to snow blow wearing a long-sleeve t-shirt and this jacket. He was surprised that it kept him warm, as we were getting snow drifts from the wind. He is pretty thin and he was surprised he didn‚Äôt get cold at all. We had a bit of rain a week later, which this jacket did great at repelling water. The cuffs on the sleeve are adjustable, and the coat also has small pull straps to tighten the hoodie around your face. This jacket will surprise you ‚Äì it has the quality of a more expensive jacket but is affordable for most to buy. You can‚Äôt go wrong with this jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket!', 'author': 'Ben', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I actually bought this jacket with a different purpose in mind rather than for skiing. I am an athletic trainer and during the late fall, winter, and spring seasons, I am covering all different sports in all different kinds of weather because I am in a four seasons state. The first thing I did when I opened up this jacket was run it under a faucet and make sure waterproof meant waterproof and not water resistant. I can safely say this jacket served its purpose for me more than well. In pouring, freezing rain or snow or sleet, it kept my torso completely warm and dry. It fits very well and is comfortable to wear. On days when I want it for warmth and am not concerned about the weather, I just take the hood off. All the pockets have zippers so I don't have to worry about losing anything or my items getting wet. I definitely would recommend this jacket to any other fellow ATs or people that are forced to stand outside for hours in the pouring, cold, rain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nearly a Perfect Jacket', 'author': 'Joseph', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Price is great for what you get. First let me say I really like this jacket a lot. The jacket is great looking. Had lots of compliments from other men, asked me where I got it. The lining is warm and the coat is great in the rain and the length is perfect, I am 5\' 9" 180 pounds I bought a size large, and it covers right to the bottom of my butt cheeks, keeping my butt dry and warm. I love the coat. It also has a removal zippered hood so you don\'t have to have it hanging there all the time when it\'s not need in warmer weather, etc. But, it will require two changes to the design to make this a perfect coat for me. #1 It needs some velcro closures on the zipper flaps to keep it closed. Yes there are two snaps, at the top and bottom of flaps, but if you\'re wearing gloves they are tough to deal with, and even when buttoned, snow and air could possibly sneak under the flap. Velcro would be a quick and easy way to secure the zipper flap. #2 It needs a double zipper. Because of the length of the jacket, butt cheeks covered, I have to fully unzip it when I sit down in the car, etc. I usually "hike-it up" and leave it zippered but it would be more comfortable if it had a double zipper which would allow me to just unzip a few inches from the bottom. It would also make it easier to get my hands into my pants pockets as well.So bottom line: If you need a warm waterproof great looking great fitting almost perfectly designed jacket, I highly recommend this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The quality on these....waow!', 'author': 'Dwaine Burrell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ok I know I didn't show much in the pics but trust me guys I'm absolutely happy with my purchase. This right here is what I call bang for your buck. This jacket checks all the boxes. It's comfy, warm, durable (well so far), looks good, and holds up nicely against the elements. I highly recommend these. Oh yeah almost forgot: I'm 6 feet tall, slender built, 175 pounds, and I purchased the size medium. I do wish they were an inch or two longer to fully cover my butt but I'm quite fine with the current length. I doubt the large would've made much of a difference anyway based on the dimensions provided on the website.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for price', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this just for snowboarding. Its super warm, has lots of pockets, fits really well, keeps you dry even in light rain & snow. Looks great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Holds up very well after 1.5 years with auspiciously large pockets.', 'author': 'Bryan Carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an excellent jacket for the price. A year and a half of regular wear later and there are no notable issues with the jacket. I'm sure that higher price points might net better gear, but I honestly have zero complaints. It's warm and all of the zippers work fine still.On the topic of zippers, it is worth noting that the pockets are unusually large. On my jacket, I can easily fit 40-oz bottles of malt liquor into each of the side pockets and 10-oz cans of olives into the other pockets with room to spare. Obviously, you can put other substances into the pockets as well. Whatever your position requires.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for skiing', 'author': 'MICHELLE WILLIAMS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my son for Christmas. He wears it skiing and quad riding on cold days. Keeps him warm. Not bulky. Fits perfectly and nice style for whatever occasion you want it for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ski jacket', 'author': 'Rhiannon Britney', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This item arrived in good condition and fast. The item was double bagged and both bags were vacuum sealed. The jacket is very well designed (with 2 exceptions, venting & need of a velcro seal along the zipper). There are 4 pockets that all are zippered and water proof (1 inside the left front, 1 left breast, 1 left front panel & 1 right front panel). There is a hood (removable) that also has a fleece lining just like the inside of the jacket around the body. There are velco closures around the wrists. The jacket is a little poofy(just a little) but not overly so, it feels comfortable and is easy to move in. It says in the advertisement that it is snow/water/ wind proof...I will find out about the water/wind proofing this weekend, but since I live in SoCal we don't get snow except in the mountains. It is a great buy! I originally ordered a 2XL because I thought it would run a bit small, but it didn't. So I was able to return it easily and I ordered a large (accidentally ordered 2). The large fit perfectly so I was able to return it easily too! I am completely satisfied with this product and the speed at which it arrived and the easy return! 5 Stars to Amazon and their personal! ;)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Insane Winter Jacket Value', 'author': 'Eric Ngo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price, these are hard to beat. I come from a place where if we see 60 degrees on the weather app, we're wearing multiple layers, hoodies, and sweatpants around and the coldest place we know is the Costco Dairy Section. That being said, the insulation on this jacket was intense. I took these snowboarding up Snoqualmie in subfreezing temps and felt warm and cozy the entire time, even having to unzip at times to cool down. There are pockets that are waterproof in the front chest and inside, but do not store any valuables in the zip up pockets in the front as those are not waterproof. Overall, this jacket was a real winner in my winter rotation this season and I can't wait to wear it again next winter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality', 'author': 'Gregg Hessler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this CREATMO US Men's Faux Leather Jacket Motorcycle Jacket Waterproof Windproof PU Moto Vintage Bomber Hoodie with Removable Hood¬π a few weeks ago and I am very happy with my purchase.
