title: Men's Rain Jacket Waterproof Lightweight Packable Rain Shell Raincoat with Hood for Golf Hiking Travel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to carry!', 'author': 'John B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easily fits into its stuff sack so goes into a backpack or overnight bag easily. And oh, it‚Äôs a great rain jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits well, looks good', 'author': 'DPotter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'and it keeps me dry, too! I bought it for a trip because it packs down into the included stuff sack. To my delight water just beads on it. I love the two-tone look, too. This travel rain jacket has earned a place in my every-day closet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A plastic jacket - minimal, but does the job', 'author': 'Jesse Calcat', 'rating': 4, 'content': "What I like about this jacket:-Waterproof-Windproof-Adjustable/tightenable hem and hood.-A fun, attractive, and hard to find color (a bright red-orange)-Two external zipped pockets, and two waist-level internal pockets! This is amazing for such a basic jacket, especially when SO many jackets, even of higher quality and price seem to offer only one small internal pocket, or quite often, none at all.-Perfect for warm rainy days, as it provides zero warmth and has no insulation or even lining-Very compact and portable, easily compacting into its own included small carrying bag-Intelligently designed, and the company seems to care about the functionality of its products.-A very good value/low price.-Fits true to size.What I'm not so crazy about:-It's literally a plastic sheet - thicker than your typical rain poncho, but very stiff and noisy.-Non-adjustable cuffs. The stiffness of the jacket's material makes the elastic, non-adjustable/non-tightenable cuffs fail to make a very good seal around my wrists, and I have pretty fat wrists.-Very thin and actually translucent - If you carry any dark items in the pockets, they can be seen by people (at least for this orange-red color). As I like to carry my dark wallet in the internal pockets of my jackets, it's almost advertised with the translucency of the material.-Absolutely no lining or insulation - I wish they had at least added a mesh lining or something, as the plastic material sticks to your arms if you wear short sleeves. Also, a lining would help to provide a bit of security insomuch as providing a visual barrier (see above regarding the jacket being translucent) - kind of like a security mailing envelope versus a non-security envelope.-Not necessarily a con, but the jacket provides ZERO warmth, so it's only really suitable for warmer rainy days, or to act as a hardshell jacket to go over your own layered clothing selected for colder days - again, this is not necessarily a con.This is a nice jacket overall, very basic and no-frills, with some nice extra features. I think a few minor tweaks could really make this a winning jacket. The original venture features adjustable spring release clamps on the hood. The venture 2 has plastic tabs that the bungee cords are threaded through. It can be adjusted but it‚Äôs only held by friction vs. a spring release clamp. This is one of the few rain jackets with zipper vents. The venture 2 is definitely a step down if you‚Äôre coming from the original venture. Obviously the company is saving money on manufacturing and charging the same or more. I just don‚Äôt get why they cut corners when they‚Äôre charging premium prices. It‚Äôs a bit disappointing but since there‚Äôs not many vented rain jackets the choices are limited.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great buy', 'author': 'Shayler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this jacket for a trip to Ireland. title: Men's Unlined Eisenhower Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks great', 'author': 'B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for my guy who‚Äôs about 6‚Äô2 and it fits him great. Just what he had been wanting', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleeves are a little long', 'author': 'Justin Ian Guaren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this jacket but the sleeves are a little long, so I‚Äôd recommend sizing down if you don‚Äôt have the arm measurements for your normal size', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket! Dickies rocks!', 'author': 'A. Maynard', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Iv been buying this jacket for 15 years. I love this jacket! It is as thin as a shirt but looks good and has pockets and a collar. In the colder weather you can wear a sweatshirt underneath with a hood. This jacket is great for everyday wear. Is sturdy as heck and lasts years even with many washes. The jacket obviously becomes softer with a little wear whereas its quite stiff at first. Oh I totally recommend this jacket! Its great for patches too. The lined Eisenhower jacket is great as well for colder weather Like under 60' ish. I wear the thin jacket all through spring , fall and summer and the lined during the winter. If you have never worn one of these jackets I totally say, Dickies is cool! From skater wear to rockabilly and punk or metal workers , whatever your style or work I highly recommend it because it will last you years and is totally worth the money. The only downfall is there aren't enough pockets, inside pockets would be better i think. Although there is a 'kind-of' inside pocket it isn't sewn to be a proper pocket. Overall yay Dickies Iv been wearing you for 30 years!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Roll Up Your Sleeves And Go To Work', 'author': 'Phill.The.Thrill', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I recently picked up this Dickies Eisenhower jacket for the coming autumn season and I really like it. It‚Äôs made of a sturdy polyester and cotton blend which makes it lightweight but heavy enough for somewhat bad weather. I would suggest that if you‚Äôd like to get a more slim, tapered look, size down. This may also help with the length of the sleeves. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11‚Äù, 205 lbs. I typically wear a Large jacket (42‚Äù chest) but for some reason, the sleeves run long. title: Leather Jackets for Men, Faux Bomber Jacket Men Motorcycle Lapel Asymmetric Zip-Up Blet Slim Fit Biker Coat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Order a size up', 'author': 'L4N1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality is great. Obviously it‚Äôs not a REAL leather jacket, so it‚Äôs super light to wear which is nice. And goes great with a hoodie underneath. Arm are long, but that‚Äôs because I‚Äôm a female, other than that, LOVE this jacket! I guess I got lucky and didn‚Äôt get one that smelt like fish! Lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Jacket for the Price', 'author': 'Julian Cordero', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First, some reviews make this seem like some kind of costume jacket. It is most certainly not. But don‚Äôt be expecting a thick, durable motorcycle jacket. I paid $55 with tax and feel I got my money‚Äôs worth. I don‚Äôt ride motorcycles and don‚Äôt plan on going into any blizzards with this. I should mention that Amazon indicated that even though I normally order a medium, others with my same preference bought a large and it fit better. So I ordered a large. It‚Äôs a good jacket. Thin. And by thin I mean not like a real, thick, heavy moto jacket. This one is soft. When I put it on it felt like I‚Äôd owned it for a while. Fit like a glove. I absolutely love it. Sipped up a little tight around my gut, but I‚Äôve been hitting the churros kinda hard recently. Also, unless I luck out or order things custom tailored- sleeves always fit me long, as they did with this jacket. I am totally okay with it; it‚Äôs a minor thing to me given how great the rest of it fit and how much it cost. I can‚Äôt wait for the chance to wear it out. If you ride, this is probably not the jacket for you. Throw a sweater under it and it might be good in cold weather. TL;DR Outstanding jacket for the price. Not for real motorcycle riders, but great for most everyone else.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs VERY small', 'author': 'Phillip Goodson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I initially ordered a large, which is what I should wear and what Amazon told me I needed based on my purchase history. It's nice enough, but it does run very small.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great for the price', 'author': 'KaciColette', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've had this jacket since April of 2022 and it's been perfect since the day I got it. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not like Leon Kennedy but close enough', 'author': 'zeke von genbu', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's a fantastic jacket, very comfortable and keeps you warm. It also looks great visually and has some high quality to it despite being faux leather. My only complaint is it has some odd measurements, despite ordering in my usual size this jacket runs big, but I cannot recommend ordering a size down as the waist is nowhere near loose enough to actually close the jacket, you probably wouldn't be too happy.So, I've got a great looking jacket that I can only wear with it unzipped and open, it's very baggy, runs big and sleeves often have to be pulled up, but I don't feel comfortable attempting to shrink it or order a size down due to the already tiny waist it has, which has no stretch at all. If you don't care about that, it's worth buying. I'd say get it on a sale if you can. For the time being I will definitely be keeping it as again, it looks fantastic but I really wish it was possible to zip it up. title: Mens Slim Fit Casual One Button Blazer Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits TRUE to size', 'author': 'Anthonny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good price-good quality. Was pleasantly surprised with the product.A good get for any business professional', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Casual and classy', 'author': 'lillyjeans', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice jacket, casual yet classy. Trying to match it to an existing pair of black pant and the fabric was a lot different. If I was ordering this jacket to dress up for a casual event it would be perfect. Very well made, nicely tailored. The fit was not good for me. Although it may be just what you are looking for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Okay for everyday.', 'author': 'William E. Smith', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The cut and fit of this jacket is bad. I'm not overly picky; I usually buy off the rack and the fit is perfect. I've ordered cheap jackets on Amazon before and have been completely satisfied. Unless you are looking for a disposable sports coat for a one-time event which will be held in a dark, dark room. Maybe look elsewhere.Specifics:‚Ä¢ The collar is cut and pressed funny so it goes up high on the back of your neck. Very stiff and though it's folded down, it looks like you're flipping it up to make some kind of '80s style statement.‚Ä¢ That white line in the pocket is not a handkerchief or a paper insert for decoration, it's sewn in and looks incredibly cheap up close. But you can fold it down to be hidden, which makes a slight lump, but better than up.‚Ä¢ I'm pretty thin so the jacket fit well around my waist, the length was good. But the cut of the lapel was so bad that I looked like Bruce Banner in a mid-Hulk moment around the chest. The lapel does not lay naturally, it opens wide like a poorly-fitting tux coat. Even with the button undone, it flares to the side a bit and looks like it fits on the bottom but is a size too small across the chest. Strangely, the shoulders fit okay, except for...‚Ä¢ ...the shoulder pads. Yes, thick, uneven shoulder pads. Felt strange, looked strange.‚Ä¢ The buttons look like cheap plastic. I know for $30 they are going to be cheap plastic, but there's a difference between BEING cheap plastic and looking from 10 feet away like cheap plastic. It looks and feels like the material in a disposable plastic spoon.‚Ä¢ Last point, but there's more: The jacket is fully lined and the lining does not look too bad, BUT when you put your arms into the sleeves, you push the lining out of the other end with your hands so you kind of have to tuck the lining back into your sleeve once you have the jacket on.I was going to return this, but for $30, it hardly seems worth the effort. I'm going to have it steamed and pressed to try to fix some of the sleeve and collar issues and am replacing the buttons with better-looking cheap plastic.One thing I do like about the jacket is the pockets in front are real and fairly large. I hate when sports coats sew the pockets shut to help the line of the jacket. Also the inside pocket, though only one, is pretty functional. The outer pocket flaps also tuck in if you like a cleaner look, so it's not all bad.If you're looking for a good alternative, it's not as low-priced, but the jackets by Ferrecci-Zonettie here on Amazon are great.UPDATE:After wearing the jacket for a few months, some of the flaws have diminished. Fabric has relaxed a bit. It still has most of the problems I mentioned above, but surprisingly, has worn fairly well. I've been rough on it, too, thinking it'd start coming apart at the seams giving me an excuse to toss it. But so far even the too-loose lining has held up to activity. Not a 4-star product, so not revising my rating, but if they let me do 3.5 stars, I'd give it that, haha.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'Nicole N', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my son. We ended up returning because it was too big. We ordered a size up because review said it runs small. My son is pretty slim, he wears a 36R in suit jackets. He wears a men small mostly but sometimes a medium. The material seemed good and would have been a great look if it was smaller. Just wanted to share the review to hopefully help when next person is choosing the size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Value in a Nice Blazer Priced Lower than most Dress Shirts', 'author': 'Larry Epstein', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This was a gift to my grown grandson to wear to the funeral of his other grandfather. I'm tired of seeing people at weddings, funerals, church services, etc. in just shirts or shirts and ties. He owned absolutely no formal wear and never saw the need. I wanted him properly attired for a funeral. He was, and his look impressed everyone. Based on its very low price, I bought him this sports coat as a virtual single-use disposable garment. But, it looks like a quality garment and fits perfectly. I suspect that he will be able to wear it many more times. The lightweight, linen-look fabric is perfect for Florida where he lives. He is a slender man: 6 feet tall and 155 pounds. The large looked great on him.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fitting suit jacket for my teen!', 'author': 'N W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this with not so high expectations based on the price but it was PERFECT! It works ok for that. The shoulders and are a little snug, which is fine. The lower part is like most jackets they make for men - I could comfortable smuggle a basketball under the front of it if I wanted. But that's how they make them all, it seems. I could go up a size and improve the shoulder fit, but then I could probably smuggle two basketballs.Overall it's not bad. The look and workmanship is good. The material is stiff enough not to flap, and thick enough to keep the wind out without being a hothouse inside. It's a good winter/spring coat. It'd be nice if it were better fitted, but that doesn't seem to be an option anywhere outside of slim-fit young adult stuff.On edit, I just wanted to add that I'm happier with it than I started. For bike rides the cut and fit is just fine. If I wanted to tailor it a bit there are side panels that would make that easy. And I'm impressed overall with the sturdiness and breathability of the fabric, which should make it very good for outdoors stuff. A t-shirt and long-sleeved thermal underneath, and it's nice and comfortable down to about 30 degrees. Probably ditch the thermal and it's an overall nice jacket for spring.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super Jacket!', 'author': 'Douglas Cohen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great fit, great price, great style. title: Mens Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket Casual Stylish bomber Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything about this is fantastic except the zipper', 'author': 'Kevin E.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The zipper is problematic but the comfort fit and look are great. I purchased the white, black and gray versions. Love them all', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Zipper not great', 'author': 'Gavonne', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Zipper difficult to use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great jacket', 'author': 'sati', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i got this for my husband. this is very light weight jacket .its good material very soft. i got it in tan color . it fits him very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'Rick W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'exact fit and finish.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Trendy Jacket with a Minor Zipper Glitch', 'author': 'Christopher West', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Hey folks, I recently snatched up the SAVKOOV Men's Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket and here's my two cents. Overall, it's a decent choice for a casual bomber jacket, but it does have a small snag that's worth mentioning.Let's start with the good stuff. First off, the V-shaped pattern solid jacquard design instantly caught my eye. It adds a touch of style without going overboard. Plus, the handpicked textured fabric is a win ‚Äì it's comfortable and breathable, making it ideal for those in-between seasons. No sweat stains for me, thank you very much!Now, let's talk about the fit. The jacket is designed to have a loose fit, which was perfect for my taste. I appreciate its versatility. You can rock it during outdoor adventures, family gatherings, or even while just hanging out on a casual day. It's a jacket for all occasions!Unfortunately, there's a minor issue that cropped up. The zipper, my friends, is a bit finicky. It seems to get stuck quite easily. It's not a dealbreaker, but for the price, I really expected something more durable. The fact that it's made of plastic also leaves me a little uncertain about its longevity. I'm crossing my fingers that it holds up in the long run.Despite the zipper glitch, this jacket is a stylish addition to my wardrobe. The quality is generally good and the fabric has a nice soft feel to it. Just make sure to keep an eye on that zipper while zipping up. If durability is your top priority, you might want to explore other options. But if you're willing to overlook a minor flaw for the sake of style, go ahead and give the SAVKOOV Men's Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket a shot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like the design', 'author': 'Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Color and style ‚Ä¶also very comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A GREAT JACKET', 'author': 'Ralph Lawrence', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is just what I was looking for!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not a bomber jacket, more of a sweater jacket combo', 'author': 'Calvin K Chen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So based on other reviews, I thought that this jacket would run small and ordered a size up in anticipation, but in actuality, for me, this jacket seems to run true to size. I normally wear a large when it comes to jackets, and this XL is actually very big/roomy - so I think it does live up to its description of "loose fitting" - or at the very least, it\'s not smaller than I expected.As for the jacket, it\'s more of a light jacket/sweater jacket vs. an actual bomber jacket, I think only the collar gives you any kind of impression that this is something like a bomber. I think the jacket looks pretty good, and mine has a texture to the fabric that is interesting (although gives it the more sweater feel). I think some of the comments about the zipper are warranted, it\'s not exactly the easiest jacket to zip up, maybe it\'s just a bit stiff to begin with. The arm pocket is a little bit of an interesting design, but not too functional.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars More of a light sweater than a jacket and not loose fitting, but still nice.', 'author': 'Jeremiah', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'While I feel like it\'s pretty obvious from the product photos (as well was the ones that I have included with this review), I feel like the product description of "SAVKOOV Mens Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket Casual Stylish bomber Jacket" is very incorrect for a couple of reasons:1. This is not a "loose fit" item (unless you size up by default to keep your clothing loose). I wear a men\'s large shirt and measure just over 46" through the chest, and this item fits closely when it is zipped. I highly recommend following the size chart!2. This is not at all what I would call a "bomber jacket" (again, this should be obvious from the pictures). A "zip sweater" or even "track jacket" would be a more accurate description.With that said, I do like this jacket. The fit is a little tighter than I expected, but it is attractive and the quality is good. The exception to that quality is the zipper! Right out of the packaging, the zipper was difficult to use. After several uses, it seemed to loosen up a tiny bit, but it still requires a bit of wiggling when first engaging it in order to zip the jacket successfully. I washed and dried the jacket on delicate cycles (as you always should any item that has a zipper) and the both of the zippers still work, so that is always a good sign!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not loose-fitting...', 'author': 'kkr', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is an absolutely nice looking jacket, but in no way is this loose fitting. I followed the instructions on the size - did all the measurements, and my 2XL fits like a regular 2XL - and maybe even a little smaller. It is not loose as I thought it would be. That is a bit disappointing since I wanted something loose fitting, and I proably should have gone with the 3XL - but then again, I don't want a jacket with drooping shoulders as well if it's too big. Otherwise, it looks ok as a regular fit jacket.Otherwise, it looks good and textured very much as the description, but just think of these sizes as Asian sizes and you should probably go bigger. If you are looking for a loose fit, in my opinion you should definitely go for the size higher that your regular size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Columbia Men's Ascender Softshell Front-zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Giftable', 'author': 'Valitia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift. It fit perfectly, hangs nicely, plenty of pockets, comfortable and looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great choice for a variety of conditions', 'author': 'Railgee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ended up purchasing two of these jackets in black. One for working in the yard and out in the public, and second I have set aside for more dressy occasions. I was impressed with the fit, the overall quality of the jacket for the price, its lightness and thinness, and its use in a range of temperatures and conditions. I have used it for light winds and 60 degrees, and heavy winds in the high 20s. I have worn it both for shoveling snow and for attending a play. In all extremes, it performed perfectly. Both the outside of the jacket and inside liner dries quickly. In my opinion, this jacket is an exceptional value for the price. I have much more expensive jackets with big outdoor names, but this one has become my go to choice for all but the most extreme conditions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice jacket, has become my favorite', 'author': 'GVLabs49', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a really nice light to mid-weight jacket and the bonus is, it looks really good. I haven't played golf in it yet, or worn it in the rain, but I will update when I do. Nice material is comfortable and feels very well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket with a few minor issues', 'author': 'B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really like this jacket. The weight is great for anything from cool spring/fall days all the way down to freezing temps. It blocks wind well and does an admirable of keeping me dry while I walk across a rainy parking lot. The classic simple style makes it easy to wear with just about anything.There are a couple of minor things that would make it even better. The sleeves are fleece-lined, which makes for a warm feel but makes it a bit more difficult to pull it off if I'm wearing long sleeves, especially if I'm wearing a sweater. The other thing I'm not crazy about is that the collar will NEVER lie flat. One side always always always sticks up. It's not unique to this jacket, nearly every soft shell I've ever owned has had this problem. I suppose it's handy if you actually zip it up all the way, but who does that?I still wear it a lot. It's my go-to jacket if it's above 25F outside.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, runs a bit larger than expected but that's okay", 'author': 'Robert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great quality you would expect from the Columbia brand. title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. This shoe was thoughtfully designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!', 'author': 'monica cerda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wear heeled leather boots as my day to day fashion, I‚Äôve never been a sneaker person and so after complaining to a friend about hiking sneakers I purchased hurting the top of my foot after an hour of wear, they suggested I try hiking boots instead. I felt like a fool for never connecting the dots. Lol.Well‚Ä¶I found these, loved the color options and the reviews seemed pretty legit! I‚Äôve worn them twice so far while running errands to see how they feel and I have to say, no discomfort and so lightweight!!Now down to sizing: With stylish boots, I‚Äôm typically a size 8, and I did order an 8 initially, however with a thin sock, they felt pretty snug and I thought maybe they might start to bother my toes since there‚Äôs more cushion that what I‚Äôm used to and what if I want to wear thick socks?For me that was enough to go up to an 8.5 juuuust to be on the safe side and because‚Ä¶why not find out? $75 is still $75.So glad I did! They feel roomier yet still a great fit, so if you‚Äôre in limbo, I‚Äôd say size up .5 if you want to be able to throw these on without switching your socks. üòâHappy I got these and I‚Äôm looking forward being more active!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Time WAS a Charm! Only took 5 tries to find Prince Charming's Boot!", 'author': 'FLGulfGrnEz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read the reviews wherever I could find them. I had become very confused over the sizing. I have a hard enough time getting the right size without this much of a difference thrown at me too!I was in love @first glance, beautiful dark gray with aqua strings. Ordered size 7 as suggested though I wear a size 6.5 or 6. Feet measures a size 5-5.5, L=8.5" R=8.7". There lies the rub, right foot doesn\'t fit sizes same as left one by a fraction so hit or miss. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Zippers are the bomb for higher topped boots/shoes especially with fat feet, high instep, opens the slimmer top for feet to get to sole.Back to the size sessions; First was great price on 7\'s, looked order back up and saw where I had ordered from the warehouse! Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. Still have plenty of room through toe bed area but TOO PRETTY, COMFY & TIRED to second guess anymore, size 6 it is!Merry Christmas Folks! Good Luck with your sizing, hope this finally solves some problems??? It was the socks that made all the difference which I kept hearing in almost every review but didn\'t hear the bell in head go off... All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! Uh Oh, gotta get lined pants, knit cap, goggles, warmer gloves, down filled vest... Merry Christmas to me.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality but rubbed on my ankle', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The shoe was nicely made and looked to be good quality. When I first tried them on , they were comfortable and looked cute. I walked around in them for about an hour when I started to feel rubbing on my right ankle in the back. I needed these for a long hike and knew they were not going to work for me. I think these would be a great shoe for shorter walks or to wear around the yard. I did size up half a size because I would be wearing heavier socks and they fit great. Just not for a long hike that I was planning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Hiking Shoes', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These shoes rock!! I wore these on a trip to Iceland and they kept my feet warm and dry. We made several long hikes through various terrains (mountain, river, gravel, mud) and they didn‚Äôt hurt my feet or feel too heavy. They are perfectly light weight and sturdy, provide ankle support and traction. These are my go to shoes for hikes now and they have held up well for at least the last year. Definitely worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Right Out of the Box', 'author': 'Michele Kohan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with these boots. They were super comfortable right out of the box and I wore them for three straight hours immediately upon putting them on. I love the classic look of these boots and can't wait to hike in them! I looked at a few different colors that were available in my size (11 women), and initially chose the classic tan and red because of the lower price; but I found I really love the color and am glad I chose thetah. They remind me of hiking boots I used to have when I lived back in Pennsylvania growing up.This new pair of Columbia boots are true hiking boots, with cushion all around the ankle and tongue, a flexible thick sole and also appear to be waterproof by design, although haven't tested that yet.The down side is the boots will be too hot to wear in the summer here in Florida, but are working great for the unexpected cold snap right now. They will come in handy for trips out of state in my camper. A+ boots!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and Cute', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I picked these based on great reviews and was not disappointed. I wear a women‚Äôs 10 in non-athletic shoes and a 10.5 wide in athletic shoes. Amazon recommended a 10, and I‚Äôm glad I got the 10.5 wide. I can lace them tight for a nice fit, and they don‚Äôt press on my bunion.Pros- Not heavy, but feel sturdy enough for rough terrain, snow and ice- Beautiful color and red accents- Don‚Äôt make my big ole feet look too big- Comfortable from the minute I put them onCon- Insole is glued down tightly and not removable. All shoe manufacturers should make their insoles removable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Columbia hiking boots', 'author': 'Deborah Kretsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with my purchases. I ordered a brand new pair and also went and bought the warehouse inspected used one on additional discount. The used pair is in perfect condition, not a mark or sign of wear anywhere on them. They‚Äôre just like the brand new pair. Perfect!I wear orthotics in my shoes, I tried them both with and without them to see how they feel. I will of course wear them with the orthotics otherwise my plantar fasciitis will get inflamed. I want to wear one pair at work which is standing on my feet my entire shift on cement floors and the other for daily use or camping etc. I will also be spraying a treatment on them for additional protection against the elements.I do have wide feet. One being bigger and slightly wider than the other as well. I always wore a 6.5 shoe, but I guess my feet spread out over time so now I wear 7.5-8 shoes/boots. I went with the 7.5 wide on these and they feel just fine. If I got 8s I think they‚Äôd have been too long and I‚Äôd be tripping on my own feet. Definitely glad I got the wides they would have been too narrow if I got the regular ones. The orthotics raise my foot in the shoe so I have to loosen the laces a lot to accommodate and this is the first time I‚Äôve had extra length on the laces to tie rather than a teeny amount to tie my shoes!For today I am wearing these around the house to break them in. They feel fine out of the box but I tend to get foot fatigue easily due to my foot condition so I need to break them in. My baby toes always get the brunt of the pain when wearing shoes and especially new shoes. I haven‚Äôt felt that pain right away like I normally would. So that‚Äôs a plus for comfort!!So far I love these and so glad I bought both pairs! I love the color and the red laces. They remind me of the old hiking boots I used to see growing up, only a more comfortable updated version! The other colors look cute in the pics but I feel limited to what I can wear them with so I feel these are more neutral to the colors I tend to wear. Hopefully these last a long time. I do own other Columbia products and am usually pleased with their products, this is the first time purchasing footwear.Thank you!Edit I‚Äôve been wearing these to work using my orthotics, standing on my feet on cement floor. No discomfort at all, they have been very comfortable! So happy with these boots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In love!', 'author': 'Desiree Mangan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I asked for these as a Christmas present and boy I am so happy I did! I usually wear an 8 however I do have wider feet and knew I was planning on wearing thicker socks so I asked for an 8 wide. I unfortunately have not had the chance to wear these while actually hiking, however I did get to wear them during the recent snow storm. I was waiting for a pair of snow boots that I ordered to come in which they didn‚Äôt but I knew that these were thick and waterproof so I figured why not wear them while shoveling. Clearly they would be much better at keeping my feet warm and dry compared to my Ugg boots. Which it is no surprise that they actually did! My feet were BONE DRY. I was out there for over an hour walking through nearly knee high snow, both shoveling/clearing off cars in my drive way. I love these shoes. Not only this but I had to go to work and play outside in the snow with my preschool kids and same thing, nice and dry. I also wore them all day, 8-5, and my feet feel great! Though I haven‚Äôt used them for what I actually asked for them for, I can tell they will perform just as well as they have already! So buy them you won‚Äôt regret it:)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Packable Rain Jacket Outdoor Waterproof Hooded Lightweight Classic Cycling Raincoat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Rain jacket for the hubby!', 'author': 'Cody Montes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am absolutely delighted with the Men's Packable Rain Jacket! This jacket has quickly become my go-to outerwear for any outdoor adventure. Its lightweight design makes it incredibly easy to carry, whether I'm hiking, camping, or simply running errands around town. Despite its featherweight construction, the jacket offers outstanding waterproof protection, keeping me dry and comfortable even during the heaviest downpours. The hood provides additional coverage and can be adjusted for a snug fit, ensuring maximum protection from the elements. I also appreciate the breathability of the fabric, which prevents me from feeling clammy or overheated. Plus, the packable feature is a game-changer, allowing me to conveniently stow the jacket in my backpack or glove compartment when not in use. Overall, I couldn't be happier with this rain jacket. It's stylish, functional, and offers unbeatable value for the price. title: Men's Rain Jacket Waterproof Lightweight Packable Rain Shell Raincoat with Hood for Golf Hiking Travel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to carry!', 'author': 'John B', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easily fits into its stuff sack so goes into a backpack or overnight bag easily. And oh, it‚Äôs a great rain jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits well, looks good', 'author': 'DPotter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'and it keeps me dry, too! I bought it for a trip because it packs down into the included stuff sack. To my delight water just beads on it. I love the two-tone look, too. This travel rain jacket has earned a place in my every-day closet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A plastic jacket - minimal, but does the job', 'author': 'Jesse Calcat', 'rating': 4, 'content': "What I like about this jacket:-Waterproof-Windproof-Adjustable/tightenable hem and hood.-A fun, attractive, and hard to find color (a bright red-orange)-Two external zipped pockets, and two waist-level internal pockets! This is amazing for such a basic jacket, especially when SO many jackets, even of higher quality and price seem to offer only one small internal pocket, or quite often, none at all.-Perfect for warm rainy days, as it provides zero warmth and has no insulation or even lining-Very compact and portable, easily compacting into its own included small carrying bag-Intelligently designed, and the company seems to care about the functionality of its products.-A very good value/low price.-Fits true to size.What I'm not so crazy about:-It's literally a plastic sheet - thicker than your typical rain poncho, but very stiff and noisy.-Non-adjustable cuffs. The stiffness of the jacket's material makes the elastic, non-adjustable/non-tightenable cuffs fail to make a very good seal around my wrists, and I have pretty fat wrists.-Very thin and actually translucent - If you carry any dark items in the pockets, they can be seen by people (at least for this orange-red color). As I like to carry my dark wallet in the internal pockets of my jackets, it's almost advertised with the translucency of the material.-Absolutely no lining or insulation - I wish they had at least added a mesh lining or something, as the plastic material sticks to your arms if you wear short sleeves. Also, a lining would help to provide a bit of security insomuch as providing a visual barrier (see above regarding the jacket being translucent) - kind of like a security mailing envelope versus a non-security envelope.-Not necessarily a con, but the jacket provides ZERO warmth, so it's only really suitable for warmer rainy days, or to act as a hardshell jacket to go over your own layered clothing selected for colder days - again, this is not necessarily a con.This is a nice jacket overall, very basic and no-frills, with some nice extra features. I think a few minor tweaks could really make this a winning jacket. I'm going to be purchasing Outdoor Venture's next model up from this jacket, which has a mesh lining, pit zips, and additional features, to compare to this jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and fit.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great price for a really nice rain jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect', 'author': 'Peggy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great fitting, light weight jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely does the job.', 'author': 'Dexter', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wore it the past 3 days it was raining and it definitely kept me dry. title: Men's Waterproof Ski Jacket Warm Winter Snow Coat Mountain Windbreaker Hooded Raincoat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Its comfortable and warm at a great price.', 'author': 'Robinson', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Initially, I ordered a size Large, but found it a bit tight, especially since I prefer layering up in the colder months. The exchange process for an XL was easy as it always is with prime. The larger size fits perfectly (XL). It\'s roomy enough for multiple layers underneath but still maintains its shape, so you don\'t feel like you\'re wearing a bulky blanket or look like the "Michelin Man" . Performance-wise, this jacket is great. It has kept me warm and dry. The insulation is effective without being overly heavy. I\'ve been out in snow and light rain, and the waterproofing holds up. It\'s exactly what you need for a cold or snowy winter day.I noticed some reviews mentioned issues with the zipper, but I\'ve had no such problems.There\'s ample space for your phone, ski pass, wallet, and even small snacks.Value for Money is great , I would recommend it to a friend or even buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality - Keeps You Warm', 'author': 'Dee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My apologies, as this coat is a rich black color, however due to the lighting in the room you can‚Äôt tell. This was a gift to my husband, as we live in the northern US where we are deep in snow. First off, this coat is a medium weight, and the inside is all soft fur. Even the hoodie is lined with fur, which worked excellent in keeping his head/neck/mouth area covered from the cold. It was roomy with a Velcro strap to keep it snug, and it is wide enough that it covers the top of the jacket when zipped. There are 3 sets of pockets: down on the side, one on the chest and one inside the jacket. This is great, as you don‚Äôt always get a secure inside pocket to tuck away your wallet, keys, money, etc. The size shown is an XX-Large and is a good length in which it would cover down beneath the bum. My husband went out to snow blow wearing a long-sleeve t-shirt and this jacket. He was surprised that it kept him warm, as we were getting snow drifts from the wind. He is pretty thin and he was surprised he didn‚Äôt get cold at all. We had a bit of rain a week later, which this jacket did great at repelling water. The cuffs on the sleeve are adjustable, and the coat also has small pull straps to tighten the hoodie around your face. This jacket will surprise you ‚Äì it has the quality of a more expensive jacket but is affordable for most to buy. You can‚Äôt go wrong with this jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket!', 'author': 'Ben', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So I actually bought this jacket with a different purpose in mind rather than for skiing. I am an athletic trainer and during the late fall, winter, and spring seasons, I am covering all different sports in all different kinds of weather because I am in a four seasons state. The first thing I did when I opened up this jacket was run it under a faucet and make sure waterproof meant waterproof and not water resistant. I can safely say this jacket served its purpose for me more than well. In pouring, freezing rain or snow or sleet, it kept my torso completely warm and dry. It fits very well and is comfortable to wear. On days when I want it for warmth and am not concerned about the weather, I just take the hood off. All the pockets have zippers so I don't have to worry about losing anything or my items getting wet. I definitely would recommend this jacket to any other fellow ATs or people that are forced to stand outside for hours in the pouring, cold, rain.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nearly a Perfect Jacket', 'author': 'Joseph', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Price is great for what you get. First let me say I really like this jacket a lot. The jacket is great looking. Had lots of compliments from other men, asked me where I got it. The lining is warm and the coat is great in the rain and the length is perfect, I am 5\' 9" 180 pounds I bought a size large, and it covers right to the bottom of my butt cheeks, keeping my butt dry and warm. I love the coat. It also has a removal zippered hood so you don\'t have to have it hanging there all the time when it\'s not need in warmer weather, etc. But, it will require two changes to the design to make this a perfect coat for me. #1 It needs some velcro closures on the zipper flaps to keep it closed. Yes there are two snaps, at the top and bottom of flaps, but if you\'re wearing gloves they are tough to deal with, and even when buttoned, snow and air could possibly sneak under the flap. Velcro would be a quick and easy way to secure the zipper flap. #2 It needs a double zipper. Because of the length of the jacket, butt cheeks covered, I have to fully unzip it when I sit down in the car, etc. I usually "hike-it up" and leave it zippered but it would be more comfortable if it had a double zipper which would allow me to just unzip a few inches from the bottom. It would also make it easier to get my hands into my pants pockets as well.So bottom line: If you need a warm waterproof great looking great fitting almost perfectly designed jacket, I highly recommend this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The quality on these....waow!', 'author': 'Dwaine Burrell', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ok I know I didn't show much in the pics but trust me guys I'm absolutely happy with my purchase. This right here is what I call bang for your buck. This jacket checks all the boxes. It's comfy, warm, durable (well so far), looks good, and holds up nicely against the elements. I highly recommend these. Oh yeah almost forgot: I'm 6 feet tall, slender built, 175 pounds, and I purchased the size medium. I do wish they were an inch or two longer to fully cover my butt but I'm quite fine with the current length. I doubt the large would've made much of a difference anyway based on the dimensions provided on the website.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for price', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this just for snowboarding. Its super warm, has lots of pockets, fits really well, keeps you dry even in light rain & snow. Looks great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Holds up very well after 1.5 years with auspiciously large pockets.', 'author': 'Bryan Carter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is an excellent jacket for the price. A year and a half of regular wear later and there are no notable issues with the jacket. I'm sure that higher price points might net better gear, but I honestly have zero complaints. It's warm and all of the zippers work fine still.On the topic of zippers, it is worth noting that the pockets are unusually large. On my jacket, I can easily fit 40-oz bottles of malt liquor into each of the side pockets and 10-oz cans of olives into the other pockets with room to spare. Obviously, you can put other substances into the pockets as well. Whatever your position requires.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for skiing', 'author': 'MICHELLE WILLIAMS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my son for Christmas. He wears it skiing and quad riding on cold days. Keeps him warm. Not bulky. Fits perfectly and nice style for whatever occasion you want it for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ski jacket', 'author': 'Rhiannon Britney', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This item arrived in good condition and fast. The item was double bagged and both bags were vacuum sealed. The jacket is very well designed (with 2 exceptions, venting & need of a velcro seal along the zipper). There are 4 pockets that all are zippered and water proof (1 inside the left front, 1 left breast, 1 left front panel & 1 right front panel). There is a hood (removable) that also has a fleece lining just like the inside of the jacket around the body. There are velco closures around the wrists. The jacket is a little poofy(just a little) but not overly so, it feels comfortable and is easy to move in. It says in the advertisement that it is snow/water/ wind proof...I will find out about the water/wind proofing this weekend, but since I live in SoCal we don't get snow except in the mountains. It is a great buy! I originally ordered a 2XL because I thought it would run a bit small, but it didn't. So I was able to return it easily and I ordered a large (accidentally ordered 2). The large fit perfectly so I was able to return it easily too! I am completely satisfied with this product and the speed at which it arrived and the easy return! 5 Stars to Amazon and their personal! ;)", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Insane Winter Jacket Value', 'author': 'Eric Ngo', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For the price, these are hard to beat. I come from a place where if we see 60 degrees on the weather app, we're wearing multiple layers, hoodies, and sweatpants around and the coldest place we know is the Costco Dairy Section. That being said, the insulation on this jacket was intense. I took these snowboarding up Snoqualmie in subfreezing temps and felt warm and cozy the entire time, even having to unzip at times to cool down. There are pockets that are waterproof in the front chest and inside, but do not store any valuables in the zip up pockets in the front as those are not waterproof. Overall, this jacket was a real winner in my winter rotation this season and I can't wait to wear it again next winter.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I wanted something for general wear in low 30s to low 40s temps. Very first impression was good when the bag, felt heavier than I thought it would. It looked good when I first opened the bag and tried it on with just a t shirt. The first shakedown run was going to be an early morning walk in the woods at 32 degrees. With a T shirt and henley on and it was fine with room for a heavier sweater or even a hoodie if needed. I am 5-11, 200 and ordered an XL.Just as I am about to go out the door it all fell apart as I put my phone into the inside breast pocket. By today\'s standards, I have a small phone, 6 inches tall. The pocket can only hold something less than 5 inches when velcroed shut. The outside front pocket is the same, only something 5 inches or less can be put in while snapped shut. So, phone is 6", sunglasses are 6" and neither can be put in pockets securely. Now I notice how shallow the side pockets are towards the outside. I couldn\'t put anything in there (hat, gloves), other than my hands that I ever wanted to see again. Nothing I placed in the shirt pockets would be secure even to bend over or squat down.For me these are terrible design flaws. So big that it makes what otherwise is a pretty good shirt into a complete disaster for its intended use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Mens Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket Casual Stylish bomber Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Everything about this is fantastic except the zipper', 'author': 'Kevin E.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The zipper is problematic but the comfort fit and look are great. I purchased the white, black and gray versions. Love them all', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Zipper not great', 'author': 'Gavonne', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Zipper difficult to use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great jacket', 'author': 'sati', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i got this for my husband. this is very light weight jacket .its good material very soft. i got it in tan color . it fits him very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'Rick W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'exact fit and finish.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Trendy Jacket with a Minor Zipper Glitch', 'author': 'Christopher West', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Hey folks, I recently snatched up the SAVKOOV Men's Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket and here's my two cents. Overall, it's a decent choice for a casual bomber jacket, but it does have a small snag that's worth mentioning.Let's start with the good stuff. First off, the V-shaped pattern solid jacquard design instantly caught my eye. It adds a touch of style without going overboard. Plus, the handpicked textured fabric is a win ‚Äì it's comfortable and breathable, making it ideal for those in-between seasons. No sweat stains for me, thank you very much!Now, let's talk about the fit. The jacket is designed to have a loose fit, which was perfect for my taste. I appreciate its versatility. You can rock it during outdoor adventures, family gatherings, or even while just hanging out on a casual day. It's a jacket for all occasions!Unfortunately, there's a minor issue that cropped up. The zipper, my friends, is a bit finicky. It seems to get stuck quite easily. It's not a dealbreaker, but for the price, I really expected something more durable. The fact that it's made of plastic also leaves me a little uncertain about its longevity. I'm crossing my fingers that it holds up in the long run.Despite the zipper glitch, this jacket is a stylish addition to my wardrobe. The quality is generally good and the fabric has a nice soft feel to it. Just make sure to keep an eye on that zipper while zipping up. If durability is your top priority, you might want to explore other options. But if you're willing to overlook a minor flaw for the sake of style, go ahead and give the SAVKOOV Men's Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket a shot.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really like the design', 'author': 'Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Color and style ‚Ä¶also very comfortable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A GREAT JACKET', 'author': 'Ralph Lawrence', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is just what I was looking for!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not a bomber jacket, more of a sweater jacket combo', 'author': 'Calvin K Chen', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So based on other reviews, I thought that this jacket would run small and ordered a size up in anticipation, but in actuality, for me, this jacket seems to run true to size. I normally wear a large when it comes to jackets, and this XL is actually very big/roomy - so I think it does live up to its description of "loose fitting" - or at the very least, it\'s not smaller than I expected.As for the jacket, it\'s more of a light jacket/sweater jacket vs. an actual bomber jacket, I think only the collar gives you any kind of impression that this is something like a bomber. I think the jacket looks pretty good, and mine has a texture to the fabric that is interesting (although gives it the more sweater feel). I think some of the comments about the zipper are warranted, it\'s not exactly the easiest jacket to zip up, maybe it\'s just a bit stiff to begin with. The arm pocket is a little bit of an interesting design, but not too functional.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars More of a light sweater than a jacket and not loose fitting, but still nice.', 'author': 'Jeremiah', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'While I feel like it\'s pretty obvious from the product photos (as well was the ones that I have included with this review), I feel like the product description of "SAVKOOV Mens Loose Fit Lightweight Jacket Casual Stylish bomber Jacket" is very incorrect for a couple of reasons:1. This is not a "loose fit" item (unless you size up by default to keep your clothing loose). I wear a men\'s large shirt and measure just over 46" through the chest, and this item fits closely when it is zipped. I highly recommend following the size chart!2. This is not at all what I would call a "bomber jacket" (again, this should be obvious from the pictures). A "zip sweater" or even "track jacket" would be a more accurate description.With that said, I do like this jacket. The fit is a little tighter than I expected, but it is attractive and the quality is good. The exception to that quality is the zipper! Right out of the packaging, the zipper was difficult to use. After several uses, it seemed to loosen up a tiny bit, but it still requires a bit of wiggling when first engaging it in order to zip the jacket successfully. I washed and dried the jacket on delicate cycles (as you always should any item that has a zipper) and the both of the zippers still work, so that is always a good sign!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 1, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not loose-fitting...', 'author': 'kkr', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is an absolutely nice looking jacket, but in no way is this loose fitting. I followed the instructions on the size - did all the measurements, and my 2XL fits like a regular 2XL - and maybe even a little smaller. It is not loose as I thought it would be. That is a bit disappointing since I wanted something loose fitting, and I proably should have gone with the 3XL - but then again, I don't want a jacket with drooping shoulders as well if it's too big. Otherwise, it looks ok as a regular fit jacket.Otherwise, it looks good and textured very much as the description, but just think of these sizes as Asian sizes and you should probably go bigger. If you are looking for a loose fit, in my opinion you should definitely go for the size higher that your regular size.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Order a size up', 'author': 'L4N1', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Quality is great. Lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding Jacket for the Price', 'author': 'Julian Cordero', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First, some reviews make this seem like some kind of costume jacket. It is most certainly not. But don‚Äôt be expecting a thick, durable motorcycle jacket. I paid $55 with tax and feel I got my money‚Äôs worth. I don‚Äôt ride motorcycles and don‚Äôt plan on going into any blizzards with this. I should mention that Amazon indicated that even though I normally order a medium, others with my same preference bought a large and it fit better. So I ordered a large. It‚Äôs a good jacket. Thin. And by thin I mean not like a real, thick, heavy moto jacket. This one is soft. When I put it on it felt like I‚Äôd owned it for a while. Fit like a glove. I absolutely love it. Sipped up a little tight around my gut, but I‚Äôve been hitting the churros kinda hard recently. Also, unless I luck out or order things custom tailored- sleeves always fit me long, as they did with this jacket. I am totally okay with it; it‚Äôs a minor thing to me given how great the rest of it fit and how much it cost. I can‚Äôt wait for the chance to wear it out. If you ride, this is probably not the jacket for you. Throw a sweater under it and it might be good in cold weather. TL;DR Outstanding jacket for the price. Not for real motorcycle riders, but great for most everyone else.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs VERY small', 'author': 'Phillip Goodson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I initially ordered a large, which is what I should wear and what Amazon told me I needed based on my purchase history. Chill.', 'author': 'Toy Daemon', 'rating': 4, 'content': '"The way of the wind."XiaoYouYu\'s Lightweight Windbreaker Bomber Jacket is made of a polyester fabric. The collar, cuffs and hem is elastic and offers a good amount of stretch without binding. The lining on my sample is brown and not white as pictured in the product listing. The zipper, is just ok. I had hoped it was a more heavy duty zipper. The stitching looks to be fine. The two side pockets are deep, but the material is the same as the lining and it\'s a bit thin. I can feel the elastic band through the pockets. If the pockets were slightly higher and a little shallower, I think I wouldn\'t have notice it as much. The fit is about as expected. Which is to say, if you normally wear a large, the "Large" will fit you. My sample arrived just as the temperature took a dive and while it kept some of the cold out, it was no match for the El Nino induced cold front. Style wise, I think it\'s more baseball jacket than a bomber jacket. I can picture this jacket with a sports team logo on it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My wife said I look, "cool"', 'author': 'T. My look has traditionally been very conservative, laid back, not interested in being noticed.BUT! When I put on this jacket my wife literally said she had to change her outfit because we were going out and I couldn't look cooler than her. It's a unique experience for me there for sure.The fit on the jacket is great. Just as I'd expect. I'm an XL comfortably, so a bit loose, and it fits just as well for that. The material does not feel cheap and the zipper feels really solid, so aces there.The jacket is a light jacket - which is great! Because I get too hot with heavier jackets so I can wear this out and about on more brisk fall-type days or when I just want another layer to look nicer than a standard tshirt.Overall, super happy with this jacket and pretty happy to hear that I'm looking cool now.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]
