title: Men's Casual Washed Cotton Military Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars With a little work, this oddly-designed jacket can be your next iconic look', 'author': 'Tuna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So I‚Äôll start off and say that as this jacket comes, it is kind of a disappointment. The aesthetic is great, I loved the way it looked before I bought it and still loved it when it arrived TODAY but the measurements are kind of unusual. I bought a medium, which is the smallest size available that will fit me based on sleeve length and chest/shoulder size. I‚Äôm a 6‚Äô1, 180lb man with a pretty wide chest and shoulders. The sleeves end right where I‚Äôd like them, and the simple button cuffs feel right at home where they rest when I‚Äôm wearing the jacket. And that‚Äôs something I struggle with so I love it.However the sleeves and body of the jacket seem to be pretty voluminous. If I bend my arm, the sheer amount of extra space and fabric is evident. In the sample picture, where the cuff is on my wrist is where it is when my arm is relaxed as well. The sleeve hasn‚Äôt fallen down in the picture, so there isn‚Äôt any reason for there to be that much fabric bunched up in the arm. Similarity, the machined quality is evident, as is the fact that it was probably manufactured dome time ago snd put in storage. The wrinkling is expected but the ‚Äústand collar‚Äù is dented and creased so severely it looks like the coat you find in the back of your closet that has been pinned under your grandmother‚Äôs old Rainbow vacuum for half of a decade. Basically, it‚Äôs gonna take more than the average steam to smooth out.This issue is more of a personal thing, but the first thing I did was remove the brand tag inside. No offense to the manufacturers, but I don‚Äôt drive off of the car lot with the dealer plate border on either (unless you‚Äôre paying me, I am not advertising for you) and the tag inside this jacket is HUGE. I own clothes ranging from $10 Hanes sleep pants to a $650 leather jacket. One of the few things I‚Äôve noticed is that the larger and more obnoxious the manufacturers fingerprint is, the lower the quality of the item is. (For instance both those Hanes pants and that leather jacket have visible tags are less than 2x2 inches and both items of clothing have proven their durability over 3+ years of continued and aggressive use). Let‚Äôs hope that trend does not continue here.Now for the reason that this jacket is perfect, amazing, and I want more than one:This is a no frills jacket. There aren‚Äôt pointless zippers that don‚Äôt give access to anything, there aren‚Äôt odd logos or characters displayed in odd places. This jacket is a blank canvas on the outside with ample seamwork. I like to personalize my clothes a little bit (a small colored thread accent here, maybe putting new buttons on, maybe a lapel pin or sew-on patch) and this jacket seems to be designed specifically with that in mind. Not to mention, because of the aforementioned seamwork, it‚Äôll be easy to take the baggy parts in without compromising the jacket‚Äôs structural integrity. (If you are unable to do a job like that yourself, it‚Äôs jot usually costly to get an adjustment like that made.).So there it is: while I have a lot of small grievances against whoever designed this jacket personally, the things I love about it faaaaaaar outweigh the negatives. For an extra $20-$40 or just your own time, this good-looking but plain and oddly-designed jacket could be your personalized masterpiece. I like it, and I intend to buy the next one in small, just to see if the base fit is better as the measurements from the seller make no sense. But I intend to have this jacket in navy and black as well as the green I already bought. And there‚Äôs a thicker winterized version that I‚Äôm probably going to end up owning at least two of them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Husband loves it!', 'author': 'Sam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Fits perfect! Great quality. My husband loves wearing it! It's such a great style too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Runs large. A little wide through body.', 'author': 'Nanarobin', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Very classy looking. Great material, color (green) and style. My husband often wears xl so purchased an xl. He\'s 5\'8", 190. Sleeves a little long but usually are. I think it should have been a large or medium but he LOVES it. Price was incredible. Macy\'s or Nordstrom or even Penneys would have been $80-100+', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'Texas Buyer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really good, well-fitting and stylish jacket. I wear it frequently and was surprised at how heavy duty it is.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this jacket', 'author': 'Jay', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My new favorite casual Fall jacket. Feels quality and fits just right. I've received quite a few compliments.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars encaja perfecto', 'author': 'lissette', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Vale la pena pagar el precio , la chaqueta esta bonita y no destiNe. De los pocos productos echos en china con los que he quedadeo satisfecho peso 70 kg "sin panza" la talla mediana perfecta para mi.muy util para salidas casuales, ha recibido algunos elogios, sin duda lo recomiendo.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Overall good purchase', 'author': 'Peanuts', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Just what I wanted, a lighter weight product, trendy enough look, well constructed garment, and just the right length ( slightly longer). Won‚Äôt go wrong if its what you‚Äôre looking for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Only 2 buttons on front! Polyester lining throughout. Tight in upper arms.', 'author': 'GalCalif', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Quality of zipper was fine, but there are only TWO buttons in the front over the zipper. One is at the very top. The second is at the very bottom. They are pretty much useless. The fabric flap over the zipper having no buttons other than the very top and very bottom flops out and sticks out. One can't just use the snaps as one would like as there are only those two.For me the upper arms are tight and the chest is a little tight. For comparison:1. Levi'sLevi's Men's Big & Tall Washed Cotton Military Jacket size LLevi's had very very tight upper arms very tight compared to WenVen in the same size L. The Levi's zippers were bad quality and one was broken on arrival. This has better zippers. The Levi's had good snaps.2. WhitetailsLegendary Whitetails Men's Oakridge Vintage Washed Canvas Jacket size MThe Whitetails in size M (no L is available) fits on me with MORE room in the upper arms and chest than the WenVen in size L. The Whitetails has a superb heavy zipper in front AND good snaps up and down the entire front. The Whitetails has a wonderfully comfortable and warm lining and a removable hood. This WenVen is not nearly as good with a slick polyester lining and a worse fit.3. WallsWalls Men's Amarillo Vintage Duck Cotton Twill Jacket size L and XL (I tried both L and XL)The Walls are a good quality product, but for the the rear length (from collar to bottom in back) is very very short and over my belt. The WenVen is proper length. The Walls have no zipper, but they have good snaps all the way down the front. The size of the Walls is larger overall than the WenVen. The size L Walls fits my arms well (not tight) and chest correctly as well. Size L in WenVen is smaller and tighter. XL Walls in spite of being XL has the same very short back.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'Samantha N', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I liked the jacket so much I got the green one too. Quality seems to be good. Not a thick jacket. Sizing is correct. Hard to keep the jacket from getting wrinkles', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good jacket', 'author': 'Chris', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Warm', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Heavyweight Sherpa Hoodies for Men, Thick Fleece Lined Full Zip Up Winter Warm Sweatshirts Work Jackets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Husband‚Äôs favorite hoodie.', 'author': 'Helen Valentine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this hoodie for my husband for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. The material is so soft and warm and I am thinking about getting one for myself. The colors are so pretty and vivid. My husband prefers this one to his others which are by expensive and famous labels. He is 5‚Äô10‚Äù tall and weighs 170 lbs. He usually wears a large but I got the extra- large which is a better fit and covers up his stomach girth. Overall it provides the warmth he is looking for while looking stylish. One of the best products offered on Amazon. I would suggest going up a size larger than you normally would and it should be perfect for you. He has even received many compliments on it. The price can‚Äôt be beat and it looks like a truly high end hoodie.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A great, warm coat that fits as expected', 'author': 'Jason Baisden', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Firstly, I'm a big guy that wears 4x shirts. I'm also 6'3. In the variety of 4x shirts, some fit, some don't. I was worried this jacket might not fit well when zipped. I'm please to say this jacket fits amazingly well. It's not too tight anywhere even when zipped up. It's a jacket that fits and is warm, so pretty much exactly what I ordered and expected.Some things to note:1) Sherpa is really freaking warm. If it's 30 degrees outside, this feels great. If its 60 or more, I'm sweating.2) The sleeves are made of a smoother material that isn't sherpa. This has an odd, pleasing cooling effect that balances the heat.3) While the jacket fits, the hood does feel overly large, but you can't have it all, right?4) There are pockets where you'd expect but that's it. There are no inside pockets and no other pockets outside of the typical left/right pockets. They're reasonably deep so I'm not worried about anything falling out.5) I had to pick a color motif that wasn't my first choice. Despite that, the charcoal, blue, white design looks better than it does in the picture, though, I'd have preferred a darker, more solid color. I chose this design based on time constraints...I needed a jacket fast.6) Speaking of needing it fast...the item was scheduled to arrive via prime shipping on Sunday. I ordered Saturday for a trip where I'd leave on Wednesday early am. The jacket was late and didn't arrive until Weds. Amazingly, it wasn't stolen from my porch so a big hurray for human decency!All things told, I'm giving it 5 stars. I needed a winter jacket reasonably priced. This works. No complaints.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars great coat', 'author': 'ACS207', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'warm, soft, not too heavy. only one complaint, the length is a little short.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome', 'author': 'C Kendle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this for my husband for work and he says it‚Äôs comfortable and warm. I would just recommend sizing up. He usually wears a large so I bought an x large and it fits him well. Good quality too.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very comfortable, winter hoodie', 'author': 'Thomas Gray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'comfortable, warm. its not your typical hoodie, its more like a winter jacket. gives lots of room, and well cut, looks good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Sleeve issues', 'author': 'InCogNito', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'It‚Äôs soft and warm. The sleeves are my issue. They do not have the same fluffy, soft lining as the body and hood. Whatever the material is that was used for the sleeve lining feels cheap. The sleeves are ridiculously long, and could stand for several inches to be cut off for them to fit properly. It‚Äôs like a kid playing dress up, the sleeves hang down below my fingertips about two inches. Pushing the sleeves up so the cuffs are around my wrists causes the sleeves to bunch up, making them uncomfortable. Worse, the cuffs are fairly loose, so the sleeves slip down requiring them to constantly be pushed up. If I knew how to sew I would just cut the sleeves off and turn it into a vest. Three stars for the warmth and softness of the body and hood. title: Men's Classic All-Sport Waterproof Breathable Rain Suit
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality Product', 'author': 'Ron Scarborough', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have owned many pairs of Frogg Toggs over the years. I use them for rain protection motorcycle riding. I love that they breath and once rode 300 miles in driving rain with them on. Did not leak! They do have an age limit of about 10 years and hot exhaust and engine parts are their enemy. I glue a high temperature fabric to the inner leg of the exhaust-side (right leg in my case) to protect them against the heat. Works well and is much cheaper and less bulkier than most traditional motorcycle rain gear plus it breathes!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super Dry', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Fit great, keeps me dry even in monsoon conditions. The color is beautiful...a bit warm, but I'd rather be a bit too warm than wet. The only downside is the lack of pockets.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars seems to do the trick, despite cheap feel', 'author': 'Kari', 'rating': 4, 'content': "when i opened this package i didn't know what i was expecting, but it certainly wasn't fabric that felt like it was made of paper pulp. it's very crinkly and stiff and i was extremely dubious as to its effectiveness. literally held the sleeve under running water in the sink for like five minutes, absolutely no permeation. really does seem like it gets the job done, tho i'm not certain how *comfortable* it will be in warmer weather, as it doesn't seem very breathable. will update if i again stand corrected.GIVE IT POCKETS THO. WHY NO POCKETS.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PNW approved', 'author': 'sum dumb guy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Pretty lightweight, waterproof, and windproof. I live in Seattle. The normally wet spring golf was a great experience. I'm actually looking forward to playing this fall.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Not Waterproof', 'author': 'kcfrench', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Bought this for a trip to the Pacific Northwest, where we were going to go hiking in a rain forest (Hoh Rainforest). We arrived in a light rain, and it was pretty chilly, so we had on t-shirts, a nice Columbia fleece, and put this rain gear on over it all. It was definitely big enough to go over all our clothing, but it did not stop the rain. Our fleece got wet. Under the fleece, our t-shirts were dry, so we know we didn't sweat through our t-shirts. DO NOT PURCHASE if you are trying to stay dry. It will fail you. Very disappointed. No way to contact seller, so leaving this review for you to not make the same mistake I did. Go buy decent rain great from Columbia Sports/REI/whatever you want. Just not this. Terrible product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Decent quality for a low price.', 'author': 'Matt', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The fit and finish of the rain suit is good. They do run big. I usually wear an extra large, but I got this suit in a large instead. It fits perfect. Plenty of room for layers underneath. They are not completely water proof. I have seen water seeping through on the seems and shoulder area. Having no pockets is something I've gotten used to, I just use the pockets in my layers. Although having pockets in the jacket would really have been nice. Overall, I would buy these again because of the low price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and Keeps You Dry', 'author': 'Chris H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Froggy Toggs are the most affordable, breathable rain gear available. I like that this one has a zipper instead of just snaps.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Darrell Hendrix', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Haven't had to use yet but seems well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good set for the Rain', 'author': 'TimMcD', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the jacket and pants, the blue is bright and will be visible on rainy days. The elastic waist of the pants is fine for now; long term‚Ä¶possibly a drawstring may be needed‚Ä¶we shall see.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive rain protection', 'author': 'Kevin S', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The price is what attracted me to Frogg Toggs. They are great for working in the yard during a rainstorm. I do not like them for protection on hikes. They are too loose fitting. I purchased my size but I would recommend trying a size lower than you would normally wear.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Columbia Men's Ascender Softshell Front-zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Giftable', 'author': 'Valitia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was a gift. One for working in the yard and out in the public, and second I have set aside for more dressy occasions. I was impressed with the fit, the overall quality of the jacket for the price, its lightness and thinness, and its use in a range of temperatures and conditions. I have used it for light winds and 60 degrees, and heavy winds in the high 20s. I have worn it both for shoveling snow and for attending a play. In all extremes, it performed perfectly. Both the outside of the jacket and inside liner dries quickly. In my opinion, this jacket is an exceptional value for the price. I have much more expensive jackets with big outdoor names, but this one has become my go to choice for all but the most extreme conditions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A really nice jacket, has become my favorite', 'author': 'GVLabs49', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a really nice light to mid-weight jacket and the bonus is, it looks really good. title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. This shoe was thoughtfully designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!', 'author': 'monica cerda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wear heeled leather boots as my day to day fashion, I‚Äôve never been a sneaker person and so after complaining to a friend about hiking sneakers I purchased hurting the top of my foot after an hour of wear, they suggested I try hiking boots instead. I felt like a fool for never connecting the dots. Lol.Well‚Ä¶I found these, loved the color options and the reviews seemed pretty legit! I‚Äôve worn them twice so far while running errands to see how they feel and I have to say, no discomfort and so lightweight!!Now down to sizing: With stylish boots, I‚Äôm typically a size 8, and I did order an 8 initially, however with a thin sock, they felt pretty snug and I thought maybe they might start to bother my toes since there‚Äôs more cushion that what I‚Äôm used to and what if I want to wear thick socks?For me that was enough to go up to an 8.5 juuuust to be on the safe side and because‚Ä¶why not find out? $75 is still $75.So glad I did! They feel roomier yet still a great fit, so if you‚Äôre in limbo, I‚Äôd say size up .5 if you want to be able to throw these on without switching your socks. üòâHappy I got these and I‚Äôm looking forward being more active!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Time WAS a Charm! Only took 5 tries to find Prince Charming's Boot!", 'author': 'FLGulfGrnEz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read the reviews wherever I could find them. I had become very confused over the sizing. I have a hard enough time getting the right size without this much of a difference thrown at me too!I was in love @first glance, beautiful dark gray with aqua strings. Ordered size 7 as suggested though I wear a size 6.5 or 6. Feet measures a size 5-5.5, L=8.5" R=8.7". There lies the rub, right foot doesn\'t fit sizes same as left one by a fraction so hit or miss. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Zippers are the bomb for higher topped boots/shoes especially with fat feet, high instep, opens the slimmer top for feet to get to sole.Back to the size sessions; First was great price on 7\'s, looked order back up and saw where I had ordered from the warehouse! Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. Still have plenty of room through toe bed area but TOO PRETTY, COMFY & TIRED to second guess anymore, size 6 it is!Merry Christmas Folks! Good Luck with your sizing, hope this finally solves some problems??? It was the socks that made all the difference which I kept hearing in almost every review but didn\'t hear the bell in head go off... All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! Uh Oh, gotta get lined pants, knit cap, goggles, warmer gloves, down filled vest... Merry Christmas to me.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality but rubbed on my ankle', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The shoe was nicely made and looked to be good quality. When I first tried them on , they were comfortable and looked cute. I walked around in them for about an hour when I started to feel rubbing on my right ankle in the back. I needed these for a long hike and knew they were not going to work for me. I think these would be a great shoe for shorter walks or to wear around the yard. I did size up half a size because I would be wearing heavier socks and they fit great. Just not for a long hike that I was planning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best Hiking Shoes', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These shoes rock!! I wore these on a trip to Iceland and they kept my feet warm and dry. We made several long hikes through various terrains (mountain, river, gravel, mud) and they didn‚Äôt hurt my feet or feel too heavy. They are perfectly light weight and sturdy, provide ankle support and traction. These are my go to shoes for hikes now and they have held up well for at least the last year. Definitely worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy Right Out of the Box', 'author': 'Michele Kohan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am very pleased with these boots. They were super comfortable right out of the box and I wore them for three straight hours immediately upon putting them on. I love the classic look of these boots and can't wait to hike in them! I looked at a few different colors that were available in my size (11 women), and initially chose the classic tan and red because of the lower price; but I found I really love the color and am glad I chose thetah. They remind me of hiking boots I used to have when I lived back in Pennsylvania growing up.This new pair of Columbia boots are true hiking boots, with cushion all around the ankle and tongue, a flexible thick sole and also appear to be waterproof by design, although haven't tested that yet.The down side is the boots will be too hot to wear in the summer here in Florida, but are working great for the unexpected cold snap right now. They will come in handy for trips out of state in my camper. A+ boots!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Comfy and Cute', 'author': 'Lisa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I picked these based on great reviews and was not disappointed. I wear a women‚Äôs 10 in non-athletic shoes and a 10.5 wide in athletic shoes. Amazon recommended a 10, and I‚Äôm glad I got the 10.5 wide. I can lace them tight for a nice fit, and they don‚Äôt press on my bunion.Pros- Not heavy, but feel sturdy enough for rough terrain, snow and ice- Beautiful color and red accents- Don‚Äôt make my big ole feet look too big- Comfortable from the minute I put them onCon- Insole is glued down tightly and not removable. All shoe manufacturers should make their insoles removable!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Columbia hiking boots', 'author': 'Deborah Kretsch', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very happy with my purchases. I ordered a brand new pair and also went and bought the warehouse inspected used one on additional discount. The used pair is in perfect condition, not a mark or sign of wear anywhere on them. They‚Äôre just like the brand new pair. Perfect!I wear orthotics in my shoes, I tried them both with and without them to see how they feel. I will of course wear them with the orthotics otherwise my plantar fasciitis will get inflamed. I want to wear one pair at work which is standing on my feet my entire shift on cement floors and the other for daily use or camping etc. I will also be spraying a treatment on them for additional protection against the elements.I do have wide feet. One being bigger and slightly wider than the other as well. I always wore a 6.5 shoe, but I guess my feet spread out over time so now I wear 7.5-8 shoes/boots. I went with the 7.5 wide on these and they feel just fine. If I got 8s I think they‚Äôd have been too long and I‚Äôd be tripping on my own feet. Definitely glad I got the wides they would have been too narrow if I got the regular ones. The orthotics raise my foot in the shoe so I have to loosen the laces a lot to accommodate and this is the first time I‚Äôve had extra length on the laces to tie rather than a teeny amount to tie my shoes!For today I am wearing these around the house to break them in. They feel fine out of the box but I tend to get foot fatigue easily due to my foot condition so I need to break them in. My baby toes always get the brunt of the pain when wearing shoes and especially new shoes. I haven‚Äôt felt that pain right away like I normally would. So that‚Äôs a plus for comfort!!So far I love these and so glad I bought both pairs! I love the color and the red laces. They remind me of the old hiking boots I used to see growing up, only a more comfortable updated version! The other colors look cute in the pics but I feel limited to what I can wear them with so I feel these are more neutral to the colors I tend to wear. Hopefully these last a long time. I do own other Columbia products and am usually pleased with their products, this is the first time purchasing footwear.Thank you!Edit I‚Äôve been wearing these to work using my orthotics, standing on my feet on cement floor. No discomfort at all, they have been very comfortable! So happy with these boots!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars In love!', 'author': 'Desiree Mangan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I asked for these as a Christmas present and boy I am so happy I did! I usually wear an 8 however I do have wider feet and knew I was planning on wearing thicker socks so I asked for an 8 wide. I unfortunately have not had the chance to wear these while actually hiking, however I did get to wear them during the recent snow storm. I was waiting for a pair of snow boots that I ordered to come in which they didn‚Äôt but I knew that these were thick and waterproof so I figured why not wear them while shoveling. Clearly they would be much better at keeping my feet warm and dry compared to my Ugg boots. Which it is no surprise that they actually did! My feet were BONE DRY. I was out there for over an hour walking through nearly knee high snow, both shoveling/clearing off cars in my drive way. I love these shoes. Not only this but I had to go to work and play outside in the snow with my preschool kids and same thing, nice and dry. I also wore them all day, 8-5, and my feet feel great! Though I haven‚Äôt used them for what I actually asked for them for, I can tell they will perform just as well as they have already! So buy them you won‚Äôt regret it:)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I bought XL this time, and now it's big on my sleeves and the waist. The waist does not bother me but the long sleeves do have velcro so I can adjust the length. The jacket is like a shell and you def. need to layer up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Looking and Snug Coat', 'author': 'David D.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I would love to give this 5-stars, because this is a very good looking coat. But the reason I cannot is based on a couple issues. First of all, I usually wear coats, shirts, and pullovers in the large to extra large sizes. Being 5\'9" , 210 lbs. with a muscular build does have its challenges. I ordered the XL based on previous reviews. I am glad I did. As others have stated, the sleeves and armpits are snug. The body of the coat was a tad snug as well (belly) , but not uncomfortable. There\'s no way I\'ll be able to layer with this coat though. A sweatshirt isn\'t fitting under this coat for me. I test drove this coat (wearing only a thin shirt underneath) on my usual 4-mile walk right out of the packaging. It was about 35 degrees and sunny here in the Mid-Atlantic. The coat was comfortable for sure. It kept me warm enough. It stopped whatever breeze there may have been. But here\'s one of the detractions, it trapped moisture more than I thought it was designed for. I arrived home with a wet shirt and moisture droplets trapped in the clear ID tag on the back of the nape. The entire inside of the coat was damp, and my phone in the chest pocket was dripping wet. It trapped more moisture than this is supposedly designed to do. So, 4-stars from me because it\'s a good looking coat...And you better order a size up for sure. I\'ll give it another go today and update the review if need be. Using this as a casual coat without an energetic walk may be more appropriate, because it is attractive.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Peefect', 'author': 'david moss', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great winter coat', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love this jacket', 'author': 'Michael Lackey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'If you are between sizes take the larger size. title: Waterproof Rain Poncho Lightweight Reusable Hiking Hooded Coat Jacket for Outdoor Activities
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So glad I had these', 'author': 'HermFam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Went to Sea World in January. And on that day‚Ä¶ it rained a lot!! This poncho covered me. Kept me dry and warm. A real life saver on that day.My husband used it a couple weeks later. And he agreed. Great to have. Kept him dry and warm. I think his buddies were a little envious.And they fold, roll up so compact. Easy to throw in your backpack.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to carry with you!', 'author': 'Jeremy Casteel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought three of these because we were going to Universal and Disney during the summer evening storm season. Easy to carry everywhere and did not take up a lot of space in the small back packs we each carried. We only had to pull them out once for a quick down pour, but they kept us dry.The quality was great as well as we put them away back in the little pouch that it came with. I fully expected to use these once, because it might not last, but was pleasantly surprised and feel I can use these multiple times for the cost and the value of the items, I highly recommend this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fair quality', 'author': 'BT & P', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I ordered these for homeless people. After one night, the people said that they were kept dry and it helped them to stay warm. I would have rated higher except the rough wear and tear they receive probably wont hold up long term. They would be better for occasional, rather than long term use.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worked great at disneyworld', 'author': 'Test_Engineer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Wore these during our annual Disneyworld trip and they were great. Got the same size for my entire family. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô10‚Äù and youngest kids are 5‚Äô2‚Äù. Fit perfectly for everyone and kept us dry while others were running for cover.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Short guys and gals - this fits', 'author': 'Anon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôm a short guy (5‚Äô 5‚Äù on best days) and no clothes from Amazon ever fit me. Seeing a lot of the 6‚Äô commenters say it hits below knees, I was afraid these ponchos would be to my ankles and drag all over. Nope. These come just below my knees. Maybe I‚Äôm thick enough to balloon it a few inches sideways? Eh, I‚Äôm not exactly fat either, probably would be considered on skinny side in USA. Long story short, it hits at just below my knees. For guys and gals 6‚Äô and over, I‚Äôd imagine these will be mid thigh, mileage may vary, but these seem perfect for me.The pros: fabric seems better than I hoped. Thick enough and very light. One thing they don‚Äôt seem to mention a lot is that the few rain ponchos(that look like this one) that sell better than this one on Amazon have a 3000mm rating while this one has 5000mm, which means this will likely last longer in rain before wetting out; this was my primary reason I got these over those. Kudos! These fold up super small. They should shrink the storage bag size. Probably made the bag bigger for the people who can‚Äôt be bothered to fold and roll and instead just stuffs it back in. Hope people don‚Äôt do that, and try to get as many uses as possible(landfills and all that). Fold and roll and there‚Äôs too much room left over on the storage bag, but that‚Äôs good. Storage bag is roughly size of 16oz water bottle but about 1/3 of it is empty space with the poncho inside. Very small. The pull strings around neck feel rugged for such a (half disposal) item. Price was very reasonable. I got the light grey one primarily by trying to get the lightest visible color for the lowest price. Looks alright.Cons: Nitpicking but ofc, the rain brim on the head is kind of a joke. All floppy floppy and way too big. Haha. Was expected. Not bothered. Snaps seem like they will rip out easily but just be careful or just stow them with them closed all the time? I think I will and hopefully will still be easy to dry like that. Like I said, for very tall folks will likely land mid thigh bordering on waist and may not work so well(I‚Äôm guessing 6‚Äô 3‚Äù and over these may feel kinda ridiculously short) but works perfect for me. Thumbs up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better poncho than most', 'author': 'Peter Boberg', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As a backpacker I prefer ponchos that I can throw over myself and my pack to trying to cover my body with a rain jacket and my pack with a pack cover. I still use a pack cover under the poncho but taking a rain jacket on and off is a huge pain when you‚Äôre wearing a pack and the rain jacket doesn‚Äôt cover your hips or thighs and it doesn‚Äôt breathe as well. This poncho is definitely higher quality than those I‚Äôve used in the past. I‚Äôve mostly thought of ponchos as 1 or 2 trip items as they rip and lose their water proofing over time. This one feels sturdier, less likely to rip and is larger so can cover more (but is a little bulkier as a result). Used it in a recent 5-day pack in the Whites with my daughter. We had non stop rain for 1.5 days. This made it through more than half of the first day of say before starting to let some moisture through (inevitable‚Äînothing is truly water proof unless you‚Äôre going to wear rubber!) but even then it kept the water flowing off me making the long rain bearable. Some people complain about sizing. It is bigger than others I‚Äôve had but I liked that, given the pack and I‚Äôm 5‚Äô11‚Äù (but skinny). Also, some complain about the hood. I wore a baseball cap underneath and that gave shape to the hood and the peak on the hood largely covered the brim of the hat so it worked out really well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It works. Good material', 'author': 'Amazoniac', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lightweight and works well to repel stormy weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Hipped', 'author': 'Doc', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Not all that as far a strong and reliable. Back to army navy I guess.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this!', 'author': 'Bri', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased because I needed to walk my dogs during a particularly rainy winter in SoCal, and was blown away by the quality. This kept me completely dry through some very heavy rain and only took a few shakes to dry off before going back inside. The drawstring allows for a secure fit around your face so you don‚Äôt have to worry about the wind blowing your hood off. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô4 so it is pretty long on me, it goes down to my ankles, but I didn‚Äôt mind that as it kept just about every part of me dry even with the wing and heavy rain for days on end. It does come with a pretty compact bag for storage, although I haven‚Äôt used it or needed it. The material is light weight enough that it doesn‚Äôt feel overly bulky but still does a great job blocking out the wind and rain. 10/10 would buy again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Hooded rain poncho', 'author': 'Becky Jo Hoffman-Clements', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this poncho! I‚Äôm a full figured lady, and my two tiny service dogs travel everywhere on my mobility scooter with me. This product cam in super handy today as it started raining 1/2 way to the store. I just took it out of its pouch put it over my head, pulled up the hood and I was able to keep my scooter, dogs and myself dry all the way home. I even got one for a scooter buddy of mine for his scooter!!üíïüõµ Only problem is trying to re-fold it to put back in its pouch. If they could ADD some snaps that would help in TWO ways to keep it closed when it windy so it‚Äôs not flopping around in the wind (like today), the snaps would ALSO keep the sides together for easier folding and re-riling to fit in the pouch!! Just a suggestion!!ü§î', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Signature Sherpa Lined Trucker Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars He loves it', 'author': 'Linda Sewell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gave this as a Christmas gift to a fussy 15 year old boy, he loves it! It is lovely, looks well made & fits him just right.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT, Warm Jacket', 'author': "I'd Rather Be Offroad", 'rating': 5, 'content': "Ordered two on the Amazon try-before-you-buy plan (can't remember exactly what it's called), to be sure I got the right size. Glad I did! Usually I would wear L, but in this jacket I took an XL. That's partly because of the width of my shoulders and the fact that I didn't want it to bind if I wear a sweater, sweatshirt, etc., underneath. But I do believe the jacket runs just a bit small as well. It is a more boxy cut than the old traditional plain denim Levi Jackets, which had a nice taper to the waist. So the waist of my XL is a little looser than I would really prefer and can ride up, exposing the small of my back to a cold car seat if I'm not careful about how I slide into the seat. Other than that, I am thrilled with this jacket. It has become my absolute go-to for just about anything less than semi-formal wear. It is far warmer than I expected (which is so welcome!) owing no doubt to the sherpa lining. The sleeves are lined with a slicker fabric, somewhat like satin, so there will be no drag on the sleeves of whatever warm clothing you wear under the jacket, which is outstanding and in my experience is not common. This is a do-not-hesitate item. title: Men's Tipton Peak Ii Insulated Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Decent winter jacket.', 'author': 'Mr. Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This took a while to get delivered, but I think overall it‚Äôs a decent winter coat. It has synthetic insulation with the shiny reflective interior that does help hold your heat inThe exterior of the coat has a nice wind and water repellent finish and seems more water resistant than a typical down or down alternative coat hasThe hood fits well and you can cinch down the sides and there‚Äôs a little brim in front. Overall the jacket seems fine because I always wear a long sleeve layer underneath it in the winterMy gripe, though is that the sleeves and shoulders fit OK but the body is still a little bit too big for size medium if I compare it to an Eddie Bauer or Northface jacket, those fit trimmer in the midsection and that way, it keeps you warmer because less air leaks inSo overall, I would say that this jacket sizes in medium is between a medium and a large. If you don‚Äôt wear a layer under it, it might be too big, but if you do wear a layer under it, it‚Äôs probably OK .I also appreciate that. It‚Äôs slightly shorter than Columbia‚Äôs white out or powder light jackets. Those are just too long for me. They look a little odd and it‚Äôs hard to get anything out of your pockets. This jacket seems to be one to 2 inches shorter than those models are so the length is better.Overall, the jacket seems to do a decent job of keeping me warm in 30s¬∞ temperatures it‚Äôs not the warmest jacket I‚Äôve ever tried, but one day it was rainy and cold, and the water seemed to beat up on the outside, and I stayed dry.When you take the jacket off, you can feel how warm the reflective lining keeps youIn the next year‚Äôs version, if Columbia would make the torso area just a touch smaller, I think the fit would be really good overall because you still need room in the shoulders and sleeves which this has. thankfully, I don‚Äôt have a big gut or else Columbia should leave it the same as it is. :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent jacket!', 'author': 'Paul S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My first order was the size I normally order and it was HUGE! I could fit two of me in it. But they exchanged it without a problem and it is superb quality and comfort. Lightweight, insulated, warm but breathable. I also have a waterproof windbreaker jacket from Columbia. They deliver an excellent product. No complaints. I also bought their snow boots.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lite, yet warm and dry ski coat.', 'author': 'Bud', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My last Columbia ski Jacket lasted well over 20 years before the zipper finally wore out. Needless to say, I was looking for a coat with rugged zippers. I loved the way the zipper was covered with a Velcro flap. My fit was in between Medium and Large, I ordered a large which allows for a fleece or heavy sweater to be worn under. It is warm enough for the Maine winters and even in the 10 to 50 degree F. weather stays comfortable with the right under garment. We often get rainy periods along the coast of Maine. I await to see if other reviews are right about repelling light rain and snow. I love the looks and fit of this hooded jacket. If it lasts as well as my last Columbia jacket, I'll be a happy skier.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Happy I Bought the Tipton Peak II Jacket', 'author': 'John G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I finally decided to retire my Helly Hansen ski coat after 20 years. Yes, 20. I spent my time doing my due diligence and am so happy that I bought the Warp Red Tipton Peak II coast as it's replacement. The coat is on the thinner side but extremely warm. Does a great job protecting against high winds and rain heads up and falls right off of it. Lots of positive comments on the color and style. Well worth $105. üëçüëç", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome jacket!', 'author': 'Jamie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is warm lightweight and waterproof. Everything I was looking for!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket - Update', 'author': 'Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'In 1997 I purchased a Columbia coat to go skiing in Colorado. It was a 3-1 one coat. The negatives were no hood, not wind or water proof. Last week the zipper slide on the inner coat broke. I replaced the slide and washed both the inner and out coat. The zipper on the outer coat tore in the wash. As I had torn the left sleeve last year, I decided it might be time to purchase a new winter coat (after 25 years of rough wear and tear, I figure I got my moneys worth out of that coat).I found the Tipton Peak II at Dick\'s Sporting Goods. The Medium was too tight (just a smidge) in the shoulders. I ordered a large from Amazon. It arrived in new condition, a day early.I\'m 6\'.0", 160Lbs, 32" waist, 42" chest. I wear a 16\' neck and 35" sleeve. The large is perfect in the shoulders, a smidge long in the arms (not a problem), the body of the coat is very roomy, it could come in a bit, but it isn\'t so big that it looks oversized. I suspect a guy 6\'1" 200 Lbs would find it about the right size. The large leaves some comfortable room for me to layer.Pro\'s: The coat appears to be well made, tight woven outer fabric appears sturdy and it\'s advertised as waterproof, I\'m thinking it will be windproof as well (as opposed to my other coat which was neither). The hand warmer pockets (very thin fleece) are roomy and secure with a zipper. There is an outer left breast pocket and an inner right breast pocket (both roomy and secure with a zipper). Also an attached hood (roomy and insulated) (Huge plus for me). I was skeptical of the Omni heat liner despite other positive reviews. It does appear to function as promised, I began to over heat just trying the coat on. I\'ll have to wait for colder weather to be sure. I gave the coat 4 stars.Cons: The main zipper is lighter and smaller than the one on my last coat (it lasted 25 years) Time will tell if the lighter zipper will perform as well. The zipper flap attaches with Velcro. Though some may like the Velcro , I prefer snaps (my last coat had heavy duty snaps). There is no draw string at the waist. I feel they could have added an outer right breast pocket and an inner left breast pocket (more pockets = more better), even one on a sleeve. The Omni heat liner is thin and feels flimsy, hopefully it doesn\'t tear easily.All in all, for the sale price of $120.00 it appears to be a really decent coat. However, I would not have purchased it for the original retail price of $180.00.Update 12/21/22 - I\'ve had the opportunity to wear the coat in wind, rain and cold weather. The coat is windproof, which is awesome. I spent 40 minutes in a light rain and remained dry and comfortable. In 40 degree Fahrenheit weather, I was comfortable with the coat and a t-shirt. At 35 degrees, I needed a sweatshirt (I\'m thin and hate cold). Colder than 35 degrees, I wear a thermal top (wool or wool blend) and a sweatshirt under the coat. At 20 degrees with the aforementioned layering, I was quite comfortable. I was skeptical of the Omni heat liner, it seems to work.The coat is quite comfortable to wear and allows for ease of movement. It doesn\'t really need a center draw string as I fist suggested, though it would be nice, the lower drawstring is sufficient to keep out wind.I absolutely love the hood!!! (Yep, you counted correctly, that\'s three exclamation points) It\'s adjustable, and insulated just enough to keep your head warm, should you decide you need a headband or stocking cap, there is plenty of room under the hood for an additional layer.The existing pockets are functional and roomy. The hand warmer pockets are lightly lined and warm. The extra pockets I mentioned in my original post would have been a nice addition, though I can\'t say I really have had need of extra storage space. More pockets are just more better.Still not a fan of the Velcro zipper flap cover, snaps would be better. I think the Velcro looks cheap and it tends to catch as I\'m unzipping the coat.I thought a parka zipper would be better, but have had no issues with the smaller zipper. It may actually be sturdier over time, time will tell.I would upgrade my star rating except for the Velcro zipper flap.I really like the coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars value for money very comfortable jacket and it feels good', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket keeps me warm on those cold days I love it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good stuff', 'author': 'Jevans', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Is an unboxing review. Have not worn it in cold weather yet. Is excellent. I ordered a large and it fits perfect. I'm 5ft 5in 168ish pounds. Waist is 34in. Ride mtn/gravel bike alot. Used to lift weights. So kinda athletic build. Fits perfect. Spot on. Psyched. Can fit layers underneath, plenty of room. But not too big. Is spot on.No defects I could find. Arrived perfectly folded, the hood was even perfectly folded. I didn't have to mess with the hood to make it look good/rounded/even at all. Even the velcro sleeve cuff straps are closed to where I want them. They definitely have a Quality Control dept. Haha. Bought the all black. Is gorgeous. The hood fits well. With the neck fully zipped it fits perfectly on my head. Some hoods will stick up 2 inches or so when fully zipped. This one does not. Can still fit whatever type hat on underneath it though. It's very nice. Am psyched. I live in NE PA USA and it's middle of November so cold weather is on it way in. I'll update with warmth factor. I'll be wearing this cross country skiing, downhill skiing (if I get out), and winter hiking. Also just going to the grocery store. Winters get below 0¬∞F so it will be put to the test. I will update...", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good buy', 'author': 'logan govro', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Fits me almost like guy in picture, although not as form fitting as it looks on him which is weird since im a little more full figured than him. Pretty warm, went out in 32¬∞ f with a t shirt underneath, chilly at first but it generates and maintains heat very fast even not moving. Columbia could take an inch or 2 off the body size of alot of their products and they would be perfect, 6ft 220lbs', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Coat', 'author': 'Thomas Bustos', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Water Resistant Diamond Quilted Nylon Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm, comfortable and sturdy construction', 'author': 'MJ Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Both Dickies and Carhartt are names you can trust for sturdy, well made clothing, at a good price. So, when I was looking for a good nylon quilted jacket for layering I found this one, which was a really good price. The nylon shell is water resistant and the lining is a soft, cotton type lining that makes it feel instantly warm and comfortable against your skin. The pockets are also half lined with this cotton type lining, aiding in keeping your hands warmer. The collar and wrist cuffs are ribbed elastic and very comfortable, as well as keep wind from seeping in. By itself it is warm in chilly days, and on cold days I use it to layer under my Carhartt Detroit jacket, making for a really warm combination. It looks well constructed and should last a good while. But, if and when I do need to replace it I will definitely buy another one. I‚Äôm very happy with this jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy Jacket. Light Weight. Not Bulky.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wanted a quality winter jacket that didn't cost an arm and a leg - can't go wrong at $28, some reviewers have bought it for less! (hopefully Amazon won't artificially raise the price on it like they do with a lot of other items...) I like this style and have a lot of respect for this brand. First off, the arms are LONG, about 27in on the Medium. For perspective, my arms from shoulder to wrist are about 24in. Judging by the images of the models it looks like smaller sizes may have shorter arms but I'm not sure. The arm length is by design since this IS a WORK jacket, the arms are supposed to be long. I have to fold the sleeves in a bit, which doesn't bother me. I'm a large female, 5'8, 40in hips. The back of the jacket covers almost half my bum (the front looks a little shorter), it cinches at the end, there's a waist band in the back. The M is snug on my hips without being too snug. I'm 41 in the chest - it's roomy up top but I'm not swimming in it. If I'd gotten a large I think I'd be swimming in it. A small probably would've been too snug for me. I wanted to layer this.It feels very warm, soft and comfortable on the inside - very nice lining. I've yet to wear it in freezing temps and will update when I do. I'm a bit disappointed that it's made in China... but overall, I'm happy with it. I know it can be tricky buying clothes online so anyone having serious doubts about sizing would be better off trying it on in store.I'll be checking out more Dickies coats in the future. Thanks Dickies!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'tucker smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very warm and comfortable. Size is perfect. I love the pockets in the front, really comfortable and warm for my hands on a cold day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good product', 'author': 'VINNY ALOISIO', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Light weight and warm', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Coat', 'author': 'Ashley Lowery', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My husband loves his coat. It‚Äôs very fitting to go with his uniform since he is a firefighter.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'NR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits great and looks great. 5-10 180lbs ordered a large', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the style and comfort.', 'author': 'Tony Capitule', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Saw Pete Davidson wearing this when he hosted SNL. title: Men's Faux Leather Jacket Motorcycle Jacket Waterproof Windproof PU Moto Vintage Bomber Hoodie with Removable Hood
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality', 'author': 'Gregg Hessler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this CREATMO US Men's Faux Leather Jacket Motorcycle Jacket Waterproof Windproof PU Moto Vintage Bomber Hoodie with Removable Hood¬π a few weeks ago and I am very happy with my purchase. The jacket also has a windproof design with a zip closure placket and rib collar, cuffs and hem that prevent the cold air from getting in. The jacket has four zippered pockets: two on the chest and two on the sides, which are very convenient for storing my keys, phone, wallet and other small items. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As good or better than "big name brand"', 'author': 'Mickey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have owned carhartt in larger sizes but lost weight and didn\'t want to spend a fortune for a "name". title: Mens Slim Fit Casual One Button Blazer Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits TRUE to size', 'author': 'Anthonny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good price-good quality. Was pleasantly surprised with the product.A good get for any business professional', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Casual and classy', 'author': 'lillyjeans', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice jacket, casual yet classy. Trying to match it to an existing pair of black pant and the fabric was a lot different. If I was ordering this jacket to dress up for a casual event it would be perfect. Very well made, nicely tailored. The fit was not good for me. Although it may be just what you are looking for.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Okay for everyday.', 'author': 'William E. Smith', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The cut and fit of this jacket is bad. I'm not overly picky; I usually buy off the rack and the fit is perfect. I've ordered cheap jackets on Amazon before and have been completely satisfied. Unless you are looking for a disposable sports coat for a one-time event which will be held in a dark, dark room. Maybe look elsewhere.Specifics:‚Ä¢ The collar is cut and pressed funny so it goes up high on the back of your neck. Very stiff and though it's folded down, it looks like you're flipping it up to make some kind of '80s style statement.‚Ä¢ That white line in the pocket is not a handkerchief or a paper insert for decoration, it's sewn in and looks incredibly cheap up close. But you can fold it down to be hidden, which makes a slight lump, but better than up.‚Ä¢ I'm pretty thin so the jacket fit well around my waist, the length was good. But the cut of the lapel was so bad that I looked like Bruce Banner in a mid-Hulk moment around the chest. The lapel does not lay naturally, it opens wide like a poorly-fitting tux coat. Even with the button undone, it flares to the side a bit and looks like it fits on the bottom but is a size too small across the chest. Strangely, the shoulders fit okay, except for...‚Ä¢ ...the shoulder pads. Yes, thick, uneven shoulder pads. Felt strange, looked strange.‚Ä¢ The buttons look like cheap plastic. I know for $30 they are going to be cheap plastic, but there's a difference between BEING cheap plastic and looking from 10 feet away like cheap plastic. It looks and feels like the material in a disposable plastic spoon.‚Ä¢ Last point, but there's more: The jacket is fully lined and the lining does not look too bad, BUT when you put your arms into the sleeves, you push the lining out of the other end with your hands so you kind of have to tuck the lining back into your sleeve once you have the jacket on.I was going to return this, but for $30, it hardly seems worth the effort. I'm going to have it steamed and pressed to try to fix some of the sleeve and collar issues and am replacing the buttons with better-looking cheap plastic.One thing I do like about the jacket is the pockets in front are real and fairly large. I hate when sports coats sew the pockets shut to help the line of the jacket. Also the inside pocket, though only one, is pretty functional. The outer pocket flaps also tuck in if you like a cleaner look, so it's not all bad.If you're looking for a good alternative, it's not as low-priced, but the jackets by Ferrecci-Zonettie here on Amazon are great.UPDATE:After wearing the jacket for a few months, some of the flaws have diminished. Fabric has relaxed a bit. It still has most of the problems I mentioned above, but surprisingly, has worn fairly well. I've been rough on it, too, thinking it'd start coming apart at the seams giving me an excuse to toss it. But so far even the too-loose lining has held up to activity. Not a 4-star product, so not revising my rating, but if they let me do 3.5 stars, I'd give it that, haha.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the price', 'author': 'Nicole N', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought for my son. We ended up returning because it was too big. We ordered a size up because review said it runs small. My son is pretty slim, he wears a 36R in suit jackets. He wears a men small mostly but sometimes a medium. The material seemed good and would have been a great look if it was smaller. Just wanted to share the review to hopefully help when next person is choosing the size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Incredible Value in a Nice Blazer Priced Lower than most Dress Shirts', 'author': 'Larry Epstein', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This was a gift to my grown grandson to wear to the funeral of his other grandfather. I'm tired of seeing people at weddings, funerals, church services, etc. in just shirts or shirts and ties. He owned absolutely no formal wear and never saw the need. I wanted him properly attired for a funeral. He was, and his look impressed everyone. Based on its very low price, I bought him this sports coat as a virtual single-use disposable garment. But, it looks like a quality garment and fits perfectly. I suspect that he will be able to wear it many more times. The lightweight, linen-look fabric is perfect for Florida where he lives. He is a slender man: 6 feet tall and 155 pounds. The large looked great on him.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fitting suit jacket for my teen!', 'author': 'N W', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered this with not so high expectations based on the price but it was PERFECT! My son is 5‚Äô10 and slim so I definitely pulled out the tape measure before ordering and the recommendations were spot on. The shipping was FAST. I ordered at 9pm and it was on my porch by 7 am the next morning. I‚Äôll be getting this in more colors for sure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits well', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My 14yo is 69" and 155# and a 30x32. We bought the medium and the blazer fits really well for him. We bought this as a quick inexpensive option for an awards ceremony if he were going to something more formal I would buy higher end and get it tailored but this is very good for now.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great slim jacket.', 'author': 'Sandra J', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Great jacket. Well made. Slim fit. Unfortunately it‚Äôs too short for my husband.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not perfect BUT..', 'author': 'HDs my game', 'rating': 5, 'content': "So it has lots of wrinkles, will need help BUT... title: Men's Soft Fleece Full Zip Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great value on a zip-up fleece with zip-up pockets.', 'author': 'Alan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am 6 foot and 165 pounds, bought the medium and it fits a little baggy but lengthwise it's perfect in both arms and waist. The baggy fit is fine for comfort (lounging around the house and maybe airplane trips and such were I value comfort over fit), but probably would go with small if buying again for a sleeker fitted look. Great quality jacket for the $25 I paid for it with free shipping, a great value. Would buy again. Zip-up fleeces with zip-up pockets are one of the best utility clothing I've ever owned (this one replaces a very similar one I bought at Kohl's years ago that I wore out). They are comfortable, warm but not too warm, and can be worn in a variety of temperatures and situations (great for travel), under winter coats for extra protection in extreme weather, or unzipped when things heat up a bit. Put things in the pocket and zip them up so you don't worry about them falling out (my iPhone 6 Plus fits inside).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My New Favorite Fleece', 'author': 'JAS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had an Amazon Basic\'s Fleece for a few years that has been fine, still looks decent, has held up well, and you can\'t beat the price. I do not go camping with it so I don\'t need one of the heavy duty, really expensive ones from, say, REI or something. I wear it inside and around town. But the Amazon Basics one is not super warm by itself. I think it\'s probably a standard "light" fleece. But because it\'s kind of thin, it doesn\'t always do the job by itself, and I often have to layer on a sweatshirt or something. So I was curious if there was slightly thicker, warmer one out there that still wasn\'t bulky. The weight on this one seemed to be a little heavier than Amazon\'s so I thought I\'d give it a try. I bought 1 from Amazon and this one. Now I haven\'t put them through any rigorous testing, but so far, my first impression is that I THINK this one is indeed a little heavier. It looks good (I got the maroon and it actually looks pretty snappy), and a strip along the inside of the collar that\'s a different color from the rest of the jacket is a nice stylistic touch if you don\'t zip it up all the way and makes the jacket look a little classier. Whether it will hold up as well as Amazon\'s over time, I have no idea. But for right now, I couldn\'t be happier with this one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Fleece For the Price', 'author': 'Harry Drinkwater', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This fleece is just about what I expected for the price. I\'m 5\'7" 175lbs. I would normally order a medium, but I ordered a small after reading some of the reviews. I prefer jackets like this more on the snug side rather than baggy, and a small fits the bill for me. The sleeve length is perfect, and although it\'s a little tight around the chest and torso, I don\'t mind it too much. I think it\'ll probably stretch out somewhat. The fleece is snug and warm. The elastic, adjustable drawstrings on either side of the fleece, at the waist, are a nice addition, but because of the snug fit all around, I probably won\'t need to use them. I was pleasantly surprised at the overall quality. Again, after reading multiple reviews, I was sort of worried about the zipper failing. However, it appears to be reasonably sturdy, but I suppose time will tell. The material is a little stiffer than expected, but it\'s OK overall. If your dimensions are similar to mine, and you prefer a somewhat looser fit, go for the medium.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars $20 gets you a fleece that works just as well as any other', 'author': 'Jay Wanders Out', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Let's face it, folks. When you pay more for the same fleece you're paying for that label on your chest. This fleece fits perfectly and is soft and very thick. Last weekend I was out camping and it was in the lower 30s in the evening and the only thing I was wearing on my torso was a long sleeve shirt and this fleece and I was comfortable all night long. It was just slightly windy so I'm sure that helped. In the morning it was 21F but I felt fairly comfy even with the morning chills and this fleece and a Marmot soft shell over it. I don't need another one but I'm sadly tempted to just buy another in a different color.Update - Jan 15, 2017: Since my first fleece in March 2014 I bought another in Nov 2014 then another in Oct 2016. All three fit and feel exactly the same. Yes, all three zippers will go crazy on you if you're too careless with it but it has only happened maybe 5 times on me in almost three years now and I wear them quite frequently. Even now in the 20s it's my sole jacket when I drive to work since it's just a short walk from the parking lot and such. When I walk a mile to my train station I'll still wear this and my soft shell over it down to the 20s and I'm still quite comfortable, if not too warm. Oddly the description now says 13.8 oz but that must be for the tiniest size. A medium weighs 17.4 oz. I'm planning on thru hiking the PCT in 2018 so every fraction of an ounce counts but I've been considering taking this over my 10 oz down jacket for the wetter sections since it works so effectively against moisture. I've gone on cold day hikes with this and a soft shell and I would feel comfortable but when I take my soft shell off I could feel the moisture on the outside of the fleece but absolutely nothing on the inside. Take it off, and shake it a few times and it's good to go. Fleece just doesn't pack small at all though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soft and comfortable', 'author': 'Rob', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Nice soft, warm jacket, all zippers work well, and price is half of what similar quality jackets cost. Shipping was a day earlier than the minimum suggested delivery. This is my second time ordering from this seller and both times the service was 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice and fits well', 'author': 'FJL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband wears a fleece jacket daily. He has many, in all stages of wear and tear: one for indoors daily, one for ‚Äònice‚Äô, one for yard work and one for shop work (gets damaged). So we got this jacket to replace his prior ‚Äògood‚Äô jacket to become one that is now a daily wear indoor jacket. In addition to the full zip and zip outer pockets (which he requires on all his jackets), he was happy to find it also has 2 deep inner pockets. The large size fits as expected. It is well made and it looks nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Works', 'author': 'olivia higgins', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The sleeves are so long as if this was made for someone whos arms went down to their calves LOL.
