It's a good bargin.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A bit smaller than the same brand I was hoping to replace', 'author': 'PAUL E', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was the closest I could find to one I have had for a few years and really like. I suppose I will be happy with this one', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful', 'author': 'Cliente de Kindle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought it for my husband for the color and it looks like the picture, is beautiful I really like.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Wool Blend Jacket Stand Collar Windproof Pea Coat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fitment and Style!!!', 'author': 'Jugosloven', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love it!!!! i had one from before but it didn't fit right it was too lose so i decided to buy an other one but I wasn't sure about the size, so I went with Large and I love it...fits nice and it's not to loose...I am 6 feet tall and about 180 pounds..it fits nice on the shoulders and the sleeves are perfect length and it's maybe 5 inches below the belt...I got the gray color, amazing color...it's nice and thick material but not heavy for it's size..it can be woren with a dress shirt or a light sweater and you can still be warm and comfortable!!! I would recommend it..you can waer it on day to day basis and if you go out on a fancier night out!!! worth the money!!!! Thanks for the prompt delivery i did place the order less then 48 hours ago!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Kinda Blown Away - Well Made', 'author': 'Drawing Guy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I just received the jacket and it\'s hard to believe how nice it is for what it cost. I would guess a jacket like this would cost $250 or more at a posh store. I\'m 6\', 185 and the Large was a tad bit big so I returned and got a Medium - fits perfect. Most of the time I wear a Large, so I suggest the sizes might run on the generous side. Check your measurements.The Large I originally purchased was Coffee (medium-thick), I like the color but it looked a little too "Sherlock Holmes" for my taste. Went with the Army Green for the Medium and am very happy with it.The Jacket looks great, I don\'t think I\'ve been more impressed from buying clothing on Amazon. I haven\'t worn it for a full day yet, but will in soon. I\'ll see how it holds up - who knows, it may completely unravel, but I highly doubt it. Really seems to be well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Product looks as pictured, but be careful of fit', 'author': 'Benny', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Looks like the product images, seems to be well constructed, is warm and cozy with no noticeable defects. Wasn't even too wrinkled, although I'll probably get it dry cleaned just to see it at its best. I almost ordered a Large, but sized up to an Extra Large after reading some comments. Glad I did--no way the Large would have worked for me. Even the XL is a bit tight across my chest. I wouldn't wear a suit jacket underneath it, but I have other coats for that so not an issue. It's quite a bit shorter than I expected, but I don't mind that other than the hand warmer pockets are placed a bit high, though not uncomfortable. Overall, it's a fantastic value and I'm happy with it! If I did it over again, the XXL may have been a better fit for me, but I worry it would possibly be too loose in the waist and only resolve the slightly tight chest fit issue. I'm happy enough and keeping it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars In men's sizes if you're normally an XL, get the XXL.", 'author': 'Abigail Matherly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My boyfriend loved it. Great material, doesnt feel cheap, looks as pictured, definitely glad I got the XXL. He normally wears XL but it would've been too small. The only downside I'd say is the pocket pictured on the right side of the chest, is not a pocket. And there's no where to put the button in so the flap hangs awkwardly. Nothing a little light ironing wont fix to lay it flat. But still, joke pocket on the chest. Rude, but as a woman I know all too well how joke pockets work! Haha. I think 70 would be a more reasonable price, but overall it's a good coat. Minus joke pocket, haha.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ultra is much thicker', 'author': 'D1inSD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very nice coat. The ultra is much thicker. However, they do run small.I\'m 6\'5" 245lbs.I originally ordered the suggested size and wasn\'t able to put it on. I returned it for a XXLT for a better fit.The arm length is shorter than I prefer but it\'s a coat and how often does one really raise the arms above the head....I will keep it. It is good quality, not 100% wool. It seems that is just a thing of the past. I do recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Style Meets Practicality', 'author': 'John', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The Wantdo Men's Wool Blend Jacket is a decent choice for those seeking style and some protection from the elements. Here's my take after giving it a spin:Classic Design: The pea coat design is timeless, and it's a versatile piece that complements both formal and casual attire.Windproof Features: It does provide some protection against the wind, making it suitable for moderately chilly days.Comfortable Collar: The stand collar adds a touch of elegance and provides extra coverage against cold winds.Affordable: This jacket offers a budget-friendly alternative to high-end pea coats without compromising too much on quality.Sizing Uncertainty: Sizing seems to be a common issue, with some users experiencing a fit that's less than perfect. Be sure to refer to the size chart diligently before ordering.Limited Warmth: While it's reasonably warm, it may not be the best option for extremely cold conditions, as it lacks the robust insulation of more expensive wool coats.Durability Concerns: Some users have reported issues with the durability of the jacket, particularly with buttons coming loose.In conclusion, the Wantdo Men's Wool Blend Jacket is a reasonable choice for those who want to stay stylish while dealing with moderate cold. However, it may not be the warmest or most durable option on the market. Three stars for its balance of style and practicality.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent buy', 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This coat was an amazing purchase. It fits well, it is functional in cold weather but not bulky. Has an internal bib providing extra warmth. Stylish design, deep slant pickets, slimming effect. I'm 5'11 180 lb and a large fits perfectly. An excellent value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Value Wool Blend Coat', 'author': 'ZuSu  (¬£—Ü—ç!#)', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought the coffee-colored medium weight coat as a x-mas gift for myself and overall I‚Äôm happy with it.The coat is decent quality, but it is an 80/20 poly/wool blend, so the fabric isn‚Äôt exactly premium. I really like the coffee color which is a black and brown twill fabric. Buttons a back gloss plastic with a silver edge binding. All my buttons were in good shape and securely sewn. My coat came with a single extra button. A single vertical zipper pocket is on the left breast. The zipper is chunky and unbranded but the action is smooth and it works. On the collar there is a silver buckle and black snap that can be used on cold days. I haven‚Äôt used it but the construction looks sturdy. There are simple interior pockets without buttons or zippers on the left and right breast. Again, construction seems sturdy. The lower exterior pockets have superfluous buttons but the pockets themselves are sturdy and warm.The fit is reasonably modern (i.e. slim) for me in a good way. However, I do have a fairly athletic build with a 42‚Äù+ chest and a 32‚Äù- waist. I really liked the fit at my shoulders and I would have preferred a closer fit at my middle‚Äî though with my build I can‚Äôt reasonably expect that from anything but a tailored coat. Length is just about right, with the coat extending down to the bottom of my jean pockets. Weight is also as advertised. The medium weigh keeps me warm in Southern California winters and would work well in Midwestern springs or autumns.Overall I‚Äôd recommend the coat. It looks good, the construction seems to be quality (though I think the fabric blend at only 20% wool is mediocre) it‚Äôs warm and the fit is good if not great. At $50, I doubt you can do better.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking and warm', 'author': 'Rob Fab', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Side pockets are awkwardly high, I guess you may get used to it. Collar is a bit annoying around the neck but it does look good and is nice and warm.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Quality, Does The Job', 'author': 'Adam Ericson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'OK, first, it stood up to the cold and wet in Ireland during our vacation. That probably is the best you can say about a winter coat. Is it going to handle sub zero weather? Maybe not, but 32 degree weather it stood up. Pockets are deep, deeper than I thought they would be. The collar, it can be as snug as you wish. You have various options to close it up. Zipper for cool, buttons for cold, zipper and buttons for very cold. Not rain proof but that was a given, but it did protect me in the rain nicely. Fits as expected. Stylish as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Precip Eco Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great packable water and wind resistant layer', 'author': 'Tony', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Took this on a trip to Europe. Performed like a champ.EASY TO CARRY: Collapses into its own little bag by stuffing itself into the right pocket. Note that there is no difference between the left and right pocket EXCEPT that the right pocket has a second zipper pull so that you can close the pocket when it is inside-out (because you stuffed the rest of the jacket into it). Doing this or even just quickly rolling the jacket up means you can carry it easily in your day pack. Light weight and low volume.WATER RESIST: Pretty good performance! taped seams. I wore it in medium rain and it kept my top dryHOOD: another reviewer complained that the hood was too long a drooped over the eyes, obscuring vision. Simple fix! Use the velcro tab back at the base of the neck to adjust how much the hood can go forward. Adjusting the velcro an inch can make a big difference! Also you can roll the hood down and tuck it into the collar.BREATHABILITY: This is waterproof and not Gore-tex (which would cost way more) so its not really breathable. But it has deep pit-zips on both sides, a reliable no-stick zipper in front, and wide sleeves at the wrist (adjustable with velcro) so you can easily create some airflow.WARMTH: Not really much insulation. But if you combine it with other layers, it can work well. For instance, I wore a t-shirt and a merino wool sweater with the jacket in reserve in my backpack. As afternoon became evening and the temperature dropped down by 10 degrees F. I put on the jacket and a knit hat and was fine. So the jacket is good for iffy weather but also for cooling at night if you're out for a full day.STYLE: It's reasonably good looking outdoor/active wear. Clean lines and lays smooth. Mine is the deep blue.DURABILITY: Seems well made. All the stitching and zippers are good quality. I have a Marmot high end gore-tex jacket and Marmot ski pants that perform well for years. So I trust the Marmot brand. This lightweight jacket seems to be quality too. No issues on my trip but I've only had the jacket two months.OVERALL: This is an easy 5 stars if your looking for easy to pack water and wind protection that looks good and fits comfortably at an affordable price point. Especially good for travel where you want to be efficient in what you're packing.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice', 'author': 'daniel d.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Needed a decent rain jacket and snagged this while on sale (in size large, moon river color which i like alot). It feels solid with pit zips, drawstrings, packable, and hood rolls up into a collar held by velcro piece. It is very thin and pretty loud (crinkly). Its pretty lightweight. During warmer weather it's comfortable enough to wear with short sleeve shirt, but cold weather I would recommend long sleeve warming layers underneath. It's comfortable but not fleece lined or anything comfortable. I firmly believe it will do its job. 5 stars if it's exactly what you want, 4 stars if you want a warmer liner or less noisy. (See pics). On sale for 59 it's not bad, but normal price tag of 100 I wouldn't (for that price I'd rather go extra mile for ultralight / hunting gear).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Lucy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Size medium was good for my 6 ft 150 lb son with room to wear layers underneath when cold. This is a great rain jacket for spring through fall. A little thin for really cold weather, unless you wear sweater or sweatshirt under it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a great jacket that exceeds the price. It‚Äôs the perfect addition to the weather gear!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and lightweight!', 'author': 'Nancy A. Bedard', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When hiking my husband is happy to have something light weight and easy to pack. This jacket is both plus keeps him warm too .', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent.', 'author': 'Bama WillBG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Typical high quality marmot jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It Rained... A LOT! This Jacket Kept Me DRY!', 'author': 'Ronald W. Harrison', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was a new purchase to replace my previous MARMOT Men's Precip Jacket. The product continues to excel! Backpacking in a recent downpour and my jacket kept me completely dry. Even with blowing rain, I was able to snug up the neck, sleeves, and waist to keep the rain out. LOVE this jacket. A nice look in this color combination, too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for hiking', 'author': 'tommy g', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Lightweight, waterproof, and has pit zips to vent. Great shell for hiking.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fits well and sizing seems right on', 'author': 'K. E. C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My husband is 5\'10" and 235 lbs. we ordered a XXL and fits him perfectly with a tad bit of material to spare. It is very thin material so I gave it 4 stars but a keeper. Time will tell if it holds up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good looks', 'author': 'Robert T Marshall', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The fit was good, looks good and keeps you dry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Outdoor Waterproof Soft Shell Hooded Military Tactical Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good Value for a functional outdoor jacket!', 'author': 'Lee David', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great cool weather tactical jacket. I am 5\'10" 190lbs medium build with broad shoulders and the size Large fit is great especially if I want to light layer underneath for really colder weather. I am normally a Medium in most outdoor name brands. I can wear a fleece sweater under this jacket and still keep my binoculars strapped to my chest and not feel constrained. A sweater or lighter fleece will work well with the correct sizing. Don\'t expect to get a lot of flex from the soft shell. This material is NOT like the NorthFace, Sitka or other tech brands in terms of soft shell flexibility. It isn not the most quiet jacket I have used but still not as loud as a full on rain jacket. The pit zips are great for venting and easy to access. The front pockets have D rings sewn in the tops of the pockets to allow clipping of items such as gloves or other gear. As well both chest pockets have an audio cable routing hole as does the right shoulder pocket. The back pocket is fleece lined and holds a hat and gloves with no problem. I can also fit a water bottle without an issue. It has NO internal pockets, but good placement of external pockets. The internal fleece is on the thinner side but more than enough for a layered system. So far I have only used the jacket outside in the rain once and it did keep me dry. It\'s not built for a serious deluge or torrential downpour. The fabric that makes up the soft shell can absorb water but this will withstand a mist/ wet fog/ sleet without a problem for a short duration. It is not meant to be rain jacket but rather deter water from getting to you allowing you to keep warm. I am thinking it will benefit from a treatment like Nikwax softshell to keep the water at bay. The hood / collar is well made with a functional visor, cinch chords inside and velcro allowing folding or rolling for 2 positions, a tall neck shield collar and a regular band collar. The hood has room to be worn with a watch cap or a baseball cap. Haven\'t tried it with shooting earphones yet but it should work. The elbows have an additional layer on top of the main layer to help with durability. I have the army green version so I can\'t speak to the other colors or camo versions that are made by similar companies. Being in Montana, we regularly have to deal with snow and rain during rough mountain hikes and hunts. I think this jacket will do well in that environment. I plan to do a durability update after a few months of regular use. So far for the price this is a great jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Liked it so well I bought two', 'author': 'alan d hulsebus', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have been using for several months and absolutely love the coat. Confirmed waterproof & windproof in several heavy rain showers. Used for walking, hiking, biking, cross country sking so the ventilation adjustments are very useful. Cool but warm enough at 32 degrees then quickly warms up in a few minutes. I like the breast height pockets to store hat & gloves away from my waist. The hood size is excellent for warmth and keeping out the wind. VERY durable fabric and zippers.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, Sizes seem a bit off', 'author': 'gadget girl', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First of all, there‚Äôs very little to complain about regarding the quality and appearance of this jacket. As others have mentioned it looks and feels like one of the more expensive popular name brands. I loved the texture and heft of the outer and inner materials, and the color was nice and as described, and it‚Äôs both warm and comfortable, and well designed to ventilate with the under arm zippered vents if needed. The dual zipper I found to be a little clunky. I usually run sizes between a medium and large, 5-7, 190lbs, so I ordered a large at first, but found it to be too long in the sleeves and large in the chest for me. I returned this one for a medium and the medium was much better yet snug. It‚Äôs confusing how there could be such a drastic difference between sizes. I kept the medium though it looks great and really love this quality jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth every penny', 'author': 'Gee Gonzalez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fire service review..Meets department color spec has Velcro to put department patches on each side that fit perfect. Has been tested in cold weather Sub <40 degrees and did an exceptionally great job keeping me warm. This is a great lightweight jacket that will keep you warm in winter temperatures for California and not to warm for those random ‚ÄúHot ‚Äú days that we have here . Also this jacket has done a great job on repelling water that has been on the surface of jacket .I am a solid size Xl but ordered 2x just in case and glad I did . It is a little big but has Velcro for wrist, and pull strings for the waist area making it a perfect fit for myself . Furthermore you are able to roll hood up and make a collar with it which is a neat feature . Wouldn‚Äôt think twice about ordering another if need be and absolutely recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic!!!!üëç', 'author': 'christian', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I would honestly give it a higher rating if I could it's warm comfortable and looks great. It feels pretty sturdy to me. Some reviews note low quality zipper but I think it's okay. For sure could be better. But not at all a deal breaker to me. I got a green one and will probly buy a second in black. This for sure should be used as a light rain jacket our as a second layer so dont get mad when it doesnt keep you warm on its own. I wear a Hoodia as my base.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Suits its Purpose and Great Value', 'author': 'Alan E. Borg', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I live in Texas, and winters here go from below freezing to having 70 degrees the next day. I was looking for a jacket that wasn't too light but not a heavy winter jacket. This jacket was recommended on several review sites as a top 10. Fits great, nice and warm and rain proof. I like the attached hood. It is a bit bulky and I wasn't sure about how it was stored when not in use (rolled up at the collar), but after several days of use i actually like it, especially when i am driving and it is a bit of a cushion on the neck. It does not have dozens of pockets, but does have enough of them!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Beyond As Advertised - 5 Stars Justified', 'author': 'Dale W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Absolutely satisfied. This jacket was/is everything I hoped it would be and more! Warm, waterpoof and functional. Already tested in cold wet weather. I\'m a pocket guy and there are plenty.I tried to get a similar jacket elsewhere and it was a "trainwreck" dealing with them. Wrong size, returning and getting refunded was a nightmare.Glad! Because I found this store and a better jacket. Fast shipping, sizing was perfect (4XL). Buy this jacket here and you will be happy you did!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars NOT WATER PROOF', 'author': 'Mr', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Buyer Beware!This is very nice Jacket with many unique pockets at a decent price yet it is NOT waterproof as advertisedTested it in a rare hard rain in Los Angeles and actually felt the dampness seep throughIt‚Äôs pretty water resistant though', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great all weather jacket, could use a few improvements', 'author': 'Dad', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, I love this jacket. I can wear this rain or shine, 30 to 75 degrees Fahrenheit or even 20 if I wear a long sleeve underneath. Water doesn‚Äôt bead at all and the hoodie is sufficient at keeping rain and wind of your face. It‚Äôs sleek and I constantly get compliments on it. It‚Äôs not perfect though and they‚Äôre minimal.Con:-The cuff plastic hook and loop (velcro )is utterly awful. It never properly worked and would open up constantly to where it was almost dangerous to wear the jacket. I‚Äôm in law enforcement and if the company is actually made up of military veterans then they should know how important securing stuff to your body is. One instance my cuff went over my hand as I was drawing my firearm at the range. Being a controlled environment I holstered and took off the jacket so it wouldn‚Äôt go over my hand or affect my grip, imagine if that was an emergency and prevented me from using my hands properly because the cuff got in the way or caught onto something. I have a fix which I go over later.- The roll up hoodie looks ridiculous, bulky and unprofessional. That‚Äôs about all I have to say on that, your coworkers will notice and they will dog on you about the new neck brace you have on lol.Improvements:- I suggest switching the cuff to actual hook & loop or velcro. I personally used a razor blade and shaved off the plastic nubs and cuz some both side of velcro to the cuff. I used a bit of additional fabric glue and let it dry under a 25lb plate to cure overnight just in case. It is vastly superior works very well.- I would love for there to be pen pockets on the sleeve for my pen and handcuff key.- A removable hoodie would make it look very professional and work with some policies as my department head actually didn‚Äôt approve of this jacket due to the hoodie until an incident with a coworker actually had him change his mind of that policy. Also I know you can roll up the hoodie and velcro it down to become a ‚Äúcollar‚Äù but it looks terrible, and looks more like a neck brace rather than a collar.Overall this is a fantastic jacket and with some tiny improvements this can be THE tactical jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good mid-weight jacket', 'author': 'Craig Cronquist', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect for what I wanted. I needed something between the heavy winter coat and the light jackets. When zipped up this one seems to keep pretty warm. Tons of pockets, although not using most of them so far. Only concerns are that the jacket sleeves seem a bit stiff, but I expect they may loosen up as it is worn more. Also, the packaging for shipping was only a sealed plastic bag, but the top seam split during handling before delivery. No damage to the jacket, so not a problem for me this time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Performance Crew Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Looks good', 'author': 'Michael Meyer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket fit well and looks good. Im 5‚Äô11 158pounds. I really like the design, its just like the dickies eisenhower jacket‚Ä¶. Butttt!!! Youre better off buying the dickies version.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid Jacket', 'author': 'M. Leetz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Great length, it's a little wide but I'm a skeleton so no fault of Red Kap. If you have animals, this attracts their hair like a magnet so hang it up when not in use.Good material, comfortable and warm; an excellent light jacket. Almost all of the stitching's ends were long and sticking out, but a few minutes with a lighter cleaned them all up and now it looks slick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Jacket', 'author': 'Raiden', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Nice Jacket. Comfortable. Nice and plain without any silly design. People here are complaining about loose threads. If you never worked for a company that provides uniforms, know that you have to trim the loose threads from manufacturing like pretty much anything from a uniform company. The sleeves are a little long but I just cuffed them like in my picture and they are fine now. It\'s a little short though, it comes down right below the belt line. If you are tall, have a long torso, or don\'t tuck in your shirts, you might want to get the Red Kap Panel Jacket instead, which is a little longer. I\'m 5\'7" and 240 pounds, I got the 2XL and it\'s a decent fit for me. If you have a gut like me there is not a lot of room for it. I\'m about 48" around the chest and 50" around at the belly button and it is not tight on my stomach but just about right. If you are fatter than 52" around the stomach this jacket will be too small when you sit down with it zipped up. If your stomach is more than a couple inches bigger around than your chest, I would say this is not a good jacket design for you. The chest area of the jacket is bigger than the stomach area. My shoulders are 20 inches wide measured from the outside of the arms and it\'s a good fit. If your shoulders are wider than 21 inches measured from the outside of the arms then this jacket will be too small for you. I can barely get hands in the inside pockets. The palm of my hand is 4" wide. If the palms of your hands are wider than 4", the inside pockets will be too small to get your hands in. I wish it had pockets on the chest. The outside pockets are nicely insulated to keep your hands warm. The fabric is a ripstop weave which you cannot see in the pictures. I think it looks cool and will post a picture of it. I also posted a picture of what the inside looks like.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Sizing feedback', 'author': 'Sarah Weiss', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Model size 6‚Äô2‚Äù 220lbs Jacket size MediumMany reviewers have stated to purchase a size down due to the product running large. This was not my experience.Jacket was tight and constricting. I did not want to exchange for a Large because the manufacturer never responded to my email asking about waist length or any other available measurements.The waist length of this style of jacket was too short for me.I think Medium may fit 5‚Äô10‚Äù 180lbs properly. If you want a high waist style. They look good and professional in photos but I don‚Äôt feel comfortable when any movement shows your belt line/possibly skin.I provided the measurement from zipper top to zipper bottom for reference, 24‚Äù total.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Winter Military Thicken Parka Jacket Warm Coat with Removable Hood
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well made coat', 'author': 'Pesky', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Well made husband loved it fit perfectly I bought a xlg. My husband is 5'10 190 lbs. The one imperfection is the chin strap. When I snap it, it doesn't really fit right. Under my chin it is too tight; and above my chin it is not quite right. I like the front pockets, so I don't have to worry about my hat and gloves falling out the side pockets.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Five Stars', 'author': 'P. P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect my son loves it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality workmanship', 'author': 'Frank', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I purchased this coat which fit perfectly every way except around my waist. Reluctantly, I had to return it. This is a well made coat, one will know that, the moment you pick it up, this item has a lot of weight to it. The overall design with that rugged look, enclosed sleeves and neck protection, I knew this coat will definitely keep you warm. I'm seriously considering going a size up and purchasing again. The concern I have now is that the fit will be the opposite of the above. Worth the try. Highly recommended.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price, stylish, and warmer than expected.', 'author': 'Nate T', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I‚Äôve only worn this jacket for 10 minutes to try it on, but wanted to review it for sizing at least. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù, 135 pounds. I ordered a small which is my typical size. This was the right size for me and I can easily wear a long sleeve and hoodie under this to make it fit properly. It‚Äôll be baggy if I wear just a thin long sleeve or tshirt under it, but that‚Äôs not the reason I bought it. This will be a day-to-day jacket for me in a mid-Atlantic winter and it should do just fine. It will not cut it in under 20¬∞F weather I don‚Äôt think, but I have a heavier jacket for that. I‚Äôm happy with this purchase and picked it up for about $50 on a sale. Quality seems on par for a $50 jacket. Anybody bashing the quality while expecting top quality for a budget jacket is ridiculous, but I do expect stitching to start coming out with moderate use within a couple seasons of use. Still worth it in my opinion. It‚Äôs not a 5-star jacket, but it is very good for the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Bought this in XL for my son, he is 6'2 210lbs", 'author': 'Karen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "He has now worn it through a cold spell in Kansas City. Son is very satisfied with this purchase. He likes the fit and warmth down into teens. I was very concerned about brand, quality, and fit. All of it worked out. I wish there had been more reviews that stated size purchase and size of the person it was for. Again, bought and XL and son is 6'2 and 210lbs", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and comfy', 'author': 'garland augustine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'For winter cold weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sizing!!!', 'author': 'Jean', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The sizing for this is typically import sizing. title: Men's Rain Defender Relaxed Fit Midweight Softshell Hooded Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect cool (not cold!) lightweight jacket!', 'author': 'Chris Isbell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Carhartt jackets tend to run a little large, but this one fits a bit slimmer. That‚Äôs not a bad thing, as this is a soft shell jacket and that‚Äôs sort of the the whole point and style. It‚Äôs not too tight or small, which is what I was worried about.I own several Carhartt jackets, and this is perfect for cool days and nights. I needed a lightweight water resistant and wind proof jacket to get me through October to late Fall here in Tennessee, and this jacket did the trick.As far as comfort rating and temperature, I can wear this with only a T-shirt and sit on my porch and stay totally warm from 55 degrees and up. No activity in other words.If I‚Äôm mowing or walking and moving, this jacket keeps me comfortable down to about 50 degrees. If you layer with a lightweight cotton/nylon blend sweater, add 10 degrees to the above assessment. Comfy down to 45 degrees. If I wear an actual shirt designed to retain warmth (a layering shirt made for that purpose), I can add another 5 degrees of warmth.The material inside the jacket is a tiny grid of micro fleece. But the jacket does a fantastic job at blocking the wind and shedding rain, and that alone adds comfort value in cooler temperatures.I love it so much that I‚Äôm ordering others in different colors.My only complaint is that it tends to ride up if driving. No big deal as I just pull it back down when I‚Äôm out of my truck. Think Captain Picard and his uniform top. (For those that get the reference from Star Trek TNG.)It has great mobility in the arms, too.I love it and I‚Äôd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a cool weather lightweight jacket that‚Äôs perfect for those cooler days in the Fall and Spring where a heavier coat is ‚Äútoo warm‚Äù.Edit* Five month review updateI‚Äôve worn this amazing jacket almost daily when the weather warranted a light jacket. It has held up exceptionally well, and still looks and feels brand new. The zippers work great, the drawstring hem works great, and the hood is useful and large enough to actually protect the wearer.4.75 stars out of 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket!!', 'author': 'Marjorie S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this jacket for my husband for Christmas and he loves it!! It fits great and is a nice weight for Spring and Fall cooler weather!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect shell', 'author': 'Billy L', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the perfect shell for construction. It's water repellent, wind resistant, tough (hasn't ripped after almost two years) ,roomy enough to layer underneath, comfortable as it has a little stretch to it and it actually looks good.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'AKMTNRUNNER', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Awesome jacket for in between fall/winter/spring. Wind proof and waterproof. Love the blocked or cubed fleece insulation. Great fit and color.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It is really relaxed fit. Means my regular S fits like M.', 'author': 'Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Feels rugged. I wouldn't say it is lightweight. If it mostly wind and rain protection, then I can wear something under for warmth.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this product', 'author': 'Jacob Lester', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Always owned big bulky jackets and didn‚Äôt have much of a dedicated rain jacket. Would buy another', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket', 'author': 'Becca', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this jacket for my son and husband. A great purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket', 'author': 'Deb', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Husband loves it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cozy Classic', 'author': 'Pat G.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was a Christmas present for my husband. I definitely recommend this jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Used', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Nice jacket but do be careful the one I got was too small so either way I had to exchange for a larger size but, when I received this one it had a parking ticket inside the pocket and a lot of halls wrappers inside the other pocket. title: Men's Waterproof Rain Jacket Outdoor Lightweight Softshell Raincoat for Hiking Travel
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Rain, Fit, Construction Quality Review', 'author': 'David', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is light weight, not too noisy, and keeps me dry.Fit:The jacket fits nicely. Depending on the shirt, I wear small or medium and I need the medium in this jacket. The small fit according to the measurements, but the waste area of the jacket was too tight so I needed medium.The hood has a harder time covering my poofy hair, but when I wrap the velcro, the hood is fine and has adjustable tightness.Rain:(So far it has kept me 100% dry)The jacket keeps me dry when walking 5-10 minutes between classes in light to moderate rain. The jacket kept me dry for a 5 minute walk to class in a heavier rain (raining hard enough to have to walk through puddles.)Long-term rain is untested, but this is good enough for walking to work/college.Construction Quality:Adverage amount of loose threads.Single stitching.Velcro is quality is decent.Comfort facts:Low thermal insulation (layers need for cold)Gets hot on a sunny day.Lightweight / easy carryStyle:The jacket (all white) is very stylish for a rain jacket and the black of the front zipper is covered by white when zipped.The jacket is pretty quite all things considered.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality!', 'author': 'Relentless Reader', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this rain jacket for my husband for Christmas. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great every day jacket, and so comfortable. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great winter coat for work and play', 'author': 'Brenna Lyons', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My husband needed a new hooded coat for work. title: Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boot
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Bit expesive but fantastic Hiking boots for Women!', 'author': 'P. Patil', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots in the Stratus/Canyon Rose color for my wife, and she absolutely loves them!Firstly, I'd recommend going half a size up for a perfect fit. Once you've got the sizing right, you're in for a treat. Appearance-wise, they look like true hiking boots, with a sleek design that my wife really appreciates. The arch support is fantastic, offering comfort and preventing fatigue even on longer hikes. Plus, they're incredibly comfortable right out of the box, requiring minimal break-in time.One of the standout features is their water resistance. Be it muddy trails and shallow streams, and these boots will keep dry throughout.Overall, we're highly satisfied with the Columbia Women's Newton Ridge Plus Waterproof Amped Hiking Boots. If you're in need of reliable hiking footwear that combines quality, durability, appearance, arch support, and comfort, look no further. These boots are a must-buy for any outdoor enthusiast!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Terrific in winter weather, wide is truly a wide', 'author': 'Eeyorefan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was heading out on a Christmas market cruise in Europe and we didn‚Äôt expect snow in early December so I wasn‚Äôt worried about footwear. Suddenly, we learned that there was unseasonable snowfall along the Danube and it was going to continue. I was in need of waterproof hiking boots and I bought these on Amazon in last minute desperation. (They arrived literally one hour before we left for the airport!) Because of a bunion on my right foot, I do need a wider shoe but I‚Äôve learned that most wides aren‚Äôt truly wide and I sometimes have to buy a men‚Äôs size. Not so with these! Although I did swap out the insole with the inserts I wear in my workout shoes for more arch support, these shoes needed no break-in time in Europe. The very first day we were walking in snow in Prague and over the course of 10 days, I walked an average of 6 miles a day in snowy, icy cities. The shoes felt like I had been wearing them for months already. No blisters, no red spots from rubbing, just a really comfortable shoe that kept my feet dry and warm. I‚Äôm so excited about these that, even though these were on sale, I‚Äôm going to buy a second pair in another color at full price. I‚Äôm very impressed.Oh, and extra points for the quick lace up option at the top. This shoe was thoughtfully designed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love these!', 'author': 'monica cerda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I always wear heeled leather boots as my day to day fashion, I‚Äôve never been a sneaker person and so after complaining to a friend about hiking sneakers I purchased hurting the top of my foot after an hour of wear, they suggested I try hiking boots instead. I felt like a fool for never connecting the dots. Lol.Well‚Ä¶I found these, loved the color options and the reviews seemed pretty legit! I‚Äôve worn them twice so far while running errands to see how they feel and I have to say, no discomfort and so lightweight!!Now down to sizing: With stylish boots, I‚Äôm typically a size 8, and I did order an 8 initially, however with a thin sock, they felt pretty snug and I thought maybe they might start to bother my toes since there‚Äôs more cushion that what I‚Äôm used to and what if I want to wear thick socks?For me that was enough to go up to an 8.5 juuuust to be on the safe side and because‚Ä¶why not find out? $75 is still $75.So glad I did! They feel roomier yet still a great fit, so if you‚Äôre in limbo, I‚Äôd say size up .5 if you want to be able to throw these on without switching your socks. üòâHappy I got these and I‚Äôm looking forward being more active!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 3rd Time WAS a Charm! Only took 5 tries to find Prince Charming's Boot!", 'author': 'FLGulfGrnEz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I read the reviews wherever I could find them. I had become very confused over the sizing. I have a hard enough time getting the right size without this much of a difference thrown at me too!I was in love @first glance, beautiful dark gray with aqua strings. Ordered size 7 as suggested though I wear a size 6.5 or 6. Feet measures a size 5-5.5, L=8.5" R=8.7". There lies the rub, right foot doesn\'t fit sizes same as left one by a fraction so hit or miss. Also, remember, as you age, your feet spread causing sizing up like me to 6.5 in shoes, 7 usually in boots but style can put you back to regular size if they are rounded toe box or squared box mostly in western styles. Shoes strings are very helpful as they can be adjusted to make more room, not more length. Mules are easier to get by smaller sized if you don\'t have toes that won\'t go entire way down, heel hangs off, usually good bet as mostly open. Overall best choice in any type of foot covering is "Leather", your friend for stretching if little small as they will mold to feet, put in a cushion before wearing though. Zippers are the bomb for higher topped boots/shoes especially with fat feet, high instep, opens the slimmer top for feet to get to sole.Back to the size sessions; First was great price on 7\'s, looked order back up and saw where I had ordered from the warehouse! Wow, what a great mistake... for my sis! Really, check it out. What others say about buying "like new", warehouse, etc., if you don\'t check it out, you are making HUGE mistake. I would never had known if not curious then found sticker where stated, "checked by warehouse". Besides, if you don\'t like what you receive, give them to your sis for Christmas! If that\'s not acceptable, check returns, usually can send back w/30 days from Amazon, look at rules though. Truly, you need to check the other items like ones we sometimes just look at and Nope, return. Perfect shape, they get sold cheaper w/new ones @less cost.Wanted those boots but those 7\'s were too great price, that\'s why sis got them and was gaga over them. So, I ordered size 6, suggested 6.5, too bad, too big but kept just in case.... the size 5\'s I was ordering now, 3rd try, didn\'t fit even though suggested I wear a 6 now! Well the 5\'s came and went, that fraction of inch on R foot, felt fine, but only for few minutes, just fraction too small in toes based on R foot!Last and 4th time! Wow! That tells you how badly I wanted these shoes, they just checked off too many boxes to let them go without a good fight. The 5.5\'s I was sure would fit in a WIDE, had been costly, at over $100 if remember correctly. Figures! Only size left & at most expensive price! Waited a day later, 5.5W\'s & more sizes had come in, ordered them up and got them in about a day. When I saw them, crossed fingers as I thought they were a yes. I have them on now, they feel like they should have been on my feet the whole time! So, the size 5.5W is my size w/just enough room for thick socks or thinner ones. I live in Florida, though kids live in Denver & Boise & France. These will work out fine for all places as it is warm today here & fit & feel great!Updated: 12/1/23, getting later, quicker! After size 7, 6, 5, 5.5W and guess what? Another size 6 was ordered at new price 1/2 of all others, came few days later. Probably wondering what was wrong w/1st size 6\'s? Nothing, just needed to make sure of correct size due to computer blindness, too much shopping. I was getting goofy and thought perhaps all in my head, being too careful. What actually happened was I realized when I put those 5\'s on, I\'d be needing really thick, wool socks and they would be more conducive & warmer to wear in a size 6!!!! Ran to Ross, bought thick wool socks, 2 pairs, eh cheap try. I have finally found my problem, I am a Floridian going to frozen U.S. This past Thursday it was really cold here and even wearing great boots w/socks feet were freezing in few minutes on way to HOA meeting! Thank goodness I used my "prior northern snow experience" to kick me in head, loosen up screws and I now firmly believe that I had probably needed to size down one size smaller than the size 7 suggested to the size 6 (I got twice!) or try a wide in next small size if all left. I know I really needed the room, which these boots have plenty of and are warm whereas my Frye\'s were made for Florida & no thick socks! The only dilemma w/sizing is the extra room throughout/around entire toe bed & instep w/room to spare, it\'s the length to think about, like I finally did. I also put in a shoe cushion to help with some of the extra room, then thick socks won over. Still have plenty of room through toe bed area but TOO PRETTY, COMFY & TIRED to second guess anymore, size 6 it is!Merry Christmas Folks! Good Luck with your sizing, hope this finally solves some problems??? It was the socks that made all the difference which I kept hearing in almost every review but didn\'t hear the bell in head go off... All\'s good that ends with most comfortable boot for warm & still is especially fab for cold, wet wool sock weather! I can go snow boarding now! Merry Christmas to me.....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality but rubbed on my ankle', 'author': 'Toni Like', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The shoe was nicely made and looked to be good quality. One being bigger and slightly wider than the other as well. I always wore a 6.5 shoe, but I guess my feet spread out over time so now I wear 7.5-8 shoes/boots. I went with the 7.5 wide on these and they feel just fine. If I got 8s I think they‚Äôd have been too long and I‚Äôd be tripping on my own feet. Definitely glad I got the wides they would have been too narrow if I got the regular ones. They feel fine out of the box but I tend to get foot fatigue easily due to my foot condition so I need to break them in. My baby toes always get the brunt of the pain when wearing shoes and especially new shoes. I haven‚Äôt felt that pain right away like I normally would. So that‚Äôs a plus for comfort!!So far I love these and so glad I bought both pairs! I love the color and the red laces. They remind me of the old hiking boots I used to see growing up, only a more comfortable updated version! I do own other Columbia products and am usually pleased with their products, this is the first time purchasing footwear.Thank you!Edit I‚Äôve been wearing these to work using my orthotics, standing on my feet on cement floor. title: Men's Rain Defender Relaxed Fit Midweight Softshell Hooded Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect cool (not cold!) lightweight jacket!', 'author': 'Chris Isbell', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Carhartt jackets tend to run a little large, but this one fits a bit slimmer. That‚Äôs not a bad thing, as this is a soft shell jacket and that‚Äôs sort of the the whole point and style. It‚Äôs not too tight or small, which is what I was worried about.I own several Carhartt jackets, and this is perfect for cool days and nights. I needed a lightweight water resistant and wind proof jacket to get me through October to late Fall here in Tennessee, and this jacket did the trick.As far as comfort rating and temperature, I can wear this with only a T-shirt and sit on my porch and stay totally warm from 55 degrees and up. No activity in other words.If I‚Äôm mowing or walking and moving, this jacket keeps me comfortable down to about 50 degrees. If you layer with a lightweight cotton/nylon blend sweater, add 10 degrees to the above assessment. Comfy down to 45 degrees. If I wear an actual shirt designed to retain warmth (a layering shirt made for that purpose), I can add another 5 degrees of warmth.The material inside the jacket is a tiny grid of micro fleece. But the jacket does a fantastic job at blocking the wind and shedding rain, and that alone adds comfort value in cooler temperatures.I love it so much that I‚Äôm ordering others in different colors.My only complaint is that it tends to ride up if driving. No big deal as I just pull it back down when I‚Äôm out of my truck. Think Captain Picard and his uniform top. (For those that get the reference from Star Trek TNG.)It has great mobility in the arms, too.I love it and I‚Äôd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a cool weather lightweight jacket that‚Äôs perfect for those cooler days in the Fall and Spring where a heavier coat is ‚Äútoo warm‚Äù.Edit* Five month review updateI‚Äôve worn this amazing jacket almost daily when the weather warranted a light jacket. It has held up exceptionally well, and still looks and feels brand new. The zippers work great, the drawstring hem works great, and the hood is useful and large enough to actually protect the wearer.4.75 stars out of 5.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Jacket!!', 'author': 'Marjorie S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this jacket for my husband for Christmas and he loves it!! title: Men's Outdoor Waterproof Soft Shell Hooded Military Tactical Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really surprised by how nice this is', 'author': 'Lori and Vince', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I gave 5 stars for water resistance and weatherproofness as I feel it will likely do well enough. I don\'t expect water proof, just to keep it at bay for a while. Have yet to actually put it through its paces.I gave my only waterproof jacket to my mom as she needed it when we were out once. She loved wearing it, so I said she could keep it. Thus, I now need a replacement as I have nothing else water resistant and will be going on a 2 wk trip to Norway in mid June. It is still cool above the arctic circle in June. I needed one garmet that could cover a decent range of weather. This was cheap, water resistant and had a good hood. I took a chance (having time to return and get something else if I didn\'t like it). Got it yesterday and gave it a good exam and wear around the house. It is exactly as advertised. I ordered a 2XL as I am in between XL and 2XL in most things and just erred on the side of safety. The 2XL fits PERFECTLY. It has enough room still for a fleece or hoodie underneath. For reference, I am 5\'8" and 240lbs (stocky not round). The jacket\'s shell is very comfortable fabric that has some stretch, so it moves very nicely with you and seems reasonably durable. The thin fleece liner is nice and makes it much more comfortable to wear. The pockets and stitching all look well done and pass my initial exam. The dual zipper works very well. I have an ICON motorcycle jacket with a dual zipper that sucks. Was worried this would too, nope. The rest of the zippers all work very well. I kept saying to myself, this was only $32. I should buy more. The hood, when rolled up, isn\'t ideal, but fine. Just leaving it down is likely how I will roll. Also, the velcro on the hood is a bit misaligned. Not bad and still works fine, but I notice it. This jacket appears to be identical to the Free Soldier jacket (like many things on Amazon - same thing, different brand names and prices), just in this case, much cheaper. For the money, this is AMAZING.Note on the sizing chart: It appears that the Chest size is the actual circumference of the fabric, not your suit coat size. Thus, if I wanted it to wear it bare chested like skin, a small would be perfect (49 chest) You have to account for how many extra inches you want inside to account for shirts and potentially layers, for reference, the 2XL was ideal for me.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality jacket. Order two sizes larger than normal', 'author': 'aaron mckinney', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a slim cut on the jacket so don't be afraid to order two sizes larger then you normally would. I'm normally large to extra large American size and the 3XL fits just right in the sleeves. The 2XL was too tight in the shoulders and the cuffs came up above my wrists. The fabric is a bit stiff until it is run through the wash about 4 times, then it loosens up somewhat. Order two sizes and possibly three sizes above normal. The jacket is self is well-made and very waterproof. Could do light duty as a spring or fall jacket, and handle cold weather with the proper layering underneath.The seller is very responsive and took good care of me by sorting out an issue I had with the fit and making me happy. Now that I know the correct size I need I will be ordering from this seller again!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice jacket...detailed review', 'author': 'Brian', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Arrived on time and in good packaging. MCU color pattern was accurate and shade was accurate. Bought a Small for my son who\'s 5\'7" and 115lbs, very slight build. Fits very nice, has plenty room for layering underneath, but not so much it\'s too big. Arm length fit nicely, but he is very lanky body type. Keep this in mind for shorter arm body type, as they may be long. Double layered elbow reinforced. Drawsting bungee bottom for tightening. Bottom sides curve upwards for pistol drawing or holster placement. Drops back down in front and in the rear. Great for rain run off over belt line. Nothing worse than a shortback jacket that drains right into your crack. Hood is large but has a drawstring and will roll down and draw tight for storage, very nice feature. Most do not stow away like a high collar, they just flop around a collect water like a bucket. Zippers are not yyk, but seem to be sturdy enough. Plenty of pockets, but the down side of all the pockets are their depth. This keeps it from being perfect. Inner pocket seam is straight across at the bottom, very shallow. Meaning, things could fall out very easy if it\'s not zipped up partially. It\'s my only real complaint. Waterproof\'ish, heavy downpours for extended time will eventually waterlog it. Very good water resistant is more accurate. But it does hold water out for a good period of time, very satisfied considering. Fleece lining is a touch too thin for my liking, but definitely acceptable especially for layering and cost of jacket. Under arm zippers will be felt, if you decide to wear it in short sleeves. But not a deal breaker by no means. You\'ll just know they are there. Underarm vents are large, and easy to grab zipper to open and close. Great feature most don\'t offer. The tail pocket is also very shallow, but in my opinion the best feature of the jacket. Large enough for extra storage out of the way, and keeps bulk from the front of the jacket. Works as a rear magazine dump pouch for me. Unzip halfway on 1 side, keeps empty mags in the pocket without falling out when moving around and running. Easy to reach and large enough to hold 3-4 AR style mags easily. Velcro works, arm pockets are plentiful, but shallow. Bought for playing airsoft in milsim\'s and other events, hunting, camping, etc.. in inclement weather without wearing or carrying a ton of gear, ie..warbelt, chest rig, or extra under layers. Challenge was met and has exceeded my expectations. I bought 3xl for myself in green. I own Columbia jacket that\'s similar. Columbia fleece is thicker, zippers are better quality. This jacket has more features, for well under half the price. It\'s a great budget friendly but very serviceable jacket. I\'ve done a ton of reviews and give a straight forward opinion. This is a winner for anyone not wanting to spend $80-150 for a similar type jacket. This jacket deserved this much detailed information, for the under $37 or whatever I paid. Not 5 stars, but as close as it gets. Darn shallow pockets?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality, well made, very water resistant.', 'author': 'Adriana F', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got my husband a camo color, n its beautiful, grrreat quality, very good looking, super nice fit, well insulated n still kinda light n comfortable, he loves that he can tighten or losen it at the wrists, its not long but not short at all at the bottom just right, great for wet AND cold weather, does it's job n then some. Very worth the price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars TOO SMALL', 'author': 'Marshall', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I ordered a 3x, got a 3x but it was a 1x or xl. I couldn't get it on me. It was such a good price i just gave it away. Good quality, nice jacket but not for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feel and look!!', 'author': 'Gong Lau', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I just got my item and feel like I'm gonna like this jacket. It feels like quality material and looks like good wind and water resistance. The hood is a little firm so it doesn't sit down readily, but I can live with that. I bought the dark camo and it looks as was advertised. I bought and normally wear extra large and it gives me enough room to wear a sweatshirt or fleece underneath should I need it. I'm going to buy another one in black.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars One you get the zipper figured out... it's great!", 'author': 'Richard C. Randall', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket is great... once you figure out how the zipper works. The first time I used it, the zipper separated... making me think that it was defective. HOWEVER, there are 2 zipper tabs on the zipper (see photo). What you have to do is firmly fit the end of the zipper THROUGH the top zipper tab into the bottom zipper tab. THEN zip it up. Once you know the "trick", it works GREAT!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fits as sized, looks good, quality matches price', 'author': 'lytefast', 'rating': 4, 'content': "First off I'm satisfied with the jacket. It fits as sized so make sure to measure before you buy. I bought one slightly bigger so I could fit a light hoodie inside. Even then it's snug.Threading/sewing is holding, but didn't look as high quality as ones from other name brand jackets I own. The inside of the jacket pockets are also all exposed and loose. Doesn't bother me, though the name brand jackets usually do a better job of patching these you the jacket lining.2 minor disappointments:- pockets are small. I couldn't fit my phone into theAny of the side pockets.- the armpit vents don't have a layer of breathable fabric attached. Usually they're is a layer of mesh between the zippers", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars SOFTSHELL WITH ADJUSTABLE VENTILATION', 'author': 'kwog', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I got this jacket to wear as an everyday work jacket and to wear when I ride my fatbike when it\'s cold. I have been searching for a softshell with armpit vent zippers that had the zipper on the right hand side on the main zipper. I am about 5\'10" and weigh 155 lbs. I ordered a size large aiming for a looser fit that would allow me to wear a hoodie underneath. The large was perfect, it\'s not baggy but a looser fit like a pair of carpenter jeans. It did take me a few days to make friends with the 2 way zipper, but once this jacket got me trained it became a non-issue. I did notice loose threads and one of the D-rings in the front pockets where they missed 90% of the seam. Not a big deal at this price it\'s to be expected. I believe this jacket is worth the price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The Arm fabric wide enough for a gallon of milk to fit through', 'author': 'Flouride Filter Set Up', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Idk what it is but the arms are over stretched upon arrival.Just because I ordered 2XL doesn't mean my arms are the size of a waterbuffalos hind leg", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Classic Zip Front Polar Fleece Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nicely made and very attractive', 'author': 'Judy Reynolds', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Gift for my husband. Looks great on him. Comfy, warm and attractive. Very well made.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent', 'author': 'David Asaad', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excellent, looks nice, true size, very good quality and material', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Warm & Smart looking, But the sleeves run long', 'author': 'Farhan K', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The Tommy Hilfiger is a smart looking looking fleece jacket that looks great on jeans and is is pretty warm and cozy as well. The fleece material is thicker and of better quality than what you would typically find in a Fruit of the Loom or a Hanes Fleece Jacket. It fits well around the chest and has sufficient length , the only issue is that its sleeves run a bit long. I had to fold them up to use them for my L sized jacket(I usually wear Large) . I\'ve included the main measurements of this jacket for its \'Large\' size in case you\'d like to refer for sizingDESIGN & QUALITY- Full sleeved zippered jacket with a turtle neck & no hoodie- Two zippered front pockets as well as two inner pockets on either side- The turtle neck collar is double layered- The zippers glide smoothly and feel that they are of good quality- The piped design/stitching that runs across the chest and back looks much better in real life than in pictures alone and adds to its overall smart looks- Both the exterior and interior pockets are deep enough to fit wallets, keys , large cellphonesDIMENSIONS (SIZE: LARGE)Sleeves :27" InchesShoulder :6.5" InchesLength :29.5" InchesWidth chest :24" InchesTHE GOOD:- Smart looking jacket that pairs well with jeans and contrasting t-shirts , whether you zip half or all the way up- The thick fleece material and the double layered turtle neck makes the jacket very warm and cozy - sufficient for 48F ~ 50F weather without any additional layers- 4 Pockets and smooth flowing zippers- Fits well around the chestTHE NOT SO GOOD- The sleeves run long , I had to fold them in my day to day use (see pics)- The fleece + black color of my jacket is a magnet for lint and hair, an important consideration if you have pets (common with most fleece jackets)- The tags in the neck area can be bothersome if you\'re wearing round neck t-shirts- For these reasons I take away one starFINAL THOUGHTSOverall the Tommy Hilfiger fleece jacket is very smart looking, warm to wear and is better in terms of quality than other common brands. The only thing I would recommend considering is that the sleeves tend to run long and that it does attract a lot of lint and hair', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars nice and thick', 'author': 'PeterC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'like the tight and thick feel for this Jacket, zipped pockets are must for me for outdoor running with phones, keys.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality fleece type jacket', 'author': 'Richard Jones', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Come in a nice variety of colors but sized run a tad smaller.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fleece Jacket', 'author': 'Gladys Cheung', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'One of my favourite brands sustains reputation for good quality of apparel, warm and light :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Handsome.', 'author': 'Joanne Wilshanetsky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great quality. The fleece is slightly different but still very soft. Has a lot of pockets but the internal ones do not zip. Still have internal side pockets. And the exterior pockets are massive; much bigger in comparison to BS. And it also has rear pockets (BS calls it a map pocket). It's hood is good and has the little bill. The waistline does adjust to prevent airflow.Cons: The zipper is on the wrong side and does not zip as smoothly as its expensive competitor. Thumb holes do not equate to adjustable cuffs. As others have said, the hood is a little big and floppy and given lack of adjustment, it's almost useless unless you want to go sailing. One last thing compared to BS, the zipper does not have the wind resistant inner flap like its competitor.Differences but but neither good/bad: It's fits different. It's not as bulky (both are mediums). This one fits tighter, but not because it's smaller, but rather because it isn't as thick.So there ya go. I suppose you're here because you're considering BS. Otherwise, it's a very nice jacket.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Fall into Winter Jacket', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Super light, easy to pack yet keeps me warm and dry. Tested with 22 degrees and light winds, I believe it can handle even lower temperatures. Definitely a keeper!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A puffer jacket without much puff', 'author': 'Ron', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is a nice lightweight jacket that fits well and feels comfortable in relatively warm conditions. It is not a real cold weather jacket.I like the fit of this jacket. The size chart was right on the money for me. It\'s very comfortable to wear around the house on cool mornings before the heater gets going, and it\'s not bad in fairly cool temperatures. I wore it outside a couple of evenings when our temps got down into the low 40s, and I could feel the cold seep through within minutes, so it\'s not a good choice for really cold conditions unless you add a base layer and a fleece layer underneath. It has very little loft, so it\'s not designed for much cold.But it\'s comfy. And the attached storage bag is handy. Pay no attention to the instructions on how to pack the jacket on this page. It is for a different kind of jacket. I included a video showing how to stuff the jacket into its own bag. Very handy feature.Good zippers, and the stitching seems to be pretty good. Found a couple of strings sticking out, but not many.As advertised, the jacket is "water resistant." It tolerates some splashing, but it can\'t take a soaking. I gave it the totally unfair test of pooling water on it and seeing how long it takes to soak all the way through. It soaks through within a few minutes, so this is not a foul weather jacket.Nice jacket for what it\'s advertised to do. Fits well, feels comfortable, and my Lady Love says I look good in it, so there\'s that.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly warm for such a light-weight jacket', 'author': 'David in Dallas', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I ordered my usual size and it fit well. The arms are a bit longer than usual, but that\'s not a bad thing. I can reach for something without exposing my wrists to the elements. It\'s very light weight, and despite being translucent, it\'s surprisingly warm. I got the "green," which matched the photo in the listing -- I fail to see green. It\'s more of an unusual golden beige to my eyes, but it\'s a great color and I\'m glad I chose it because it\'s really good looking and I love something different. The seams are beautifully finished with binding tape and there are zippered side pockets and another across the lower back that is zippered on both sides. Every zipper operates smoothly and easily. There are also huge open side and lower-back pockets on the inside. This ideal to travel with because it squishes up into nothing and won\'t occupy a ton of luggage space. Layering will extend the effective temperature range, but I\'m in the southwest and (hopefully) won\'t be testing its limits. This jacket is very well designed, and the closer you look, the better it gets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap zipper', 'author': 'Todd Z.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Very disappointed as this jacket was the perfect weight, however the main zipper broke just after a month!üòû', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars So so', 'author': 'Freddie Burkhardt', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Collar and cuffs suck. Got free with points. Will not pay money for replacement.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars LOPSIDED - Higher in front than in the back.', 'author': 'Twain, Mark', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Very light jacket. Not suitable for winter. And it's lopsided.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm, Comfortable, And Stylish', 'author': 'The Matt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I‚Äôve been eyeing this Amazon Essentials Corduroy Jacket for months, watching the price fluctuate. The corduroy on the outside is stylish, and the quilted inner-lining has provided me with a nice insulation in chilly 20-degree temps. Also, the lining is slick and the coat easily slides right on and off. The stitching is great, without any loose sloppy threading, and the zipper is robust, and glides up and down smoothly. Furthermore, the collar is surprisingly very pliable, so in colder temperatures, you can bend it upwards to protect your neck from the elements. The pockets on the bottom, though buttonless, are roomy enough for my hands, and as far as the chest pockets, I can‚Äôt comment as I haven‚Äôt used them. Size large fit me perfectly. I really have nothing negative to say.
