When I lift my hands above my head the jacket almost converts to a mid riff jacket.Since it‚Äôs made in China I‚Äôm assuming they don‚Äôt understand American sizing. It seems to be made for someone with a short wide midsection with short arms.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I can't complain!", 'author': 'RPG Man', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I struggle hard these days in figuring out what is worth while on Amazon, so I am trying to make more of an effort to write reviews myself of the things I get.I once had a hoodie like this over a decade ago, but instead of the flanal look it was a solid color. I would see the assorted flanal hoodies and regret I hadn 't gotten one, so many years later far after that hoodie had fallen apart, It was time I got a new one, and thought its time to get a flanal one... only to find no one was selling them anymore, except for amazon!It is very soft, the fluff inside it does feel a little thin, but is very warm. Its lighter weight than some of the older hoodies of this style I had run into before, which is actually a boon. Warm, soft and light is perfect.Fit: It is for sure on the larger side of XL, but as someone who put on a bit of weight that is perfect for me, and once I loose that weight still will fit well, As to some negitives people have said about the sleeves is true, they are an inch or two shorter than they could stand to be. so they can pull back leaving your wrists a little uncovered and get chilly when sitting or streching out, but its hardly the worst instance of this I've encountered. Its perfectly fine.My biggest issue is the pockets on the front. I am so used to those front pockets on hoodies to be nice and deep so you can comfortably keep a phone or other stuff in there and not easily be seen in there, or have some good room to stuff your hands in deep. On this there are just a tad too shallow.All in all, Its comfortable and I enjoy it!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Jacket Shirt Fully Lined', 'author': 'M. M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Oh wow! This shirt has all the things an outdoor man could hope for. An attached hood, hidden pockets, fully sherpa lined in arm sleeves as well and difficult to locate such a shirt. I bought 2 and took them home and gave to my husband early and learned then he wasn't so warm in the shirt sleeves for lack of warm lining and felt cold still. He really needed to replace his other worn shirt jacket and I just kept looking after returning the others. Guess who had the one he wanted most? Amazon of course! My husband is wearing it right now while putting our neighbor's mailbox back on the post. I got him the brown/tan/beige plaid and he looks really nice in it. It hasn't been laundered yet as he just received it today and is putting it to use when taking dogs out for potty breaks, getting the mail, etc. Just short trips outside and he's still cozy warm.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good value', 'author': 'KEVIN SCOTT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Coat has a good weight to it, nice medium weather lining. Great for out and about. Comfortable and not too bulky to wear in car. I wouldn‚Äôt go skiing; and I wouldn‚Äôt shovel the drive without a sweater underneath. Large is my size and this has enough room to wear a sweater without being too tight, roomy but not too large if you don‚Äôt.Not sure I‚Äôd pay full price, 35% sale is good value; bought Blue at 65% discount?! Definitely works for me. It‚Äôs Royal Blue and dull soft denim type fabric with canvas texture, not smooth, not coated, no sheen like one of the pics.Fuzzy lining around body, sleeves are thinner and lightly lined but not fuzzy. Pockets are deep and useful. Great buttons. Looks sharp. Dumb pull cords ‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre supposed to function as tightening hood or waist, but waist is too high and they don‚Äôt stay. Simple leather looking clasp that is for decoration - too loose.Like the elastic sleeve to keep tight at wrist. Again button just looks good, there‚Äôs only one button so you can‚Äôt make it smaller. Really like the removable fuzzy hood with hidden zipper. Proper 2 snaps tightly and no gap. Coat has high button perfectly at chin height with lining and zipper doesn‚Äôt pinch.Really good value, well made. Looks just like website. Very good for the price and very reasonable. Cannot have anything to say bad about the coat. It is excellent. Highly recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Warm material, a little heavy, lower quality', 'author': 'Ian Wienert', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I like this coat. It looks fashionable, and it keeps me warm and dry. It's a little heavy, but it fits well and keeps me warm at work and when I ride my bike in to workThe quality of craftsmanship leaves a little to be desired as some of the snap buttons on the pockets have already fallen off the jacket or are warped and won't snap shut.I really do like it, but it has some drawbacks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice and very very heavy thick jacket...', 'author': 'DoctorSpock', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It did not fit me because I have very wide shouldersbut it is a rugged jacket...very heavy...I suppose thiswould be good in weather around 20 degrees and upin Fahreinheit. Probably not good for minus weatherbut thats because it is not a parka...but it is built sonicely and rugged fabric....', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this coat', 'author': 'Lionel C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "2 things. (I almost hate giving 5 stars because people like me skip the 5 star ratings cause people are too generous with their praise and I also skip the 1 stars for the opposite. But I want people to read this review)Thing 1. The zipper on this coat appears to be plastic because it's tan colored but I swear it feels and sounds like it's real metal. Hallelujah I thought all zippers were plastic now and inferior making metal zippers a thing of the past. Not so.Thing 2. Not sure if it was due to the poor reviews about the hand pockets size but either those complaints were bogus (and there were plenty of them) or the manufactures fixed the problem. The hand pockets are perfect. The complaint was that the pockets were shallow and you'd barely get your fingers inside but on this coat/ jacket that I got the pockets are great. My hands are a good average size for being 6ft and 250lbs and my hands fit exactly right. They go all the way in past the wrist with a nice little bit of room to spare in case you have something in your fist like keys.Another thing people pointed out but I don't call it a complaint and I'll explain. But the other thing people didn't like on this coat was the zipper head was on the left. Back in my day men's zippers were on the right and women's on the left. I thought those days were history due to political correctness. But, this zipper head is on the left and it catches me of guard. I'm not going to complain about it because I like that I have to stay on my toes to zip this up. I don't know how many of you people try this once in a while but most people have a set routine dressing themselves.If you put on pants you may put your right leg in first then left and you always do it that way. But if you ever purposefully reverse that it feels awkward as heck.Well, I like reversing things sometimes just to shake things up and re-coordinate. That's how I see this zipper on the left.I love this coat. I like the weight. It gives me confidence is going to keep me warm. I got it a size bigger than i would for a hoody or T shirt because to wear this coat I'm probably going to have extra layers of clothes underneath like a hoody and the size is perfect. It's not too snug and it's not all billowy letting too much air exchange. BTW I'm 6ft and 250 plus pounds and I got the XXXL. It's just right.So there ya go!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So Far, So Good', 'author': 'Robert Brown', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Everything objective stated, so far, in the descriptions are literally correct. Do *not* choose a size based on what you "usually" wear. For instance, I usually wear an overcoat like this in US size XL since I\'m wearing it over sweaters and usually over 2-3 layers. However, as I usually do when buying clothes on Amazon, I checked the sellers sizing chart. I saw that the "L" size had a 50.7" to 51.5" Chest rating. Bare, my chest size measures US 45-46" and I\'ll normally order an "XL" overcoat that has a 49-50" Chest rating. So, this time, I ordered the "L" size as their chart stated....Perfect sizing!When received it, I tried it on over 3-layers I was wearing. It was easy to put on, even with my arthritis-crippled hands; and, even when zipped, had enough play/looseness to be comfortable sitting or standing without being overly baggy.A couple points of interest for buyers in the US. First, the zipper pulley is US-style on the right-hand side. Some previous buyers stated it was Euro-style on the left, but it looks like they\'ve rectified that for the US market. Second, the button-straps on the cuff, while functional, are decorative in nature. You can button/unbutton them, but there is no second snap for the strap to tighten around the cuffs. The inner elastic cuff is tight enough around the wrists that it shouldn\'t allow any cold wind up the sleeves. There is a third point. The pockets are a *little* bit smaller than what I\'m used to. The upper-chest pockets are a bit tough to fit my fingers into to grab things, but I\'m sure I\'ll get used to it.The coat is shipped in a tight-fitting bag that leaves it wrinkled. If, like me, you have a steamer; just hang it up and it\'s easy to steam out the wrinkles. The pockets, snaps, hood, are all as described/shown. The weather hasn\'t reach sub-freezing while I have this to wear, but I should be able to update before winter is over.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No disappointments', 'author': 'Jeremy and Secret Stevens', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm 6,0..230lbs, average build. I purchased an XL and it fits perfect. All of the pockets work great, large cell phone fits in all of them and so do my hands. I understand what people are saying about the zipper. It's heavy duty, which is great. It is warm while wearing it in the house to try on. It's 45 degrees outside and this thing is more than comfortable. It is a denim type material, so it seems very durable and also it will get wet if it rains but for cooler/cold non-rainey days, it'll be my everyday wear. The mid-length is awesome and it does keep the wind out. Couldn't be happier.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Very comfortable and cozy! Stylish', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A surprisingly warm, soft, beautiful jacket, but with fit problems', 'author': 'Gil Hamilton', 'rating': 3, 'content': "This jacket is really lovely.. it is shiny copper colored, almost metallic. It definitely makes an impression: it may not be to some people's taste, but I love the color and the shine. It is also very very soft, so much so that I find myself petting it sometimes, it is soothing. The jacket is comfortable to wear, and doesn't restrict movement. It is very thin, but still quite warm. I wore it in 50 degree weather wearing shorts and a T-shirt and was fine, and I am very sensitive to cold!Now the bad news: this jacket runs large. I ordered a medium, because that is my shirt size, but in jackets I often need a large. It hangs much more like a large. More importantly, because the material is thin and very floppy the jacket has no shape. This isn't flattering, I have broad, horizontal shoulders yet with the jacket on I look like I have narrower, sunken shoulders.I really enjoy this jacket, and I wish it fit. I could order a smaller size, but I suspect it would be too small in the shoulders (and the arms, but that's because I have freaky-long arms). I wish I could rate it 3 1/2 stars, because I suspect there will be folks for whom the fit isn't an issue, but I can't responsibly rate it four stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It all depends on your shape and on your measurements. Please take note.', 'author': 'Michael Harper', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Simply said, the jacket is soft and the material is luxurious. It has a pleasant light weight. It does come pretty wrinkled, as some people have said.It is a slim fit item, though the waist is a little roomier than one might expect from a slim fit. I am reviewing the XXL size on this item.If you have a chest that is bigger than 54 inches (Maybe 52 for comfort), then you may not be able to zip this jacket past your pectoral muscles. You will probably be able to zip the waist, but the zipper will stop at your pecs, or your bust for those who identify as female, and you will look like social media models who like to emphasize their bustline in that way.If your biceps are around 16 inches, then your arms will fit in the sleeves, but they will bulge spandex-like, which some people absolutely want, but for others, this is uncomfortable. I would guess that the sleeves can accommodate 18 inch biceps, but Hulk Hogan's 22 inch pythons are probably out. All this is not to be confused with sleeve length, we are talking about bicep circumference here.If you work your shoulders a lot, it will feel tight behind the neck and trapezius muscles, and the way this garment is designed, the space taken up by your traps will be sacrificed by your pecs.Most men with a 54 inch chest will have a 48 inch waist, but if you consistently strength train, then you might have a 46 inch waist or a 44 inch waist, maybe even a 42 inch waist. It gets iffy around the 46-47 inch range for waist size, but again, it depends specifically on how you are shaped.If you wear suits, I would say these sizes are an approximate description of the jacket's fit: 52R, 52L, 54R, 54L.I wear a 56R-56L most of the time at 6 feet tall. When the winter plumps me up, maybe a 58R-58L. At either weight, I would have gotten the 3x if it had been available.Good luck!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Kinda Shiny', 'author': 'Matt Morrow', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a very soft, comfortable, and nice looking jacket, but it wasn't exactly what I expected. The pictures in the advertisement seem to make it look like a matte appearance on a few of the photos, but in reality it's more of a shiny appearance. With that being the case, this jacket is better if you're going out in the evening to dinner and not a casual, during the middle of the day jacket, which was more what I was hoping for. The fit is good and it is decent quality, but just not exactly what I was expecting.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Men's Winter Ski Jacket Waterproof Snow Coats Snowboard Fleece Lining Jacket Warm Parka with Hooded
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good enough for the Chicago winter spell', 'author': 'Tom Slick43', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for a recent trip to Chicago during late January and this jacket held up great, kept me warm throughout my trip, though admittedly the weather was relatively mild for Chicago at the time of my trip. Jacket has a lot of functional pockets, deep enough to hold my iphone plus with battery case, though i wish the outer pockets were a little larger as it might be hard if you have large hands. The size appears to be true. The layers were thick enough to block the Chicago winds, but mind you it wasn‚Äôt below 10F, and the outer shell was impervious to a snowball fight. The removable hood works well and the labeling is subtle, not over-bearing. Also, the zipper is on the right side, i guess the manufacturer corrected it for the US market, great job! I bought this during Black Friday sale, so the value was even greater.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very impressed', 'author': 'NEWMANN HAYNES', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is very warm and comfortable and seems to be pretty durable so far good choice for the price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing bang for your buck', 'author': 'STAR_MUSIC', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Honestly was skeptical how can such a lower tier priced jacket be such good quality like other reviews said. I was literally going to Norway on a last minute trip, where it was -10 C (14 F) and left all my regular winter clothes at home.I did buy thermals as well, but this jacket was amazing. Kept me definitely warm for hours outside. Excellent even when snowing or on ice. The hoodie part protecting the face was very nice. Color scheme design looked awesome. Well done whoever made it. I just wish I had bought some gloves lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good jacket size Large', 'author': 'Dave Hollingworth', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Great for the price. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6‚Äù 170 lbs. I‚Äôll start with the positive: warm for sure, walk to work it‚Äôs been mid 20‚Äôs F, I like the material, lining is really nice inside and in the sleeves, kept me dry in a light rain haven‚Äôt been in a downpour yet. When you use the hood it‚Äôs nice, when the hood is back it just flops around so I take it off. The Velcro is good so far.Not a big deal but the zipper is on the left side.I don‚Äôt like the pockets! If you have long arms this might not be for you.Overall I like it and it‚Äôs a great price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good and Warm', 'author': 'David Brandon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Warm and fits well. Soft fuzzy liner.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars ‚ÄºÔ∏èAWESOME ‚ÄºÔ∏è', 'author': 'Edward N Noyes', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ridicules price and a whole lot of quality. Go a size bigger if you plan to layer up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Warm/Good Quality', 'author': 'David Goshien', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought this for my Artic gear needed for Alaska. Had a base layer and a hoodie with this jacket for outer layer and was warm in -20 weather. Good quality for the price and looks good. I am 5‚Äô9 and 175lbs and the Large fit perfect with base layer and was not bulky at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Even better than I had expected.', 'author': 'Wesley', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Don't usually write reviews, but this jacket has earned one. I haven\'t ordered one.. you\'d feel better if you bought this on sale. I\'d say the quality justifies the pricing? ... But come on, it\'s a nylon jacket. Maybe the brand justifies it? Levi is known for quality jean products, not flight jackets. Idk how much better the alpha industries jacket would be for $200 but it\'s an iconic brand that I\'d pay to collect one of their pieces.UPDATE: I ordered a alpha industries jacket and did a complete 180 on my opinion here. That jacket is AMAZING! I had this one exchanged for a "filled" red jacket to see if that\'s the difference but if it isn\'t then I\'m sending my Levi flight jacket back for 2 more alpha industries jackets. HOPEFULLY I don\'t "have" to spend that much and Levi will satisfy my taste but we\'ll see... Shame alpha doesn\'t have a red jacket like this though but the flight nylon (I had no clue what the difference was at first) is so soft and durable. The jacket doesn\'t make as much noise as this Levi jacket and I like to be "touchable", "embraceable". I don\'t want someone feeling uncomfortable when they hug me or embrace me, especially in these cold months coming up. I want my fabric to be alluring and addictive to the touch. title: Men's 13mwz Cowboy Cut Original Fit Jean
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my man's tush", 'author': 'Tonya Rush', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love seeing the wrangler patch on my man\'s tushy. These are the perfect fit for my 6\'8" man. Not only do I love them he loves the look and feel as well. Hes usually a levis man but i got him to try these and he liked them. Definitely great quality for a great price. Very rugged long lasting work jean but also great for everyday wear. Very comfortable jean...', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality & Durability', 'author': 'Catherine Arnette', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I buy these for my husband who has been wearing them for over 20 years,He likes the original cowboy bootcut,He doesn‚Äôt like pre washed,The color is a nice deep blue,the stitching is good he has never had any issues with that,They are of course very stiff I wash them once and they are softer but not much which is what he likes,He switched from Levi‚Äôs which he wore since he was a teenager mainly because of the price and quality,Wrangler‚Äôs fit him very well they are not to short in the crotch he is long waisted 6‚Äô2 I buy him 35x34‚Äôs and they‚Äôre a perfect fit they don‚Äôt shrink after washing and drying and the color holds up well but will start to fade eventually but that‚Äôs it they still hold up well with the stitching, I would and he says he would recommend the wranglers for durability 100%,I hope this helps anyone considering purchasing these,Like I said they are durable and the quality is good‚Ä¶When trying to add the size to the guide it wouldn‚Äôt let me but like I said my husband is 6‚Äô2 the guide wouldn‚Äôt let me go pass 5‚Äô4,He‚Äôs 225 lbs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Timeless Classic and Ultimate Comfort', 'author': 'Taten S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The Wrangler Men‚Äôs 13MWZ Cowboy Cut Original Fit Jean is an absolute masterpiece of denim craftsmanship. As a long-time fan of Wrangler jeans, I can confidently say that these jeans deserve every bit of their 5-star rating. Here's why I'm such a devoted fan:1. Classic Cowboy Cut: These jeans have that iconic cowboy cut that I've come to love. They provide ample room in the seat and thigh, making them incredibly comfortable and allowing for unrestricted movement.2. Legendary Durability: Wrangler is renowned for producing jeans that can withstand the test of time, and these are no exception. They're built to last and handle the rigors of both work and everyday wear.3. Authentic Style: The Cowboy Cut style exudes authenticity and timeless charm. Whether I'm wearing them for a casual day out or dressing them up a bit, they always look great.4. Comfortable Fit: The original fit is just right, offering comfort without being too loose or too tight. They feel comfortable all day long, whether I'm sitting at a desk or on horseback.5. Versatile Wardrobe Staple: These jeans are incredibly versatile and can be paired with a wide range of tops and shoes, making them a true wardrobe staple.6. Quality Denim: The denim used in these jeans is of exceptional quality. It's sturdy yet soft, and it breaks in beautifully over time, molding to my body for a personalized fit.7. Easy Care: They're easy to care for and maintain. They can handle regular washing without losing their shape or color.In summary, the Wrangler Men‚Äôs 13MWZ Cowboy Cut Original Fit Jean is a classic and timeless piece of Americana. It offers the perfect combination of style, comfort, and durability that Wrangler is known for. These jeans have been a part of my wardrobe for years, and they continue to impress me with their quality and performance. If you're in search of the perfect pair of jeans that can take you from work to play and everywhere in between, look no further. These jeans deserve every one of their 5 stars and are a true testament to Wrangler's legacy of excellence.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Jeans', 'author': 'Jimbo', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I just purchased more because they are like $8 cheaper than anywhere else. Wrangler has so many different styles and fits that you need to know what you need to get. Ok example Ariat M4 I wear 42x32, on cinch black label same 40x32. Wrangler 20x relaxed 40x32, on the wrangler 13MWZ pre-washed indigo, stoned washed tan and all other washes 44x32 these don‚Äôt shrink much. For the wrangler 13MWZ rigid indigo 46x32 they do shrink but not that much. So rigids after the initial treatment they shrink to a 45x31 the only thing if you know the original cowboy cut these are high rise jeans so they go higher up on the waist, the thighs are relaxed but not straight leg, they stack on boots(depending on the stack you want that is how long you get them) I do like stacked jeans but not a lot of material. Because of the larger size I get on these jeans the waist is fine, the length is fine but the thighs feel a little more loose, but I have tried the 44x32 and they feel tight after I shrink and break them in. They are easy to break in for the first wear, this is what I do. Flip the jeans inside out( this is the only way you should be washing jeans)I wash them on the heavy cycle with hot water, then dry them in dryer on hot cycle. Get them out throw them in the washer again same hot cycle, get them out dry again in hot cycle. The first two rounds no laundry detergent the 3 round I add detergent and a dryer sheet on the dryer, I don‚Äôt complete the last dryer cycle I take them out after 10 minutes and air dry them. After you do this they are way softer they have shrunk enough and fit way better. So if you want a tighter fit go with your regular size, if you like a little space go up one size. They will shrink just a bit more after that but it is not very noticeable. Ok now that they are ready, wear them a couple of times before you wash them again if they start to smell air them out. If you don‚Äôt stink them up go as many wears as you can. Next time you need to wash them flip them inside out zipped them up button them up throw them in the delicate cycle with cold water setting with very little detergent try not to use laundry softener. Take them out of washer and air dry them inside your house, try not to sun dry. If you need to use dryer on an emergency use the lowest setting possible. They last a while and better if you have several pairs on rotation I always have 5-6 pairs on rotation so they don‚Äôt get washed often once they need washing I get another 5-6 pairs an start rotation on those. I have pairs that are pretty old. You dye these pants if you need to but the natural worn use gives them personality.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Fit', 'author': 'David Brandon', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have other pairs of Wrangler jeans and they all last forever it seams. The fit is perfect and can feel the quality. Great price and better than Levi's.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Classics', 'author': 'Drake', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'An American classic, fits slightly slim on the hips and butt but with room for boots at the leg opening. These jeans are built to last and never go out of style.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars First time wearing Wrangler Cowboy Cut jeans', 'author': 'Josh', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've been losing quite a bit of weight lately and my old Duluth Trading jeans had gotten exceedingly large to the point where if I wore them with a belt (which was necessary) they'd look as if they were pleated.Growing up, my mom would never let me even consider Wrangler jeans, always ended up with Levis of one form or another. In my college years I liked the way Levi 501s looked with boots, but didn't like the way the waist sat on me - some no-mans-land between natural waist and hips.I got interested in Wranglers primarily because they did have such a high waist. Of course, the fact that I could buy two pair of the Cowboy Cut jeans for less than a single pair of Levi 501s was exceedingly attractive, especially since I'm still losing weight.They fit well, waist is more or less perfect, thighs are a bit tight, but that's to be expected with such a cut. Only issue is the inseam. All the pants I've ever worn since I was 18 have been with a 34 inseam. Usually they'll be a bit long with bare feet, but with boots, they'll break perfectly and won't bunch up. These are a bit longer and tend to bunch up just the slightest bit. They really oughtn't shrink, either, since they have been sanforized.The material on these is interesting. The Duluth Trading jeans I had been wearing for so long were made of 14.5oz denim. These Wranglers use significantly lighter denim, but it's strange, though. They're definitely thinner, but the material feels substantially denser than any other denim I've worn before. I did go ahead and order a pair of the Wrangler Premium Performance Cowboy Cut jeans to see how the heavier material would turn out. They feel well made and the material most assuredly feels strong and resilient enough.The positioning of the pockets is somewhat important to me. The back two pockets are marvelous, never had rear pockets up that high and it really does help when trying to get your wallet out while sitting down. Front pockets, I'm assuming are meant to be treated as they are on Levi 501s, more or less for aesthetics. I usually just carry my big ol' Samsung Galaxy S4 in the left pocket, forgo a pocket knife (wear one on my belt instead), then tuck my keys and a Zippo into the right pocket. Not an issue, really, they're not cargo pants after all.Even if they somehow turn out to only last me half a year or so, they're very affordable jeans. They're cut really well. My only wish would be to have them available in button fly, but that'd be too perfect.I think I'm somewhere between a 42 and 44 waist right now. I got the 44 on these, as I figured they'd fit tighter than most regular fit jeans. The waist is almost roomy, even after a few washes, but I'm glad I went with 44 because it fits perfectly at my hips and thighs. These things are straight as rails.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2014', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Paid the ‚ÄúNEW‚Äù price, received USED pants', 'author': 'BIG RED', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I paid full price for the 13MWZ pants, but received pants without any labels and packaged poorly in the clear and green ‚ÄúUSED/RETURNS‚Äù bag, with the LPN label that is used for ‚ÄúUSED/RETURNED‚Äù items. The pants are sized correct and fit as expected, but the warehouses need to stop shipping NOT NEW items in exchange for NEW ones, there is another section for those.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars What does original mean, just fit or quality too?', 'author': 'Mr. B', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Used to wear 13MWZs exclusively when I owned a ranch. This is the first pair I have bought in the last 20 years or so. What I like is that there has been no change in the color, comfort, style, denim weight or fit and finish of these jeans. Quality of fabrication (Mexico) is good. What I don't like is the denim seems to be woven less tight than it used to be. Will the denim be as durable as in the past? 13MWZ jeans used to be super-tough and took any chore you could throw at them from livestock handling to fencing. We'll see if my perception about the weave is correct but for now 4-stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars amazing.', 'author': 'Logan Oliver', 'rating': 5, 'content': "for anyone who says they are stiff just don't know anything about jeans. they will loosen up after wearing them a few times or after the first wash. overall they are a great pair of jeans and they look great with boots. you can feel the quality of these jeans but they are also comfortable enough to wear all day. would 100% get a second pair (and will be) and would definitely recommend these to a friend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Faux Leather Jacket with Removable Hood Motorcycle Jacket Casual Warm Winter Coat
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Do not get size based on height and weight alone', 'author': 'Austin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Let me start off by saying that this is a really nice jacket. The outer material is very soft for faux leather and the overall craftsmanship is very good. I do have a bit of a problem with the sizing however.Here\'s a bit of background for perspective. I\'m 5 foot 11 inches tall, weight 180 pounds, have a short torso, long legs, and a 34 inch waist, all on what is considered to be a small to medium body frame. In other words, I\'m fairly compact for my height and weight. This jacket in size large is way too big on me, though it fits most people of comparable height and weight just fine. For example, I have another coat that I typically layer a hoodie or sweater under, though it still fits well on its own. It is an American size small. This jacket can be worn over that coat and the layer under it while still allowing me to move effectively. The shoulders are too big causing the arms to hang lower and appear too long. The stretch band around the bottom of the jacket makes it want to sit at my waist, and combined with my short torso, causes the material in the midsection of the jacket to bunch up and puff out the back. Suffice it to say, this does not have the most "fitted" look on me.That being said, I have decided not to return the jacket. It fits great with layers under it, so I\'m just going to use this one as an overcoat. I am going to get a second one in size small, and update this review accordingly.If you want a fitted look, go with the size you typically get, otherwise, if you want a looser look or just to be sure it wont be too small, go at least one size up. This should be taken with a grain of salt though, as someone with wide shoulders or a long torso might have to go at least one size up just to get a good fit. In short; take all of your body\'s dimensions into consideration, not just height and weight.Update: My size small version came in, and it fits me much better than the large. The arm length is almost perfect and the bottom of the jacket sits just below my belt line. The stomach, back, and shoulders are all a good fit, with not much extra material hanging around. I have found that this jacket does have a design flaw, which is also shared by most other leather jackets. There is little to no extra material in the arm pit area, causing the jacket to pull up if you raise your arms above chest level. This is very common in jackets such as this, so it isn\'t a big deal, at least not to me.Ultimately, this is a very nice jacket, but the sizing can definitely make or break how it looks on you. My final advice to anyone reading this is; do not lie to yourself about your body. If you are a small person and you know it, just go with the size you know fits you best. Likewise, if you are a big person and you know it, go a size up just to be safe. To sum up everything I wrote here in one sentence; I thought I was a medium, so I bought a large, but it turned out that I am a small, and needed a small all along. Take care.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Looking Stylish Jacket, Exactly as Described!', 'author': 'Kevin Clay-EL', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this jacket a size larger than I actually could have,. In the winter months here in Chicago, I might opt to wear a hoodie or sweater underneath. It fits well with a hoodie top, sweat shirt, etc. Looks good, feels, good. Get one, you won't regret it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good-Great jacket with some caveats.', 'author': 'Randy Wilkinson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So this coat was a weird experience for me. I have been wanting to get a nice leather/faux leather jacket for a while and when this was on sale for Cyber Monday I decided to snag it. I got it for $42 instead of the normal $70, which plays into my rating here.1st of all I ordered the Black(heavy) version both because I thought it was the best looking one and because it was the only one on sale, but that IS NOT what I received. I received a Brown one (I think it is the coffee(heavy) one, but not sure). I was going to send it back but my wife said she thought the brown one looked really good on me and since it fits me well enough (always a concern when buying clothes you don't get to try on 1st) I decided to just let it be and keep the brown one. So my rating takes a bit of a hit there.As for fit, I was nervous just because of how inconsistently sized clothes tend to be online. I am 6' tall, about 250lbs with most of my extra size in my stomach/spare tire region. Generally speaking 2XL fits me just right but sometimes with outerwear it's good to buy 1 size up and based on some of the reviews I considered doing that here, but I'm glad that I didn't.The fit is a bit unique but not horrible. The sleeves are a couple inches longer than I expected (probably at least 3XL length) but that is fine because they stay in place with the fabric cuffs at the wrist. It fits just right and exactly as expected in the shoulders and upper chest. It is smaller/tighter than expected covering my stomach(closer to an XL size there). It could stand to be a couple inches longer as it fits just right length wise (again probably XL length) until you move around/bend over/reach up etc... overall the fit is very comfortable when unzipped, and not perfect but acceptable when zipped up.As for the quality it is better then expected for the $42 I paid for it, but would probably just as expecte if I paid the full $70. Sometimes these faux-leather materials can feel/look a bit too plasticky or shiny like vinyl, but this one does not. It's very nice and soft. There are a some loose dangling threads on the stitching which is disappointing but fixable. The 3 buttons that hold the head part of the hood in place seem a bit flimsy and like they aren't stitched into place very securely and after reading some of the other reviews I've come to the conclusion that I'll likely have to replace them eventually. My biggest from a quality perspective however is the zippers, they definitely feel like they are significantly lower quality than the rest of the jacket. I haven't had any problems with them yet but considering that they seem to be the most commonly cited problem in the reviews and the fact that they feel lightweight I'm very worried that they will break down the road, hopefully being extra careful with them will help.Overall I really like this coat a lot, it's comfortable, very warm, and it looks great. It loses 1 star because of getting sent the wrong color, the strange/inconsistent fit, and the poor quality zippers and buttons. None of those issues are bad enough on their own but all together they knock off a star. If you can get this coat on sale it is definitely worth it, but at full price I might look elsewhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fits perfect', 'author': 'LENNY A. RIVERA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This coat makes me look good üòäVery comfortable and warm..love the hood', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Anniversary Gift', 'author': 'Dani Lee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this for my husband for our anniversary. Absolutely LOVE it! Looks great! Great quality! Practical and comfortable (I wear it on occasion ‚ò∫Ô∏è). Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent purchase. Love it', 'author': 'Wesley Cowan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was worried from the price but ended up being the perfect jacket. Seems to be good for cool and cold. This will be my everyday jacket for all of fall and winter. Above expectations.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great jacket !', 'author': 'A.J  Austin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This jacket was perfect. Everything I was looking for. Style, color and warmth for those cold winter morning. Has 5 pockets that are big! Great jacket/Winter coat!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars One month in', 'author': 'Mkp58', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I like the jacket. It fits well cam change how I want looks good, but after only one month the "leather" is starting to come apart and strings are hanging off and getting caught. I suspect the zippers catching on the sleeves of both issues.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for the price', 'author': 'Danam0', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This jacket is stylish, comfortable, a good fit, and warm enough for mild (above freezing temperatures) winters.My only criticisms are that the faux leather outer layer only lasts for about 5 years and then starts peeling off in big pieces, and the buttons that hold the hood on started coming off and I had to sew them back on after about 4 winters of use.But for the low price, I can just buy a new one after five years or so, which is what I just did.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best fit I‚Äôve ever owned', 'author': 'Joe madure', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Feels great. Hot or cold keeps me right where I need to be. Covered and dry in the rain. It‚Äôs amazing.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Mens Jacket Winter Casual Fleece Lined Cotton Thick Military Tactical Hooded Work Coats with Cargo Pockets
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE THE FIT OF THIS COAT', 'author': 'Peasaint', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Live in New England, and my Justine jacket was shot. Went on Amazon, looked at 3 and decided on this one. I\'m very happy with it. That being said, onto the pros and cons.The Fit: I\'m 5\'5", 150 pounds. I didn\'t get much information from the reviews left on size, other than "180 pounds, the X-large fits great", etc. I\'m 5\'5" / 150 pounds, 68 years old with the obvious gain around my waist that comes with age, and a few too many beers. Nothing extreme, but I pondered between the small or medium. The size chart is correct, ... I ordered the \'small\', and it fits me perfectly. Sleeve length is perfect, back length is perfect, and I STILL have enough room to wear a sweater under the coat without any problem with movement. Standing upright, the bottom hem of this coat comes down to the end joints of my fingers when arms are by my side. The sleeve cuffs fall just below my wrist, no hindrance in getting into my pockets, ... coat or pants. The medium would have been way to big, cumbersome, and in the way for comfort.The PROS: It\'s warm, as is the collar and hood. Keeps the wind and rain out, and is repellant to showers. Not sure about a \'downpour\' however. The fleece lining is very soft and comfortable, and the weight of the coat itself, while heavier than a fiber filled parka, is very comfortable to wear, even when shopping for a period of time. The fabric is dense but flexible, not like wearing a cardboard box, this coat flexes with you, not against you.The coat buttons are decent, securely sewn in place. The zipper works perfectly, no indication of a "wrong way zipper", ... what\'s that about. The inside pocket is deep for a wallet, cellphone, etc.. The side pockets, ... front and side are deep. Might be a problem if one is wearing heavy gloves, otherwise not an issue. The top chest pockets are also a decent size for some extra cash, keys, container of meds and such.I\'ve not found any reason to shoot this coat out of the running, ... but I\'ll offer some attempts.CONS: The waist draw sting could be of a stronger material, ... and the leather \'belt stops\' could be of a locking type of bead, the little leather stop are more to keep the waist draw from moving into the coat. So far, ... that\'s it. I love this coatIf I find some issues pro or con, ... I\'ll update this review.01/20/2024 UPDATE:In temps 35-f and under, ... One really needs a good sweater under this coat. The added warmth will be needed. That aside, this is still a wonderful coat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Incredible', 'author': 'Jim Ed', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted a military style jacket and I spent a great deal of time looking.I stumbled upon this brand and after reading all the great reviews I decided to give it a try. I wear a XXL and I ordered a XXXL because it‚Äôs a coat and you want it a size up and I‚Äôm glad cause it fits me so well. From the moment I opened the package I could feel the weight. This jacket is the best jacket I‚Äôve ever had and the price is amazing. I was just outside where it‚Äôs 4degrees and below zero windchill. I can‚Äôt believe how warm and comfortable this jacket feels. I‚Äôve had several Carheart jackets and they aren‚Äôt as warm. It breathes and I don‚Äôt sweat. Listen, I don‚Äôt make reviews but I feel compelled to share so you won‚Äôt have to spend hours looking for the right one. I‚Äôm thinking of buying another one in black. I give it a solid 5 stars.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Dr.Cyril Mens winter jacket, Fleece Lined', 'author': 'Sandy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The first one I ordered was a large, perfect fit, but no room for layering. Returned, no problem with returns, very easy. Reordered in extra large. Sleeves were a little long, but workable. Now I have room to layer. I live in Pennsylvania, can get down to 20's or teens. I disagree with reviews on how warm this coat is. 35* down you will need to start layering, so buy, at least, one size up. The coat is very well made, great colors, and the zippers work very well. Krigel', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'I ordered a medium. All my clothes are a classic medium size... This item runs a little oversized. I ordered a small to see if it fits better.(see below)The zipper on the medium is on the correct side (right side)There is a stamped label in the a back of the jacket, not a sewn label:"MMade in China"Is all it says.No manufacturer is named.The hood on the medium sized jacket is larger than usual, necessitating tightening the drawstrings, which then look silly bulging from around the face. Note that the model is not shown with the hood worn.Delivery of the medium jacket was prompt.The small sized jacket fits better, though using the thumb-holes does pull the sleeves tighter than preferred.The zipper is on the wrong side (left, the lady convention)There is no size nor manufacturer name sewn into the jacket, nor any stamp attesting to size or manufacturer.The finish of one sleeve where it connects to the body of the jacket left a "pill".Delivery of the small jacket was extended.The cleaning/washing instructions on the two jackets is different, in common: machine wash, do not bleach. Either tumble dry (small sized jacket), or machine dry at low temperature and iron (medium sized jacket)The large sized jacket details the material as 90% polyester, 10% Elastane.The small sized jacket does not specify the material.Should I trust the jacket to last a year?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Material', 'author': 'nini', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My husband love the hoody. title: Men's Packable Rainfoil Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great purchase', 'author': 'KB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This jacket works really well and for the price it's a no-brainer. It's lightweight, but actually keeps you dry, unlike other lightweight jackets that claim to be raincoats but are really just windbreakers. Fits true to size and is a good shell that can fit layers underneath. I bought this because I had previously purchased the Marmot Precip jacket from here, looking for a quality lightweight raincoat. But like other people have stated, it doesn't take very long at all for the inner lining of the Marmot Precip to start to disintegrate and flake off. I don't know if it's just poorly made, which seems weird for a Marmot product, or if it's a counterfeit? This Eddie Bauer jacket has a mesh lining and you can tell it's way better quality than the Marmot. If you're looking for a good raincoat that is affordable, built well and is genuine (Eddie Bauer is the listed seller) then you can't do much better than this one.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good sleeve length', 'author': 'granger', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 6\'2" and 170 lbs with 35 inch arms. The medium fits very nicely. It\'s a quality jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit and design', 'author': 'colavecd', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought the indigo blue, not as dark as navy but close. A size Large for 5'10' @ 185 pounds provides ample room for a sweatshirt under, if needed, as well as a nice fit without layering. Water repellency was awesome. Preferring a packable hood, EB came to the rescue. Easily stores away when not raining, as this makes a great wind breaker jacket as well. Fabric is a bit heavier than some, but lends itself to a small packed parcel for luggage. No underarm vents, which might have been an added asset. However, very pleased with purchase.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice, size chart correct, nice look', 'author': 'Gary', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was worried if would fit. Size chart worked. Fit perfect. I\'m 5\'7" 165lbs. Ordered lg. Reg. Room for layers underneath. All velcro stitching perfect. No loose threads. Zippers smooth, hood is large enough to fit completely over ball type cap, including brim. Also big enough to not be pulling on the back behind shoulders like many do. So can freely turn head unrestricted. Totally comfortable. Still waiting for rain to test but all other reviews say excellent water proofing which I believe will be true. Length is right to bottom edge of butt. Sleeve length perfect. Can stretch out arm and cuff is still at wrist as should be. Highly recommend buying this jacket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very nice rain jacket', 'author': 'D. Minnit', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a nice, lightweight rain jacket, and truly waterproof. It is not warm, so be sure to size up and leave room for layers. The gold color is beautiful, not too yellow. Sleeves are too long, otherwise, fit is good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality', 'author': 'Reba', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Hubby picked out. Good quality fabric and folds easily into packable pocket.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars keeps you dry and packs light & small.', 'author': 'boomvang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I purchased this because of the Eddie Bauer name and good reviews. Also I liked the stow away hood that most do not have. The stow away makes it look more like a jacket than a raincoat, so it looks better doing double duty on a trip. The fit was great. The only complaint was that it does not breathe so well. But realistically to get a waterproof jacket that breathes really well you need to spend another $100. So for the money it is a really good value. FYI it self packs in one of its pockets.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 23, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Lighter than most Eddie Bauer Jackets', 'author': 'gy williams', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased as a gift for my son, after looking endlessly for a lightweight rain jacket. I wanted only Eddie Bauer because their quality is guaranteed, and many of their jackets can be folded and therefore easy for packing when traveling--like this one. Oddly enough, this jacket is quite similar to another gray one that my son owns, from Eddie Bauer, but this blue one here is lighter in weight. (A bit tricky to the eye--one must examine each coat (the gray and blue one) side by side to make the distinctions in the weight of the fabric.)I still think that this blue one, though advertised as lightweight would be too heavy for an area where the humidity is thick and high, such as the Southern areas of the East coast. Definitely waterproof, thus great for those areas where the rain could be consistent throughout the day. Great pockets, as advertised, I mean the pockets are handy and practical.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Faulty Zipper', 'author': 'gary Hole', 'rating': 2, 'content': "Overall the coat was all that was expected from Eddie Bauer. Although the zipper is malfunctioning. It is a small low quality YKK zipper. It is not because it is too small. I buy my outdoor coats on the large and loose size. I have only had the jacket for a couple of months and have only used it for riding my bike about 6 times. Recently, each time I use it the zipper separates from the bottom with little to no exertion. Again, only going on a bike ride. I have had other coats do this with the zipper teeth this size, but only after years of normal use.I have bought Eddie Bauer products for over 40 years. The quality has always been flawless. I seldom complain about a product unless its truly a problem I can't fix.'When I needed to see about replacing with a new jacket, it was out of the Amazon return policy. Thus I contacted Eddie Bauer directly. What saddens me is that I got a paperwork run around. No matter what paperwork I sent them on proving when and where I bought the product, they just gave me excuses that they needed more, right down to the original sales receipt, amazon order number, pictures, and emails. I finally gave up. I don‚Äôt expect any product to always be perfect. But when a company like Eddie Bauer that claims quality as they used to, now makes it hard to return and replace, I lose my respect quickly.So now, I will go to REI, Carhartt or LL Bean. I know they all still back their products from personal experience and the quality is still there.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Size', 'author': 'K', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I returned it. Size is bigger than I thought.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Smooth Leather Moto Jacket
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality Lambskin Leather Jacket', 'author': 'Gregory M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very soft leather with nice cut for medium build men. Love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A looker, but not the best doer...', 'author': 'Eric Bergfield', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This jacket looks great, and fit my body type perfectly! Sooooo, don't expect this to keep you warm if the weather is uncomfortably cold outside. With that said, I think it is overpriced by quite a lot, and would NOT recommend buying it at full price.In summation: looks great, functions averagely.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 17, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The jacke is very nice, exactly what expected.The only problem is the size.', 'author': 'kaugur', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'As I already mentioned , I love this jacket. The only problem is me, not the jacket: since March 2021 (my weight -208lb)-through today, October 8,2029my weight (176lb) I have Lost 32 lb.Of course , XXL is very big,and I really do not know what to -How to Exchange to XL the same Designer Cole Haan.Please Help me how to exchange this jacket.Thank you very much,Anatoly Shakevich.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great looking jacket, quality may be questionable', 'author': 'thundercleese', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'First impression: Fits perfectly and the leather feels great. I get many compliments when I wear this. The only minor gripe is that the liner builds up static frequently.Editing this review now that I‚Äôve had it for about 2 weeks. I‚Äôve now worn this jacket 5 times. Already the hanging loop has detached on one side. I‚Äôve never hung it or even picket it up by that loop. It was so poorly attached it just fell off on its own.I really don‚Äôt want to return this jacket because I really love the style and how it fits me. But if anything more happens soon, I will have to or end up having wasted my money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The real one from amazon is nice, but the third party fake sucks.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I ordered two sizes. The first size, a medium, fit my 6'0 175 frame a little large in the waist, but it was spot on in the chest. I am a normally a 40R in jackets, so I was satisfied there. However, like I said, it was baggy in the waist, so I returned it. I should mention at this point that the first size (medium) was sold and fulfilled by amazon. This product was clearly authentic. The second size I ordered was a small. It was sold by the 3rd party retailer leather hub. It arrived 4 days shy of a month later than the last day of the estimated arrival date (original order placed 11/1/16, arrived 12/17/16). It was sold by the third party retailer leather hub, and is clearly not authentic. The leather feels cheap and plastic in contrast to the smooth soft lambskin of the real version that arrived first. The second one did not have tags or a hanger (unlike the first one), and the quality of construction is awful. There are missed stitches everywhere, and the it is completely different from the first. It is clearly a fake. All in all, I am highly unsatisfied with the purchase, first because it is too loose in the waist, and second because amazon let a 3rd party retailer scam me. I am waiting on a return now. If I don't receive it within 2 days, I will have to do a charge back on my credit card.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2016', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'All I can say is the it‚Äôs a very nice and elegant leather jacket!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It looks like there are a lot of fakes going around', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It looks like there are a lot of fakes going around. I guess I got lucky by buying directly from Amazon, and at a steal for $129.99 (I guess they were matching Nordstrom because they had it for the same price on clearance or a sale) for the large a few days ago. Quality is superb and on par with a few others I have. Beautiful jacket, almost a very dark espresso instead of black but that's alright. Construction is fantastic and the deal couldn't be better on this authentic jacket. Hopefully Amazon is able to nab the third-party sellers selling fakes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This jacket is a great deal for the price', 'author': 'mikado89', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This jacket is a great deal for the price. I saw it at Saks for nearly $500. I usually wear an XL, but had tried on a Cole Haan XXL at a department store and found it fit me well, so I ordered that instead.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2017', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Marathon Jacket 3-stripes
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great running jacket', 'author': 'Tim M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I\'m 6\'4" and 165 pounds and I order both the large and the medium. The large was a bit too bulky and wide on the shoulders. The medium fit perfectly. As other reviewers have said, the sleeves are long, which is perfect for me being rather tall. The cinch around the waste is great too. The jacket is thin and light weight, but effective at blocking the wind. It\'s perfect for an extra layer while running. It also looks really good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just as expected.', 'author': 'Jose Alejandro', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm 5'9 and 155 lbs and size S fits great. It's very comfy for running.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable Cold-Weather Running Companion', 'author': 'Slade', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The adidas Men's Marathon Jacket 3-stripes has become my go-to companion for cold-weather runs, especially in 40¬∞F temperatures. Here's a breakdown of my experience:Pros:Excellent Warmth: This jacket excels in keeping me warm during chilly runs. The insulation is sufficient for 40¬∞F weather, providing the right balance of warmth without causing overheating during intense runs.Lightweight Design: The jacket's lightweight construction is a standout feature, ensuring that it doesn't weigh me down during runs. It strikes a perfect balance between insulation and mobility, making it ideal for both casual jogs and more intense workouts.Affordable Price: One of the most attractive aspects is the affordability. Despite its high-quality performance, the Marathon Jacket is reasonably priced, making it an excellent value for runners on a budget.Cons:None worth mentioning.Recommendation:If you're looking for a reliable, lightweight, and budget-friendly jacket for running in colder weather, the adidas Marathon Jacket is an excellent investment. It strikes the perfect balance between warmth and mobility, making it a top choice for runners of all levels.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Well constructed but a little small for the stated size', 'author': 'Scott Radeker', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love the color, love the design and the construction. It runs a little small ‚Äî FYI.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Probably The Best Lightweight Jacket I Own', 'author': 'Hyoun Kim', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have another Adidas jacket similar to this, but it's black and no pockets with a hood. I keep that next to my front door to grab when I go in and out and need a light jacket.I've ran into some situations thought that I needed my light jacket but I didn't grab it on the way out. So I got this one to keep in my car. It's not 100% waterproof but is good enough to keep you dry if you're out in the rain in a short period of time. It's also good for when it's windy and/or slightly chilly outside. I play ice hockey and so does my son. The rink does get cold and I throw this on while I'm in there and it's much more convenient than a blanket.I love this jacket. It looks good and it's Adidas!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT PURCHASE', 'author': 'Andre Chotoosingh', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this jacket (actually two of them) for the spring and fall weather. I wanted something light and breathable, yet not bulky. These are perfect. They‚Äôre very thin, so you don‚Äôt actually get hot, but it blocks the cool air from making you cold when you go from the indoors to outside and you‚Äôre still sweaty.I especially like them for running on chilly mornings when you start of cool but later, you want to shed a few layers when your core warms up. I can just ball it up in my hand or put it in my pocket and continue my run. The zipper handle is a bit small, but the benefit is that it makes it streamlined.The arm length is a bit longer than normal, but it‚Äôs a welcomed length when you reach out or extend your body. You can tell it was deliberately done.I‚Äôm a litter over 5‚Äô10‚Äù and I weigh about 190ish right now. I‚Äôm not bulky or muscular, but not skinny. This is designed for a slim person, in my opinion.Worth the buy, worth the price.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice Comfortable Jacket', 'author': 'JD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great material, Fits true to size.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed', 'author': 'K & P', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Adidas Men's Marathon Jacket was everything I wanted. I was well constructed , light weight, the right color and great price. It was not a XLarge jacket. It was poorly sized. The shoulders were too narrow. I did not return this item. I gave it to a smaller friend who was very pleased with it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for slightly windy day.', 'author': 'Sandeep chakroborthy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Received the product as shown. Fits perfectly. You can wear it to the beach or while cycling , roller-blading or running.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Husband love', 'author': 'Tomeka Grant', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for my husband and he loves it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Men's Alsek Jacket - Softshell Jacket, Lightweight & Water-Resistant for Layering on the Trail
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A great light weight jacket', 'author': 'Popmahn', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Do NOT expect the jacket to be thick and warm. This is a light weight jacket, with a thin soft inner fleece (?) layer inside. I was pleasantly surprised that the seams are taped. I find the wind and water resistance to be good; keep in mind this is a softshell jacket (not a hardshell jacket), so do not expect it to be 100% water/wind proof. Also, the fit of the jacket is on the "sporty" side; if you have a big belly, the waist area of the jacket might feel tight. Overall, I am very happy with the jacket, and I primarily use it at the start of morning spring/autumn hikes.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Cheap feeling jacket', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This jacket is not at all the quality of my 20 year old Marmot jacket. It is thin, uncomfortable and the arms actually crinkle like plastic when you move. Also, as others have said the collar is way too tall - I tried it on for 10 seconds and immediatly took it off and returned it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic light weight jacket', 'author': 'David F.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I needed something to transition from fall and spring. This jacket covers all the bases for me-light weight, rain resistant with taped seams and wind proof. It has large zippered side pockets and a smaller zippered inner chest pocket suitable for a smartphone. I have found it perfect for 65¬∞F down to 45¬∞F. It is not baggy, i.e., is trim fit; therefore, is not suitable for thick layers of clothing beneath. Marmot clothing has a lifetime guarantee against defects in materials, which I find reassuring.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars New & improved', 'author': 'Chainsaw 2', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Fits just like the old one but with a better outside material.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Marmot changed the style for the worse', 'author': 'zoran', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I have been buying and using nearly exclusively marmot jackets for last 15 years. This is the first jacket that I don't even know if I can use - and only because of (huge) oversized collars. If you look at the product photos, it looks as if its normal collar size but this person must have very long neck. Even worse, they did not make a photo of the unzipped jacket because it just doesn't look good with oversized collars. They are TWICE as large as any other of the 5-6 jackets in the same size I had over the years (e.g. Marmot Approach or Marmot Gravity).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Too light bad fit', 'author': 'Camera', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Not like the marmot gravity jacket so don‚Äôt think this is a replacement', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': 'Off', 'author': 'Cris', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Had high hopes for this jacket. Despite checking multiple size guides it was too tight in the shoulders. And that collar.. what was the designer thinking?? Not like in the pictures at all. Had to return and chose a Sch√∂ffel Avdalen which is just wow. Such a good cut', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in Germany May 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]
